story:
Short Summary

My names is Elizabeth Short, my husband Peter Short died in 2014 from complications that arose from oesophageal cancer that had metastasised into his lungs. 

Peter was the CEO of Coles Express in Australia, and through the connections he made, he was able to obtain the illegal drug Nembutal which gave him peace of mind, knowing he had control over the end of his life. Peter in the final months of his life became a vocal advocate for changing the law so that all Australians with a terminal illness or incurable suffering could have the choice to end their own life, should their suffering and quality of life become unbearable.

Peter’s journey was widely covered in the media and in the documentary film, Fade to Black which is currently being released in theatres across Australia through Demand Film.

It was Peter’s dying wish that assisted dying laws would become legal in Australia. The state of Victoria will vote on a safe and sensible assisted dying bill during September this year. This legislation has a good chance of being written into law, and will set a precedence for other states to follow.

According to all surveys on this issue, more than 80% of Australians want these laws passed. More than 70% of Australian Christians want to see assisted dying laws passed.

But, there is a vocal minority of pro-suffering, religious extremists who are doing everything in their power to convince Victorians and our politicians to vote against Assisted Dying. These groups include the Catholic Church, Right to Life, HOPE and the Australian Christian Lobby. 

These groups are running a campaign of lies, deception, mis-information, baseless made up facts and made up stories to trick people into standing against a compassionate assisted dying law.

 

What We Need 

We’ve decided it’s time to expose the dishonesty of these religious extremists in a video we’ve made that we need to raise funding for, so that we can literally get it into the hands of every Victorian politician ahead of the vote in September.

We are looking to raise a minimum of $5,000 so that we can manufacture 150 video brochures that will be delivered to every member of the Victorian Legislative Council and Legislative Assembly. Every video brochure is like a greeting card, except it has a 4.3" video screen and speaker embedded into the card and will play our video.

 

The Impact

We hope that when we deliver this video to politicians, it will help create context around the fear-mongering and scare campaign that's being propagated by religious extremists and will equip politicians to ignore unfounded claims when they are bombarded by targeted extremist lobbying efforts.

We also hope to raise more than $5,000 so that we can invest money in promoting the video through Facebook. We will urge every Victorian who watches this video on Facebook to reach out to their politician to say that assisted dying is an issue they care about want to see legalised.

 

Risks & Challenges

We only have a short period of time to get the video brochures manufactured before the assisted dying bill comes up for a vote in September. We've already created the video and have everything ready to send to the factory so that we will have the brochures in our hands by the last week of August.

If we don't raise enough money to pay for all of the video brochures, then we will adjust our spend to Facebook and/or a limited amount of brochures that will go to politicians who are undecided on the issue.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate money to our campaign, please help promote our Indiegogo campaign to friends, family, colleagues and by sharing our page on all of your social media channels.

story:
Diolch / Thank you

I'r rheiny a gyfrannodd at ein hymgyrch codi arian y llynedd, hoffem ddiolch o waelod calon i chi am eich caredigrwydd. Mae eich haelioni wedi cyfrannu at flwyddyn lwyddiannus iawn yn hanes y mudiad, ac rydym yn awyddus i sicrhau bod ein gweithgarwch yn parhau i gynyddu.

Sincere thanks to all who supported our fundraising campaign last year. Your generosity played a large part in what has been a highly successful year for the movement, and we're determined to ensure that our activity continues to grow. 

Ein bwriad / Our aim

Ein bwriad yw archebu rhagor o'r nwyddau a gynhyrchwyd gennym y llynedd (hynny yw, crysau-T, pamffledi, sticeri a matiau cwrw). Rydym hefyd yn awyddus i gynhyrchu nwyddau newydd er mwyn hyrwyddo negeseuon mwy cyfredol. Yn ogystal, hoffem greu pecynnau i gefnogi canghennau newydd o Plaid Ifanc sydd wedi'u sefydlu'n ddiweddar mewn amrywiol ardaloedd ledled Cymru. Bydd y pecynnau hyn yn yn cynnwys adnoddau a nwyddau i hyrwyddo neges y mudiad mewn ardaloedd lleol ac i roi'r canghennau newydd ar ben ffordd.

Our aim is to replenish our stock of merchandise created last year (namely T-shirts, pamphlets, stickers and beer mats). We would also like to design and create new merchandise in order to promote a more current message. We'd also like to create guidance packs to support the new branches of Plaid Ifanc that have been established in recent months across Wales. These packs will include resources and merchandise to promote our message as a movement in local areas and to give these new branches some initial guidance.

Yr hyn sydd ei angen arnom / What we need

Mae'r gost o gyfrannu at gynhadledd ffeministaidd lwyddiannus dros ben (ar y cyd â EFAy a Centre Maurits Coppieters) ym mis Mehefin wedi ein gadael braidd yn brin...! Rydym hefyd yn fudiad eithaf bach, sy'n dibynnu ar y cyfan ar garedigrwydd aelodau "llai ifanc" o Blaid Cymru i'n hariannu. Y gobaith yw codi rhyw £500 i ariannu ein costau cynhyrchu dros y misoedd nesaf. Bydd y nwyddau hyn ar gael i ni eu dosbarthu drwy gydol y flwyddyn sydd i ddod. Rydym, wrth reswm, yn gwerthfawrogi pob rhodd.

Plaid Ifanc recently contributed financially to the highly successful feminism conference in Cardiff (held in conjunction with EFAy and Centre Maurits Coppieters). This cost has left us a little low on funds....! We're a relatively small movement, and we depend on the "less young" members of Plaid Cymru for a large amount of our funding. We hope to raise £500 to fund our design and promotion costs over the next few months. We will be distributing these items for the rest of the year. Naturally, we appreciate every contribution. 

Eich effaith / Your impact

Mewn cyfnod cythryblus fel hwn, mae gwaith mudiad fel Plaid Ifanc yn fwy perthnasol nag erioed o'r blaen. Rydym yn ymdrechu i adeiladu mudiad ieuenctid sy'n ceisio gwneud y frwydr dros ryddid yn berthnasol ac yn ddeniadol i bobl ifanc Cymru heddiw. Mae Plaid Ifanc ei hun hefyd wedi cael blwyddyn lwyddiannus dros ben - daeth dros 50 o bobl ifanc i'n cynhadledd flynyddol eleni, ac rydym yn benderfynol ein bod yn mynd i gynnal y momentwm dros y misoedd nesaf. Byddai eich rhodd, beth bynnag fo'i faint, yn ein cynorthwyo i gryfhau elfen hanfodol o'r mudiad cenedlaethol. Diolch yn fawr am eich cefnogaeth!

In such difficult and turbulent times, we believe that Plaid Ifanc's message and contribution is more important than ever. We strive to build a youth movement that makes the fight for national liberation relevant and attractive to young people today. The past year has also been a highly successful one for Plaid Ifanc - more than 50 young people attended our annual conference this year, and we're determined to maintain this momentum over the coming months. Your donation, however large or small, would help us to strengthen a crucial element of the national movement. Thanks for your support!

story:
Since the election of Trump there has been a dramatic rise in violent attacks against minority and oppressed groups. Rather than give in to fear or turn to leaders who promise power, we believe that people should protect each other and organize their lives together. Haymaker will be a center for Popular Fitness & Self-Defense, bringing free martial arts and self-defense training to Chicago . We envision a space where people, regardless of ability, can learn the skills they need to stay safe in Trump’s America. We envision a new culture of fitness based on solidarity and mutual-aid. We not only want to improve ourselves, but help create a new world along the way.

Help us open our doors to every person who wants to stand up for the fight ahead!

As organizers, we believe in Autonomy, Strength, and Solidarity. Because we believe in autonomy, we know that we must learn to fight our enemies without relying on institutions that disempower us and macho gym cultures that weaken us. We must learn to fight for ourselves. Because we believe in strength, we know that we must be stronger than those who want us to suffer or wipe us out completely. We must learn to be unafraid as we become a force capable not only of self-defense, but of social transformation. Because we believe in solidarity, we know that our personal transformation is at once collective transformation and that an injury to one is indeed an injury to all. We will learn how to keep each other safe as we become dangerous together. 

Martial arts gyms are expensive. Here's a break down of all our projected costs so you know where your money is going.

Martial Arts Equipment:

  • Gloves: $20~ each [10 pairs, $150-200]
  • Heavy Bags: $50~ each [5 bags, $200-250]
  • Heavy Bag Stands: $20-100 each [depending on free-standing or wall-mounted; 5 for $300-500]
  • Speed Bags: $20-50 each [depending on mounting options; 2 for$50-80]
  • Timing Bags: $20-50 each [2 for $50-80]
  • Headgear: $10-30 each [5 sets, $100]

Protective Flooring: 

  • Interlocking Foam, 1" Thick: $2/sq ft [400 sq ft, $800]
  • 2" Thick Folding Panel: $2.5/sq ft [400 sq ft, $1000]

Workout Machines:

  • Rowing Machine: $200-800 each
  • Treadmill: $200-600 each
  • Misc. Other Machines, "All-In-One" Machines: $200-600 each
  • WEIGHTS: $300-500 [full set of dumbbells, barbells, one or two benches]

Rent:

  • $ 2000 / month.
  • $24,000 / year

Trainers:

  • $15 / hour 
  • 20 hours / week x 52 weeks = $15,600

Insurance:

  • $1000 / year

Bottomline: $46,110 per year operating costs.

If we reach our goal, we will be able to run the gym at absolutely zero costs for the first year. This will allow us ample time to build a base of sustaining donors who will help the space run indefinitely into the future.

“How much of the money raised will go directly to funding Haymaker: Popular Fitness and Self-Defense?”

Besides the small percentage taken by IndieGoGo, every single dollar will go immediately toward the physical space, weight lifting equipment, a boxing ring, and paying our wonderful trainers. No money goes toward our 501c(3) non-profit.

“Is Haymaker: Popular Fitness and Self-Defense really going to be free?”

Yes! While we will accept donations for participating in training, nobody will be turned away at the door for lack of funds. We firmly believe self-defense training is a human right, not a commodity reserved for the rich.

“What is Breakaway Autonomous Social Center?”

We are a non-profit organization based in Chicago. We exist to help legally run non-profit projects like Haymaker: Popular Fitness and Self-Defense. Our other projects include the Breakaway Autonomous Social Center which hosts a variety of events and serves as a meeting place for progressive activists on the Southwest Side of Chicago. We see the current political climate as one of ethical bankruptcy and of the same uninspiring political routines being played on repeat. We pose a new politics. HAYMAKER is a crucial aspect of our vision.

“What if you don’t meet your goals? Can the project be funded without meeting your immediate goal?”

Yes! We will still be able to move ahead with the project, however, we will have to do so in an abbreviated form. With less than $50,000, we will not be able to purchase equipment or rent a space with the full range of amenities necessary for a gym. Nevertheless, we have existing space and martial arts can be taught without equipment — we want the best facilities because people deserve to be able to defend themselves!

$25 zine bundle!

 

$75 T-Shirt + zine bundle!

 

$100 Anti-Fascist Poster Art!

 

$200 Custom Yoga Mat!

$300 track jacket! (2 possible designs)

 

$500 Boxing Gloves!

 

$1000 Speaking event / self-defense class

story:
We say NO to youth recruitment in Colombia

New hope for young Colombian victims

Why help us?

We are youths compromised with our country, with our fellow youth compatriots, with the peace of our lands and, above all, with the radical termination of infant recruitment for war. Helping us means giving an opportunity to one young Colombian to realize there is another path to achieve their goals away from guns and bullets. 

About Us

In 1997, five teenagers caught on to the idea that it was only us, young Colombians, who had to change in order to change the country for we are, at the same time, both the present and future of the nation. This idea became the core of the social project TIERRA NATIVA EXPEDICIONES, which aims to transform the way young people live and perceive their own country as well as to minimize the gap between rural and urban realities, vis-à-vis a unified nation. With this conviction set in deep in our souls, not even the violence perpetrated in 2000 stopped us from our goal: to conquer by road and river North, East, South, and West of the country, in kayaks and bicycles, covering 6,500 km and taking one simple message of hope to 80 rural communities: “We in the cities have not abandoned you”.

TIERRA NATIVA belongs to la Asociación Santa Cruz, an organization that impacts 4,000 youth per year since 1993. Its aim is to assist the progress of learning while nourishing life values through experiential education, via a methodology that takes advantage of emotions and self experience to generate reflections that lead to lasting knowledge. This year our expedition will take us to La Macarena, a territory that is, at the same time, well known for its natural beauty and for the violence thereabouts once exerted by the guerrillas.

We think that the current context, the peace agreement, calls for the reconstruction of communities affected by the conflict. Reconstruction which should be led by the local youth. Thus, we have already traveled twice to La Macarena to meet the 20 teenagers with whom we attended a British Council workshop in July. Since then, we have kept in contact to monitor the project. In January 2019, we will be back and, with the help of our bikes, we will all train in life values, teamwork skills, and leadership so that later, in the near future, they keep on leading, without our help, their own rural community.

At TIERRA NATIVA we hold on to our motto:

 

 

Budget:

  • Board and Lodging. We estimate US $3,000 to accommodate staff and participants at La Macarena for the duration of the expedition. (20 – 30 persons approx.)
  • Soft drinks and refreshments. US $1,000 to supply the liquids and calories necessary for the team’s exertions. (It can get very hot and dry… or hot, humid, and rainy).
  • Transport and security. We estimate US $4,000 in transport costs to and from La Macarena, plus the help of two security cars during rides to minimize the risk of accidents with other vehicles among the pack of riders.
  • Cycling gear. US $3,000 to cover for the relevant sport and safety gear: bicycles to rent plus proper helmets, gloves, uniforms. We have in mind the fact that most La Macarena's young participants can’t afford the latter.  
  • US $2.000 For proper overall insurance against accident or any other calamitous eventuality.

 

Risks

Due to the context  a working project in the region implies a series of risks for our participants and volunteers. Moreover, outdoor activities with large groups include the possibility of accidents, illness, allergies, and other unexpected inconveniences.

Thus, Tierra Nativa is well aware of the preparations needed to face all kinds of risks. For this reason, different preventive measures to ensure the wellbeing of staff and participants were taken.

  • Health and Safety: All volunteers will receive first aid training and search and rescue courses. Furthermore, there will be a permanent team in charge of prevention and attention of accidents and ailments. A medical doctor plus two qualified members of staff will be in charge of the team.
  • Security protocols were drawn from a well of twenty years’ experience with the help of experts in physical and environmental risk management.
  • Mental and emotional health: a volunteer psychologist will be in charge of the participants and staff’s wellbeing. The staff includes people qualified in mental health and emotional first response.
  • Counseling: Tierra Nativa will make previous contact and arrangements with the local authorities and entities in charge of security in the area, id est, City Halls, Police Forces, Army, Red Cross, and the relevant fire departments and hospitals.
  • Resources: Tierra Nativa has its own emergency equipment to face any kind of situation. It includes two first aid kits, basic medicines, a stretcher, anti-ophidic serum, cycling kits, and security vehicles.
  • Pre-expedition: In preparation for the expedition, a group of volunteers will travel to the area to recognize the territory, the routes, and the people with whom they will be working during the expedition.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can not help us financially, you can help us by spreading this project with your friends and family. Making some noise about our campaign.

Thank you!
story_txt:
We say NO to youth recruitment in ColombiaNew hope for young Colombian victimsWhy help us?We are youths compromised with our country, with our fellow youth compatriots, with the peace of our lands and, above all, with the radical termination of infant recruitment for war. Helping us means giving an opportunity to one young Colombian to realize there is another path to achieve their goals away from guns and bullets. About UsIn 1997, five teenagers caught on to the idea that it was only us, young Colombians, who had to change in order to change the country for we are, at the same time, both the present and future of the nation. This idea became the core of the social project TIERRA NATIVA EXPEDICIONES, which aims to transform the way young people live and perceive their own country as well as to minimize the gap between rural and urban realities, vis-à-vis a unified nation. With this conviction set in deep in our souls, not even the violence perpetrated in 2000 stopped us from our goal: to conquer by road and river North, East, South, and West of the country, in kayaks and bicycles, covering 6,500 km and taking one simple message of hope to 80 rural communities: “We in the cities have not abandoned you”.TIERRA NATIVA belongs to la Asociación Santa Cruz, an organization that impacts 4,000 youth per year since 1993. Its aim is to assist the progress of learning while nourishing life values through experiential education, via a methodology that takes advantage of emotions and self experience to generate reflections that lead to lasting knowledge. This year our expedition will take us to La Macarena, a territory that is, at the same time, well known for its natural beauty and for the violence thereabouts once exerted by the guerrillas.We think that the current context, the peace agreement, calls for the reconstruction of communities affected by the conflict. Reconstruction which should be led by the local youth. Thus, we have already traveled twice to La Macarena to meet the 20 teenagers with whom we attended a British Council workshop in July. Since then, we have kept in contact to monitor the project. In January 2019, we will be back and, with the help of our bikes, we will all train in life values, teamwork skills, and leadership so that later, in the near future, they keep on leading, without our help, their own rural community.At TIERRA NATIVA we hold on to our motto:  Budget:

Board and Lodging. We estimate US $3,000 to accommodate staff and participants at La Macarena for the duration of the expedition. (20 – 30 persons approx.)

Soft drinks and refreshments. US $1,000 to supply the liquids and calories necessary for the team’s exertions. (It can get very hot and dry… or hot, humid, and rainy).

Transport and security. We estimate US $4,000 in transport costs to and from La Macarena, plus the help of two security cars during rides to minimize the risk of accidents with other vehicles among the pack of riders.

Cycling gear. US $3,000 to cover for the relevant sport and safety gear: bicycles to rent plus proper helmets, gloves, uniforms. We have in mind the fact that most La Macarena's young participants can’t afford the latter.  

US $2.000 For proper overall insurance against accident or any other calamitous eventuality.
 RisksDue to the context  a working project in the region implies a series of risks for our participants and volunteers. Moreover, outdoor activities with large groups include the possibility of accidents, illness, allergies, and other unexpected inconveniences.Thus, Tierra Nativa is well aware of the preparations needed to face all kinds of risks. For this reason, different preventive measures to ensure the wellbeing of staff and participants were taken.

Health and Safety: All volunteers will receive first aid training and search and rescue courses. Furthermore, there will be a permanent team in charge of prevention and attention of accidents and ailments. A medical doctor plus two qualified members of staff will be in charge of the team.

Security protocols were drawn from a well of twenty years’ experience with the help of experts in physical and environmental risk management.

Mental and emotional health: a volunteer psychologist will be in charge of the participants and staff’s wellbeing. The staff includes people qualified in mental health and emotional first response.

Counseling: Tierra Nativa will make previous contact and arrangements with the local authorities and entities in charge of security in the area, id est, City Halls, Police Forces, Army, Red Cross, and the relevant fire departments and hospitals.

Resources: Tierra Nativa has its own emergency equipment to face any kind of situation. It includes two first aid kits, basic medicines, a stretcher, anti-ophidic serum, cycling kits, and security vehicles.

Pre-expedition: In preparation for the expedition, a group of volunteers will travel to the area to recognize the territory, the routes, and the people with whom they will be working during the expedition.
Other Ways You Can Help If you can not help us financially, you can help us by spreading this project with your friends and family. Making some noise about our campaign.Thank you!

story:
Each year 2,000,000 children are victimized by sex trafficking.

One child is one too many.

At ChildRescueAssociation.org we are committed to saving children and saving lives. We fight child exploitation through a variety of services and educational programs, including training law enforcement officers, and running undercover rescue missions. 

  • We've identified an existing sex-trafficking ring in a Latin American country
  • Agents have been offered children as young as 10-years-old
  • We need your help in taking it down, bringing the perpetrators to justice, and giving these kids a second chance at childhood.


#ChildRescue has been featured on ...


What Your Donations Mean 


Your contribution, whatever size, has the power to make a very big difference—and change lives. It allows us to rescue children who are subjected to daily torture, rape, and abuse. We bring them to safety, and provide them with housing and aftercare, so they can transition to a safe environment where they can finally be kids again. 

Based on previous missions, we know that a trafficking ring typically holds between 10 to 20 children, with the average age between 12 and 14. The current mission we have planned has uncovered at least one child as young as 10. 

Donations will cover the costs in-the-field operators incur to see the rescue mission through from start to finish:

  • Operator travel & accommodations
  • Camera equipment to capture evidence that will be provided to local law enforcement
  • Field work, planning, and other incidentals   

Over-Funding: Aftercare & Future Missions

If we are successful in funding the mission, the work isn't over. We'll be using any extra funds to cover additional living expenses and aftercare services, including counseling for rescue survivors, as well as future rescue missions. 
PLEASE continue to share our campaign beyond our initial $30,000 target so we can fund critical survivor aftercare services and upcoming rescue missions.

The Perks of Participating in #ChildRescue

In addition to the warm fuzzy feeling of doing a good deed by donating, our sponsors and the #ChildRescue team and some mission sponsors have created a variety of ways to acknowledge your participation and recognize your role in this mission. 



$5 - Our Deepest Thanks - Thank you from all of us at #ChildRescue. We appreciate your donation from the bottom of our hearts.

$10 Special Ops Hostage Escape Card & How-to-use video.  

A Special Operations Hostage Escape Card + How-to-use video. This credit card-sized tool was invented by our friends at Readyman, a team of Green Berets and Navy SEAL Combat Veterans. Its hacksaw and lock picks can help you break out of ropes or handcuffs in the event of a kidnapping, and is slim enough to fit in your wallet. The team that invented the card has a combined 70 years of experience and has taught escape and survival to Special Forces and other Government employees around the world.

$25 - Thank You + Poster + Special Ops Hostage Escape Card & How-to-use video - You will receive a personal Thank You card from a sex-trafficking Survivor, a 16x20 “Operation Poster” and a A Special Operations Hostage Escape Card + How-to-use video. This credit card-sized tool was invented by our friends at Readyman, a team of Green Berets & Navy SEALs Combat Veterans. Its hacksaw and lock picks can help you break out of ropes or handcuffs in the event of a kidnapping, and is slim enough to fit in your wallet.

$50 - Mission T-shirt + ReadyMan Card -  A t-shirt with the name of the rescue mission, and a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card. 


$100 - Rescue Mission Debrief - A debrief report of the rescue mission, your name on our donor page, and a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card.

$250 - Shooting Class with Delta Force - A shooting class with a former Delta Force member, your name on our donor page, and a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card.

$500 - A Personal Debrief - from one of the rescue mission coordinators, and your name under the "Heroes" section of our donor page and a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card.


$1,000 - Escape and Evasion with Special Ops - A half-day escape and evasion class taught by a 28 year special forces veteran (and real-life hero). We will also list your name on our donor page. (Class taught in/near Salt Lake City) Donor responsible for their own travel.

$1,000 Corporate Sponsorship - Personal Debrief for You and Your Team - via Skype, from one our rescue mission coordinators, your company logo as a mission sponsor, and 10 ReadyMan Hostage Escape Cards. 


$1,800 - Save a Child's Life - the opportunity to save one child from sex trafficking for life, your name as a “Hero” on our donor page, and a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card.
$3,600 - Be a Hero - Not only will you save TWO children, we'll put you in a drawing to name the mission, which will be on the t-shirts associated with the campaign. (The chosen name is subject to approval.) You will also be listed as a “Hero” on our donor page, and receive a ReadyMan Hostage Escape Card.

Risks & Challenges

A rescue mission is a complex process; the people who run trafficking rings are dedicated professional criminals. Even with the best plan in place, there may be unexpected turns. But our rescue team is comprised of of highly dedicated civilians and expertly trained operators, who have backgrounds that include special forces and field operations. These skilled experts are no strangers to dangerous situations, and are committed to bringing every child to safety. They conduct all necessary fieldwork and evidence collection—including formulating the complex plan of rescue—all in partnership with local authorities. 

Immediately after the mission is completed, the rescued children will be taken to a safe house to receive immediate professional aftercare.

Beyond the rescue missions, #ChildRescue has a team of expert volunteers who work with law enforcement agencies across the country to train officers on human trafficking in the United States, and how they can effectively combat it. By building awareness, we believe we can help stop child trafficking before it starts.


The Team

Child Rescue Association of North America was founded in 2007 by the husband and wife team of Stephanie and Jess Larsen to spearhead a lifelong effort to combat child exploitation. Since then, the team has grown into a group of individuals who are equally as passionate. The team also consists of unnamed heroes, the special ops combat vets, intelligence professionals and others whose direct intervention rescues children taken by sex traffickers.



How You Can Help 

Here are several ways you can contribute to the #ChildRescue cause.

  • Donate to the mission.
  • Like our Facebook page, and share the campaign using #ChildRescue.
  • Tweet this message.
  • Add a signature to your email to help spread the word: "I just donated to the #ChildRescue mission. Make a difference in a child’s life today. http://bit.ly/1MQal6v."
  • Share the video of the campaign.
  • Check out our Media Kit: http://bit.ly/1kzjMkK

A Special Thanks To Our Corporate Sponsors


*Note: We do not publicize the faces of actual trafficking survivor rescue victims or field operators for their own protection.

story:
Ad.dar (“home” in Arabic) is an all-volunteer, non-political, non-religious community center for Syrian refugees in Istanbul.

Ad.dar’s main objective is to provide the tools to Syrian refugees in Istanbul to rebuild their lives with dignity after the trauma of war and displacement.

Cooking and "family meals" are a constant at Ad.dar. We are so sad to be physically isolated from each other- but we are in constant touch through phone calls and messaging. We are reaching out to our community to provide supermarket gift cards during this time of struggle.

In "normal" days:

Through our education programs, we help children, youth and adults to return to their education. For this purpose, it has provided advanced linguistic and university preparation education and support along with basic linguistic education for the improvement of livelihood opportunities for Syrian refugees.

Ad.dar also holds regular workshops to mentor Syrians with their resumes and applications and to help them understand their rights in Turkey.

Weekly workshops for children provide a place to allow children to play, socialize, and enjoy the freedom to be a child.

Through cultural events, such as Friday film evenings, poetry readings, concerts, cooking club and community meals, Ad.dar brings together Syrian, local and international communities, which makes Ad.dar a shared place of solidarity to keep Syrian culture alive.

story:
What is Project Haiti?

Project Haiti is a student run organization at Temple University whose members fund-raise all year round for the needs of the 18 children at the St. Francis Xavier Orphanage in Petite Riviere De Artibonite, Haiti.

Project Haiti visits the orphanage each year over Spring Break in order to create lasting relationships with the children, Director Cenat Esperandieu and staff while connecting Temple University to the Haitian community.

 Last year we were able fund the completion of a new kitchen with a concrete floor, creating a more sanitary cooking environment for the orphanage while reducing the risk of food borne illness.

We embrace diversity, Haitian culture and the mutual benefits of serving others through building global friendships! 

What We Need From You

$2,000 USD in order to execute and sustain The Latrine Project. 

The Impact

 Each year, Project Haiti has the opportunity to see the results of our fundraising efforts directly when we visit the orphanage over Spring Break.

This year Project Haiti will initiate The Latrine Project. This is a new project for Temple Project Haiti and we hope to positively impact the community in Petite Rivière de l'Artibonite. The goal of The Latrine Project is to help fight some of the biggest challenges facing many people in the community, which is a lack of proper sanitation and hygiene facilities. With the help of 10 students from Project Haiti, we hope to build 5 Latrines that will significantly improve hygiene conditions. Essentially, latrines are similar to outhouses used for restroom purposes. Our plan is to implement these Latrines for several neighbors of the orphanage in order to benefit the surrounding community.

The Latrine Project is an important step in increasing the overall quality of life for the St. Francis Xavier community. Project Haiti recognizes the important potential of every child and the lives of every Haitian within the community, and we wish to not only provide access to better health and meet basic human needs, but to also strengthen the bond or relationship with the St. Francis Xavier Orphanage and community. 

The St. Francis Xavier Orphanage is a place that is very close to our hearts as we have been able to form relationships with the children and staff while making connections with the local community.  With your donation, you will be provided progress reports to see the direct results and benefits for the rest of 2016.

Please know that any amount makes a difference and thank you for considering to support Temple Project Haiti.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate your interest even if you cannot contribute. If you want to help support our cause in other ways, share our story! Don't forget to follow us on Instagram @tuproject.haiti and like us on Facebook at Facebook.com/TUProjectHaiti

story:
Grab the chance to stop the burglar BY OWN.

   A couple of years are we trying to find a ideal system which would prevent the property from the burglar attacks. We had tested many systems and we found some to be interesting for the wide application. To the final starting line came 3 devices: Acoustic Defense Wall ADELL is one of them.

   In the video You can see how easy is sometimes to come in. You can count the seconds ...

 The standard alarm system consists today,  in principle, from two parts:

     ● From the  security cameras, sensors etc. - it means sensing equipment

        and

     ● From a monitoring system – it means  evaluation equipment.

   Some months ago we all could see the promotion of a Canary system here. It was a pretty example how to observe secured space and interpret the information from.

   But all the monitoring (equipment)  produces only an alarm (signal, picture, etc.) which must be evaluated by someone. Someone – the owner, the Police or a Security agency. They all will act -  only after  they receive the signal. How long will it be delayed? It depends! 10 minutes, a half an hour, a hour, some hours after the attack ? Sure!  And Sure is also that You will see the result of the burglary itself - as You will come...

   It means by nowadays alarm systems always exist a problem of time delay. Always. If the burglar has a good scheduled plan it is a question of minutes and its too late as the Security agency or Police arrives. Your valuables had left...   

 

  The Idea

   The idea is to extend the standard alarm system with an additional acting system where the active components discourage the burglar from the criminal idea and push him out from  the defended  space.

   All informed  know the pictures and movies from the Red see,  Somali pirates and the LRAD machines (Long Range Acoustic Devices) known also as  Sound cannons.  The Sound cannons as nonlethal weapons are sources of high energy sound beams which push the attackers (pirates, robbers) from the target (attacked ship) – without any significant injury. (see: Wikipedia - LRAD)

   In the following videos you can see the mechanism of  operation of such devices and the impact of the acoustic waves on the beings.


   What would happen if we try to apply such acting mechanism into the homeland security?  Acoustic Defense Wall!

   ADELL is a single device containing directly such sound  nonlethal  facility.  The device is a source of  intensive (directed) sound, which strength is just under the limit of human tolerableness. After the activation it generates an imaginary "Acoustic  wall" which immediately modify  the behavior of the intruder,  disables a effective thinking, disables a reasonable communication with the accomplices and forces the intruder(s) to the desertion from the irradiated zone. 

   ADELL is a ultimate security devices forcing the burglar to leave and empowers you to keep your assets safe. Coupled with a fog generator it should be perfect safety tool against robbery or thievery (see the last perk for goldsmith´s) .

  

 The Goal

  The housebreaker must be stopped before he has his work done!

  That's what homeland security should be!

  

  Hardware specification/ proposition on the beginning

On the beginning of  the project there was a discussion about following attributes:

     ● Single device construction producing a strong acoustic signal which could be             installed in a secured space

     ● Acoustic pressure up to 127/128 dB(A)

     ● Sound generator of audible hearable acoustic signal from 2 to 5 kHz

     ● Power source:  12-15 V DC (car battery)

     ● Function time min. 30 minutes

     ● Battery backup to avoid power supply cut

     ● Possible construction material: titan, steel or aluminum (ev. plastic)

     ● Ability to be switched by a signal/ contact from (an external) sensing device


Where is the job today?

Today exists a unit which fulfills the proposition:

     ● Acoustic pressure: up to 127 ±1 dB(A)in 1m / 3.28ft

     ● Sound generator of hearable/ modulated  acoustic signal of  2 – 5 kHz

     ● Protected Volume: aprox. 65-70 square meters / 700-750 square feet

     ● Standard DC power source of:  12-15 V

     ● Sabotage protection

     ● Function time by full  load min 30 minutes

     ● Battery backup: 9,6 V

     ● Contact switch, ability to connect various types of sensors

     ● Construction material: steel and plastic

     ● Temperature range: -15° C / 5°F - +55 °C/  131°F

     ● Dimension: 385 mm/15.15 in(L) x 217 mm/8.54 in(W) x 54mm/2.12in(H)                                  and: 685mm/26.97in(L) x 106 mm/4.17 in(W) x 40 mm/1.58in(H)                         (will depend from the production facility)        

     ● Actual weight of the unit: 1,7 kg/ 3.7 lb without battery

     ● Color: Silver/ Black


    It is possible to control/ to switch the ADELL with  a IR sensor or with a GSM module or with standard contacts from a (existing) alarm system.

● A IR (infrared) sensor is clear for everyone - it will switch as a thermal source (human body) is registered.  

● GSM communication  module has following useful features

     ● Communication possibility: GM Dual band  900/1800 MHz

     ● Programming device: standard  mobile able to send SMS

     ● Standard DC power source of:  10-15 V

     ● Power consumption: 0,2 A by 12 V

     ● Memory: permanent

    As it was written above we have been working on some  ideas  in the last  3-4 years.  Have looked for various sources, switching logic and mechanical constructions to find for this time a optimal one.

   Now the products are technically ready and we have  to fix the inner structure for the best sources/ production  recovery. That means the delivery of  the perfect ADELL units in some weeks.

   Nowadays actual tasks are:

     ● to finalize the mechanical construction

     ●to finalize a Installation manual in English, German

     ● to organize production lines for the production

     ● to choose the optimal distant switching (signal) sources for operation

   In addition the tasks there should be done:

     ● to add a module to allow the landlord to see and drive the situation distant by             video or online

     ● to proof  of the water resistant version for outdoor use

 

Now we need YOUR involvement and YOUR interest.

   Your support will allow us to popularize the SRAD idea, to bring the product widely on the market - so  we can make ADELL known and available to all home owners, house owners and millions of other people who have never before had a possibility to stop (their) burglar(s) directly.

  

 So why should you support us?

   You need not more to trust ONLY to Your alarm system

   You need not more to trust ONLY to the Police or the Security company and hope that they will come in time.

   You alarm system will stop the burglar BY OWN.

   YOU will be at last Your UNLIMITED LANDLORD!
story_txt:
Grab the chance to stop the burglar BY OWN.
   A couple of years are we trying to find a ideal system which
would prevent the property from the burglar attacks. We had tested many systems
and we found some to be interesting for the wide application. To the final starting line came 3 devices: Acoustic Defense Wall ADELL is one of them.   In the video You can see how easy is sometimes to come in. You can count the seconds ...
 The standard alarm system consists today,  in principle, from two parts: 
     ● From the  security cameras,
sensors etc. - it means sensing equipment
        and
     ● From a monitoring system –
it means  evaluation equipment.
   Some months ago we all could see the promotion of a Canary system
here. It was a pretty example how to observe secured space and interpret the information from.
   But all the monitoring (equipment) 
produces only an alarm (signal, picture, etc.) which must be evaluated
by someone. Someone – the owner, the Police or a Security agency. They all will
act -  only after  they receive the signal. How long will it be delayed? It
depends! 10 minutes, a half an hour, a hour, some hours after the
attack ? Sure!  And Sure is also that You will see
the result of the burglary itself - as You will come...
   It means by nowadays alarm systems always exist a problem of time delay. Always. If the burglar has a good scheduled plan it is a question of
minutes and its too late as the Security agency or Police arrives. Your
valuables had left...     
The Idea

   The idea is to extend the standard alarm system with an additional acting system where the active components discourage the
burglar from the criminal idea and push him out from  the defended 
space. 
   All informed  know the pictures
and movies from the Red see,  Somali
pirates and the LRAD machines (Long Range Acoustic Devices) known also as  Sound cannons.  The Sound cannons as nonlethal weapons are
sources of high energy sound beams which push the attackers (pirates, robbers) from
the target (attacked ship) – without any significant injury. (see: Wikipedia - LRAD)
   In the following videos you can see the mechanism of  operation of such devices and the impact of
the acoustic waves on the beings.

   What would happen if we try to apply such acting
mechanism into the homeland security?  Acoustic Defense Wall!
   ADELL is a single device containing directly such sound  nonlethal 
facility.  The device is a source
of  intensive (directed) sound, which
strength is just under the limit of human tolerableness. After the activation it
generates an imaginary "Acoustic  wall" which immediately modify  the behavior of the intruder,  disables a effective thinking, disables
a reasonable communication with the accomplices and forces the intruder(s)
to the desertion from the irradiated zone.    ADELL is a ultimate security devices forcing the burglar to leave and empowers you to keep your assets safe. Coupled with a fog generator it should be perfect safety tool against robbery or thievery (see the last perk for goldsmith´s) .   The Goal
  The housebreaker must be stopped before he has his work
done!  That's what homeland security should be!

  
  Hardware specification/ proposition on the beginning

On the beginning of  the
project there was a discussion about following attributes:
     ● Single device construction
producing a strong acoustic signal which could be             installed in
a secured space
     ● Acoustic pressure up to 127/128
dB(A)
     ● Sound generator of audible
hearable acoustic signal from 2 to 5 kHz 
     ● Power source:  12-15 V DC (car battery)
     ● Function time min. 30 minutes
     ● Battery backup to avoid power
supply cut
     ● Possible construction material:
titan, steel or aluminum (ev. plastic)
     ● Ability to be switched by
a signal/ contact from (an external) sensing device 
Where is the job today?
Today exists a unit which
fulfills the proposition:
     ● Acoustic pressure: up to 127 ±1
dB(A)in 1m / 3.28ft 
     ● Sound generator of
hearable/ modulated  acoustic signal
of  2 – 5 kHz 
     ● Protected Volume: aprox. 65-70 square
meters / 700-750 square feet 
     ● Standard DC power source of:  12-15 V 
     ● Sabotage protection
     ● Function time by full  load min 30 minutes
     ● Battery backup: 9,6 V
     ● Contact switch, ability to
connect various types of sensors
     ● Construction material: steel and
plastic
     ● Temperature range: -15° C / 5°F -
+55 °C/  131°F
     ● Dimension: 385 mm/15.15 in(L) x 217 mm/8.54 in(W) x
54mm/2.12in(H)                                  and: 685mm/26.97in(L) x 106 mm/4.17 in(W) x 40 mm/1.58in(H)                         (will depend from the production facility)         
     ● Actual weight of the unit: 1,7 kg/ 3.7 lb without battery
     ● Color: Silver/ Black


    It is possible to control/ to switch the ADELL with  a IR sensor or with a GSM module or with standard contacts from a (existing) alarm system.
● A IR (infrared) sensor is clear for
everyone - it will switch as a thermal source (human body) is registered.  
● GSM communication  module has following useful features
     ● Communication possibility: GM
Dual band  900/1800 MHz
     ● Programming device:
standard  mobile able to send SMS     ● Standard DC power source of:  10-15
V
     ● Power consumption: 0,2
A by 12 V
     ● Memory: permanent
    As it was written above we have been working on some  ideas 
in the last  3-4 years.  Have looked for various sources, switching
logic and mechanical constructions to find for this time a optimal one.
   Now the products are technically ready and we have 
to fix the inner structure for the best sources/ production  recovery. That means the delivery of  the perfect ADELL units in some weeks.
   Nowadays actual tasks are: 
     ● to finalize the mechanical construction     ●to finalize a
Installation manual in English, German
     ● to organize production lines for
the production
     ● to choose the optimal distant
switching (signal) sources for operation
   In addition the tasks there should
be done:
     ● to add a module to allow the
landlord to see and drive the situation distant by             video or online
     ● to proof  of the water resistant version for outdoor
use
 

Now we need YOUR involvement and YOUR interest.
   Your support will allow us to popularize the SRAD idea, to bring the product
widely on the market - so  we can make
ADELL known and available to all home owners, house owners and millions of
other people who have never before had a possibility to stop (their) burglar(s)
directly.
   So why should you support us?
   You need not more to trust ONLY to Your alarm system
   You need not more to trust ONLY to the Police or the Security company
and hope that they will come in time.
   You alarm system will stop the burglar BY OWN.

 
 YOU will be at last Your UNLIMITED LANDLORD!

story:
Short Summary

 

Our actions are solidarity demonstrations to raise awareness of housing poverty, homelessness and mass food waste: we want people to know that a lot of things are working in a wrong way within this social/economic system and we face these problems day by day when we step out on the streets: we see poverty, starvation, homelessness and the growth of housing difficulties. With our activity, we do not only try to reflect on these problems but we stand in solidarity with all our poorest and unbacked human beings as well, because we believe that the right to food and housing are basic human rights!

FNB Budapest is a community where the teenager punk works together with the young adult who’s just started the drudgery of work in a multi, the foreign university student works together with the grandma, and the grandchildren cook together with homeless activists. This diversity is one of our powers: we have so many different people with different social and cultural background spending their weekends together, working on a common cause.

Furthermore, FNB Budapest stands in solidarity with all the oppressed, pursued, vulnerable or disadvantaged groups of people.

For more info, check our Website and Facebook page.

 

 

What We Need

 

This campaign’s goal is to collect 2500$ (which is 1800£ /2000€) so our movement can survive!

The situation is that we’ve had to relocate our kitchen and common place quite out of the blue. The renovation of the new place requires loads of work and an enormous amount of money, which totally exceeds our yearly budget (what we use to buy pasta, rice, oil, spices, gas tank, etc). To continue, and to make our kitchen suitable for our actions and our volunteers, we need all the help we can get, so we ask for everyone’s support, anyone who can back us this way.

From your support, we can renovate the walls, install the water system, electricity, get new windows and doors.

 

 

Where are we going?

 

Our previous kitchen was in Élesztő Craft Beer Bar for years. The new place is not far, a place called Food Truck Udvar. This place needs to be fully renovated, and soon it will become our dream kitchen and community space.

We managed to progress already, having a lot of work done.  We teared down parts and layers of the wall that would have come down anyway and moved our stuff there. However, we are very far from the end.

 

 

What do we have to do, what do we need?

 

  • We have to renovate the walls. Time and leaks had their effect on it. We will take the layers down, and fix it, as a long term solution we would like to install drywall on it or something.
     
  • We have to install the water system. There is no water in the space at the moment so we need tubes, taps, water meter, etc.
     
  • We have to install electricity. Although the place is full of cables, not much electricity is running in them, so we have to fix this – not only for the light, but winter is coming and so for the heating system as well.
     
  • We have to get new doors and a window. Again due to time and water, these are pretty much damaged and must be replaced.
     
  • We need radiators, so we can stay active during winter time.
     
  • We also need your support so we can buy the already mentioned things that we need to run the activities, for example, gas tanks, oil, pasta, rice, gloves, etc., not even talking about the monthly overhead prices like paying the water and electricity.

 

We need your help to implement all of these. If you have the chance, please support us, so the approx. 900 portions of food that we distribute to people in need every month, will be secured, and our community can continue its work.
 

About these reasons, we want to collect 2500$ (which is 1800£ /2000€)!

 

 

If you only want to support one good cause
in this year, let that be FNB Budapest!

 

 

Other ways you can help

If you can't contribute, that's not a problem. We will be very grateful if you can spread the word, make some noise about this campaign, follow us on social medias and share our posts with your friends, families in your social networks!

Our social links:

Website
Facebook
Instagram

 

Unfortunately, we are not able to afford perks at the moment. Thank you for your understanding!


We are really thankful in advance for your help (and will be afterward as well)!

Food Not Bombs Budapest Crew

story:
Why an Adoptee Rights Booth? Almost 7 million US citizens cannot have their Original Birth Certificate because they were adopted. Help the ARC change the laws for millions of Adoptees & their families. Go to http://www.indiegogo.com/Buy-the-Booth. Donate a Dollar & Add Your Name. Your Rights, Your Protest...add your voice, play your part and help BUY THE BOOTH now!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Adoptee Rights Coalition is a nonprofit all volunteer based group of adult adoptees, birthparents and adoptive parents working together to bring awareness and education to the need for unrestricted access to our original birth certificates. We want all Americans to have unconditional access to their own original birth certificates even if they happen to have been adopted. Nothing more than what every other American in the US has, nothing less.

 

Equal Access and Equal Rights.

 

The Impact of The Denied

 

Access to the Original Birth Certificate (OBC) is a matter of state laws. In the US, 41 states continue the practice of sealing adopted children's OBC upon finalization of the adoption. Alaska and Kansas never sealed theirs at all, but the other 48 did, some as early as the 1930's and some not until the 70's. Some sealed records laws, such as NY, can trace their roots back to the corrupt practices of infamous baby stealer Georgia Tann and other unscrupulous lobby groups.

 

Right now, unless the adoptee's OBC is in Alaska, Kansas, Maine, New Hampshire, Oregon, Tennessee, Alabama or, unless the adoptee's birthparents had the knowledge that they could apply for the OBC before the adoption records were sealed, then that adoptee might never see the record of their birth.

 

 

 

Every year the Adoptee Rights Coalition organizes the Adoptee Rights Demonstration. We follow the National Convention of State Legislators as adoption laws are a state issue. Hundreds of ARC supports come from all across the country and even internationally to have their voices heard. As we are small and unfunded, the demonstration, a traditional sign waving, chanting old fashioned protest, garnishes the attention of the state legislators that attend the convention. These are the people that have the power to help us change the out dated adoption laws.

 

The Adoptee Rights Coalition volunteers then spend three days working the exhibition hall booth where we interact one on one with state lawmakers in order to education them about the need for updated adoption laws in their states. In our experience, most legislators are unaware that these are issues affect almost 7 million American's every day, but when are faced the facts, are interested in updating their current laws. Legislative changes that allow adult adoptees to have unrestricted access to their birth certificates create bi-partisan support, have a positive impact upon the fiscal budgets of the state, are supported by adoptees, adoptive parent s and birthparents, and are win-win for all involved.

 

What We Need & What You Get The NCSL Legislative Summit is Aug. 12-15, 2013 in Atlanta, Georgia. In order to have access to the state legislators, we have to purchase an exhibit booth in the main exhibit hall during the conference. We are vying for attention against the huge lobby groups who have giant displays, custom swag to giveaway and are funded by major interest groups. We are, without a doubt, the underdogs of the adoption industry and we are fighting against the big corporations. There is no getting around the cost of the booth.

 

Please help the ARC BUY THE BOOTH!

 

Through our generous supporters last year, we were able to  fund our booth and we were able to buy updated supplies. We were able to secure our booth this year, but we need funds for our booth supplies, sign making materials and other costs associated with our  booth. We know our supporters will be generous, especially if they cannot physically make it to Atlanta.

 

Other Ways You Can Help Adoptees * Learn more about Adoptee Rights at our website www.adopteerightscoalition.com.

 

* Find out where your state stands, and how to help put the pressure on your home state legislators. * Find and follow the Adoptee Rights Coalition on Twitter, Facebook, andGoogle Plus. * Join our mailing lists or subscribe for updates. * Wear an Adoptee Rights T-shirt proudly and tell people why you support equal OBC access.

 

* Share this information and help us BUY THE BOOTH!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 
For the exhibit hall in the NCSL, there are required booth items that are not covered in the initial purchase. This might seem incredibly insane, but it is the way it works. The ARC has always been very thrifty and only purchased the required items including: the carpet under the booth, renting the table and chairs ( we only get two chairs and take turns sitting).  Even the "official" garbage pail must be rented. We forgo the $50 garbage pail and use bags that we hide under the table.  In any case,  your contributions a will allow us to purchase what we must. We still will NOT get the garbage pail!
 
 
 
 
Bottom line: Please continue to share the donation campaign on Facebook, on Twitter, on your blogs, in your adoption groups and forums. We are an AMAZING COMMUNITY and together we can do AMAZING things.

Again, from the bottom of our hearts...THANK YOU!!

Why the Adoptee Rights Coalition?

 

Adoption is supposed to be about what is best for the child. But what happens when that child grows up and is an adult? 

Currently, close to 7 million US citizens are denied access to the legal records of their birth because they happen to be adopted. Adult adopted persons in the US are denied access to their Original Birth Certificates, the legal documentation of their birth. 

This is a violation of their civil rights.

The Adoptee Rights Coalition is a nonprofit all volunteer based group of adult adoptees, birthparents and adoptive parents working together to bring awareness and education to the need for unrestricted access to our original birth certificates. We want all Americans to have unconditional access to their own original birth certificates even if they happen to have been adopted. Nothing more than what every other American in the US has, nothing less. 

Equal Access and Equal Rights. 

The Impact of The Denied

Access to the Original Birth Certificate ( OBC) is a matter of state laws. In the US, 41 states continue the practice of sealing adopted children's OBC upon finalization of the adoption.  Alaska and Kansas never sealed theirs at all, but the other 48 did, some as early as the 1930's and some not until the 70's. Some sealed records laws, such as NY, can trace their roots back to the corrupt practices of infamous baby stealer Georgia Tann and other unscrupulous lobby groups.

Right now, unless the adoptee's OBC is in Alaska, Kansas, Maine, New Hampshire, Oregon, Tennessee or Alabama, or, unless the adoptee's birthparents had the knowledge that they could apply for the OBC before the adoption records were sealed, then that adoptee might never see the record of their birth.

Every year  the Adoptee Rights Coalition organizes the Adoptee Rights Demonstration. We follow the National Convention of State Legislators as adoption laws are a state issue. Hundreds of ARC supports come from all across the country and even internationally to have their voices heard. As we are small and unfunded, the demonstration, a traditional sign waving, chanting old fashioned protest, garnishes the attention of the state legislators that attend the convention. These are the people that have the power to help us change the out dated adoption laws.

The Adoptee Rights Coalition volunteers then spend three days working the exhibition hall booth where we interact one on one with state lawmakers in order to education them about the need for updated adoption laws in their states. In our experience, most legislators are unaware that these are issues affect almost 7 million American's every day, but when are faced the facts, are interested in updating their current laws. Legislative changes that allow adult adoptees to have unrestricted access to their birth certificates create bi-partisan support, have a positive impact upon the fiscal budgets of the state, are supported by adoptees, adoptive parent s and birthparents, and are win-win for all involved.

What We Need!

The NCSL Legislative Summit is Aug. 12-15 in Atlanta, Georgia. In order to have access to the state legislators, we have to purchase an exhibit booth in the main exhibit hall during the conference. We are vying for attention against the huge lobby groups who have giant displays, custom swag to giveaway and are funded by major interest groups. We are, without a doubt, the underdogs of the NCSL fighting against the big corporations. There is no getting around the cost of the booth. 

Please help the ARC BUY THE BOOTH!

This year the booth is $1,825.00 but we still need booth supplies, sign making materials, and other demonstration materials. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help Adoptees

 

  • Learn more about Adoptee Rights at our website www.adopteerights.net.
  • Find out where your state stands, and how to help put the pressure on your home state legislators.
  • Find and follow the Adoptee Rights Coalition on Twitter, Facebook, and Google Plus.
  • Join our mailing lists or subscribe for updates.
  • Wear an Adoptee Rights T-shirt proudly and tell people why you support equal OBC access.
  • Share this information and help us BUY THE BOOTH!

Right now, unless the adoptee's OBC is in Alaska, Kansas, Maine, New Hampshire, Oregon, Tennessee or Alabama, or, unless the adoptee's birthparents had the knowledge that they could apply for the OBC before the adoption records were sealed, then that adoptee might never see the record of their birth.
Every year  the Adoptee Rights Coalition organizes the Adoptee Rights Demonstration. We follow the National Convention of State Legislators as adoption laws are a state issue. Hundreds of ARC supports come from all across the country and even internationally to have their voices heard. As we are small and unfunded, the demonstration, a traditional sign waving, chanting old fashioned protest, garnishes the attention of the state legislators that attend the convention. These are the people that have the power to help us change the out dated adoption laws.
The Adoptee Rights Coalition volunteers then spend three days working the exhibition hall booth where we interact one on one with state lawmakers in order to education them about the need for updated adoption laws in their states. In our experience, most legislators are unaware that these are issues affect almost 7 million American's every day, but when are faced the facts, are interested in updating their current laws. Legislative changes that allow adult adoptees to have unrestricted access to their birth certificates create bi-partisan support, have a positive impact upon the fiscal budgets of the state, are supported by adoptees, adoptive parent s and birthparents, and are win-win for all involved.
What We Need!
The NCSL Legislative Summit is Aug. 12-15 in Atlanta, Georgia. In order to have access to the state legislators, we have to purchase an exhibit booth in the main exhibit hall during the conference. We are vying for attention against the huge lobby groups who have giant displays, custom swag to giveaway and are funded by major interest groups. We are, without a doubt, the underdogs of the NCSL fighting against the big corporations. There is no getting around the cost of the booth. 
Please help the ARC BUY THE BOOTH! 
This year the booth is $1,825.00 but we still need booth supplies, sign making materials, and other demonstration materials. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help Adoptees
 

Learn more about Adoptee Rights at our website www.adopteerights.net.
Find out where your state stands, and how to help put the pressure on your home state legislators.
Find and follow the Adoptee Rights Coalition on Twitter, Facebook, and Google Plus.
Join our mailing lists or subscribe for updates.
Wear an Adoptee Rights T-shirt proudly and tell people why you support equal OBC access.
Share this information and help us BUY THE BOOTH!

story:
Your kind support can help 70 children to forget their daily troubles and have an extraordinary vacation. 

 

In the 2008 war, the village of Ergneti in Georgia was at the center of hostilities. Many people left then, but the community is slowly returning to life. The children of the village remain victims of the conflict however, as soldiers, checkpoints, barbed wire and deep poverty continue to be part of their lives.

Help us fund a fun, joy-filled summer camp in the village of Ergneti to give these kids an opportunity to forget their daily troubles. With your support, 70 children between 7 and 15 can have ten days of fun, growth and experience they will never forget.


The summer camp is run by team of enthusiastic volunteers – doctors, teachers and journalists. They have voluntarily run this camp in previous years and therefore have the necessary experience to make the 2014 summer camp a great success again. We will put your donation to maximum use by using it directly to buy food, arts and crafts material and sports equipment.

For the amount that you would spend for your child’s friend’s birthday gift or just a night out with friends you can give these children a summer they will not forget and an opportunity to just have carefree fun!


As is tradition in Georgia, the guest is always sent by God, so our community would like you to remember us too with small gifts.


დაეხმარეთ  70  ბავშვსდაივიწყოსყოველდღიურისიძნელედაგაატაროსდაუვიწყარიზაფხული!

  სოფელიერგნეთს  ცხინვალისრეგიონის  საოკუპაციოზონის  გამყოფ  ხაზს  ეკლიანიმავთულხლართები  რამდენიმემეტრითაცილებს. დევნილი.აგვისტოსკონფლიქტისდროსსოფელისაომარიმოქმედებებისეპიცენტრიიყო.ასობითადამიანიდახდადევნილი.სოფელშიდაიწვა 160 საცხოვრებელისახლი.ასობითადამიანიგახდადევნილი.

შეწყდაშეიარაღებულიდაპირისპირება ,ომითდაზარალებულიმოსახლეობანელ-ნელადაუბრუნდასოფელს,დაიწყოდანგრეულისახლებისდამეურნეობისაღდგენა,მაგრამდარჩადიდიტკივილი,შიშიდაუდიდესიფსიქოლოგიურიტრავმა.


სოფელერგნეთისბავშვებიდღემდერჩებიანდაუცველნი,სამხედრობლოკ-პოსტი,მათიუსაფრთხოებისათვისშეიარაღებულიჯარისკაცისკოლისეზოში,ეკლიანიმავთულები,ცაშიმფრინავირუსულისამხედროვერტმფრენი,დამთრგუნველისიღარიბე,შიმშილი-აი,მათიყოველდღიურიცხოვრებისშემადგენელინაწილი.

მეგობრებო! ჩემოძვირფასებო! მოგვეხმარეთ.სოფელერგნეთშიმოვაწყოთსაზაფხულობანაკი  ფსიქო-სოციალურირეაბილიტაციისმიზნითსოფლისბავშვებისათვის.რათაბავშვებსმივცეთსაშუალებადაივიწყონომისსაშინელება,დაგვეხმარეთმოვუხსნათსტრესი,რომელიცმათმიიღეს,გამოეთიშონიმყოველდღიურპრობლემებს,რომელიცმათდამათმშობლებსაწუხებს.

ბანაკიმოეწყობა 2014 წლისზაფხულს ,აგვისტოში, 7-დან 15 წლისასაკის 70 ბავშვისათვის 10 დღისგანმავლობაშიიმმხიარულიღონისძიებებით,რომელიცარასოდესდაავიწყდებათ !

ვილონტიორები(მოხალისეები)-ექიმები,ფსიქოლოგები,ტრენერები,ჟურნალისტებიბავშვებთან  მთელიდღეებისგანმავლობაშიატარებენსაინტერესოტრენინგებსდამხიარულსანახაობებს.

თქვენიშემოწირულობებიდაიხარჯებამხოლოდდამხოლოდსაკვების,ხელსაქმისმასალებისდასპორტულიინვენტარისშესაძენად.

დახარჯეთზუსტადიმდენი,რამდენსაცდახარჯავდითთქვენიშვილისმეგობრისსაჩუქრისშესაძენად,ანთქვენსმეგობრებთანერთადერთისაღამოსგასატარებლად.

თქვენომგამოვლილბავშვებსაჩუქებთულამაზესსაათებს,რომელიცარასოდესწაიშლებამათიმეხსიერებიდანდამისცემთსაშუალებასუზრუნველადგაატარონათიდაუვიწყარიდღე.


ქართულიტრადიციებისმიხედვით ,სტუმარიღვთისაა. ამიტომჩვენცგვაქვსსურვილიგაჩუქოთსამახსოვროსაჩუქარი.

ლიაჩლაჩიძეცხოვრობსსოფელერგნეთში.ყოფილიპედაგოგიდაჟურნალისტიახლაპენსიაზეა,მაგრამაქტიურადმონაწილეობს  სამოქალაქოსაზოგადოებისცხოვრებაში. 15 ივნისსისკენჭსიყრისადგილობრივთვითმმართველობისარჩევნებში,რათამიიტანოსგამყოფიხაზისსიახლოვესმცხოვრებიქალებისხმაფართოსაზოგადოებამდედაეძებონპრობლემებისგადაჭრისგზები.

  სოფელიერგნეთს  ცხინვალისრეგიონის  საოკუპაციოზონის  გამყოფ  ხაზს  ეკლიანიმავთულხლართები  რამდენიმემეტრითაცილებს. დევნილი.აგვისტოსკონფლიქტისდროსსოფელისაომარიმოქმედებებისეპიცენტრიიყო.ასობითადამიანიდახდადევნილი.სოფელშიდაიწვა 160 საცხოვრებელისახლი.ასობითადამიანიგახდადევნილი.

სოფელერგნეთისბავშვებიდღემდერჩებიანდაუცველნი,სამხედრობლოკ-პოსტი,მათიუსაფრთხოებისათვისშეიარაღებულიჯარისკაცისკოლისეზოში,ეკლიანიმავთულები,ცაშიმფრინავირუსულისამხედროვერტმფრენი,დამთრგუნველისიღარიბე,შიმშილი-აი,მათიყოველდღიურიცხოვრებისშემადგენელინაწილი.
მეგობრებო! ჩემოძვირფასებო! მოგვეხმარეთ.სოფელერგნეთშიმოვაწყოთსაზაფხულობანაკი  ფსიქო-სოციალურირეაბილიტაციისმიზნითსოფლისბავშვებისათვის.რათაბავშვებსმივცეთსაშუალებადაივიწყონომისსაშინელება,დაგვეხმარეთმოვუხსნათსტრესი,რომელიცმათმიიღეს,გამოეთიშონიმყოველდღიურპრობლემებს,რომელიცმათდამათმშობლებსაწუხებს.
ბანაკიმოეწყობა 2014 წლისზაფხულს ,აგვისტოში, 7-დან 15 წლისასაკის 70 ბავშვისათვის 10 დღისგანმავლობაშიიმმხიარულიღონისძიებებით,რომელიცარასოდესდაავიწყდებათ !

თქვენიშემოწირულობებიდაიხარჯებამხოლოდდამხოლოდსაკვების,ხელსაქმისმასალებისდასპორტულიინვენტარისშესაძენად.
დახარჯეთზუსტადიმდენი,რამდენსაცდახარჯავდითთქვენიშვილისმეგობრისსაჩუქრისშესაძენად,ანთქვენსმეგობრებთანერთადერთისაღამოსგასატარებლად.
თქვენომგამოვლილბავშვებსაჩუქებთულამაზესსაათებს,რომელიცარასოდესწაიშლებამათიმეხსიერებიდანდამისცემთსაშუალებასუზრუნველადგაატარონათიდაუვიწყარიდღე.


ქართულიტრადიციებისმიხედვით ,სტუმარიღვთისაა. ამიტომჩვენცგვაქვსსურვილიგაჩუქოთსამახსოვროსაჩუქარი.
ლიაჩლაჩიძეცხოვრობსსოფელერგნეთში.ყოფილიპედაგოგიდაჟურნალისტიახლაპენსიაზეა,მაგრამაქტიურადმონაწილეობს  სამოქალაქოსაზოგადოებისცხოვრებაში. 15 ივნისსისკენჭსიყრისადგილობრივთვითმმართველობისარჩევნებში,რათამიიტანოსგამყოფიხაზისსიახლოვესმცხოვრებიქალებისხმაფართოსაზოგადოებამდედაეძებონპრობლემებისგადაჭრისგზები.

story:
The Idea

My name is Louino 'Robi' Robillard, and I am a young community leader who grew up in Cite Soleil, Haiti's largest ghetto. Cite Soleil has a rough history: our community is mostly known for the gang violence that has made it the most dangerous place in the country.

But what most people don't know is that most people in Cite Soleil have dreams of peace, and that there are countless young people who are working to build peace in our community every day. They do the hard, thankless work of building community, and they never get recognized for it - and we lose a lot of them to discouragement and burnout.

To address this, last year I came up with the idea for the Cite Soleil Peace Prize, a chance to honor young people making a difference in these tough conditions, and to focus attention on a positive side of Cite Soleil that few people see. Our decision to honor 4 young leaders got local and national attention, and helped inspire other young people to step up and continue down the hard road to building peace.
2015 has been especially hard for Cite Soleil: there has been an increase in both violence and the number of innocent people who've been caught in the crossfire. Now more than ever, we need to remind our community that peace is still possible, to not give up hope. So this year, we are planning on organizing the 2nd Annual Cite Soleil Peace Prize to celebrate the young people who are still holding onto the dream - and we need your help to do it.


The Logistics

A Peace Prize Committee has been established this year, and they are developing the criteria for this year's candidates. They will be looking for emerging leaders who are working collaboratively to bring creative solutions to their community's problems. They will be looking for the people who embody the spirit of konbit, a traditional Haitian system of reciprocity and solidarity.  Potential candidates will be nominated by community members, and the final list of 5 will be selected by the Committee. The award will be given out on the 25th of June, 2015.

Our vision is mostly built on the energy of community leaders, but we do need some support to help make this happen: arranging for the award plaques, building a stage in the central square of Cite Soleil, arranging a sound system and program, investing in leadership development activities for the finalists and other nominees. Any additional resources will be invested in community activities that build a sense of unity and solidarity in Cite Soleil. 


The Impact

Last year, we chose four young, emerging leaders who had made great sacrifices and showed great imagination (you can see a video describing them here). After they were awarded the prize, all have become more capable and passionate leaders. Sadrack is expanding the vision for the Cite Soleil Basketball Team, Frantz was highlighted during World Humanitarian Day 2014, Alashkar is emerging as one of the strongest female voices in the community, and Stephen has steered La Difference through one of its most challenging years. I have heard them say that knowing that their actions were recognized - and that the eyes of the community are on them -  was a significant source of motivation.

So this year, we are planning to do this - and go beyond. Not only will we select 5 leaders this year, but we will have a more structured mentoring program to provide support to these young people. We will have more sustained engagement with local media, to get their stories out there and fight some of the negative narratives about Cite Soleil. We will leverage this event to support other initiatives that bring together the people of Cite Soleil in solidarity and unity. 

Sadly, 2015 has been such a violent year that many of the young leaders I know and care about are getting discouraged, and talking to me about giving up. We can't let this happen. Now is the time to show them that their sacrifices are not invisible, their fight is not vain, and their futures can still be bright.


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't give money, you can still help! We need everyone we can to fight the negative stigma about Cite Soleil, and at the same time, help bring attention to the serious barriers that our young people face. Look for and share positive stories about our community. Help us think about creative ways to fight the structural violence that holds us back. Brainstorm about how we can create opportunity for the talented young people across Cite Soleil.
