My name is Louino 'Robi' Robillard, and I am a young community leader who grew up in Cite Soleil, Haiti's largest ghetto. Cite Soleil has a rough history: our community is mostly known for the gang violence that has made it the most dangerous place in the country.
But what most people don't know is that most people in Cite Soleil have dreams of peace, and that there are countless young people who are working to build peace in our community every day. They do the hard, thankless work of building community, and they never get recognized for it - and we lose a lot of them to discouragement and burnout.
To address this, last year I came up with the idea for the Cite Soleil Peace Prize, a chance to honor young people making a difference in these tough conditions, and to focus attention on a positive side of Cite Soleil that few people see. Our decision to honor 4 young leaders got local and national attention, and helped inspire other young people to step up and continue down the hard road to building peace.2015 has been especially hard for Cite Soleil: there has been an increase in both violence and the number of innocent people who've been caught in the crossfire. Now more than ever, we need to remind our community that peace is still possible, to not give up hope. So this year, we are planning on organizing the 2nd Annual Cite Soleil Peace Prize to celebrate the young people who are still holding onto the dream - and we need your help to do it.
The Logistics




A Peace Prize Committee has been established this year, and they are developing the criteria for this year's candidates. They will be looking for emerging leaders who are working collaboratively to bring creative solutions to their community's problems. They will be looking for the people who embody the spirit of konbit, a traditional Haitian system of reciprocity and solidarity.  Potential candidates will be nominated by community members, and the final list of 5 will be selected by the Committee. The award will be given out on the 25th of June, 2015.
Our vision is mostly built on the energy of community leaders, but we do need some support to help make this happen: arranging for the award plaques, building a stage in the central square of Cite Soleil, arranging a sound system and program, investing in leadership development activities for the finalists and other nominees. Any additional resources will be invested in community activities that build a sense of unity and solidarity in Cite Soleil. 
The Impact
Last year, we chose four young, emerging leaders who had made great sacrifices and showed great imagination (you can see a video describing them here). After they were awarded the prize, all have become more capable and passionate leaders. Sadrack is expanding the vision for the Cite Soleil Basketball Team, Frantz was highlighted during World Humanitarian Day 2014, Alashkar is emerging as one of the strongest female voices in the community, and Stephen has steered La Difference through one of its most challenging years. I have heard them say that knowing that their actions were recognized - and that the eyes of the community are on them -  was a significant source of motivation.
So this year, we are planning to do this - and go beyond. Not only will we select 5 leaders this year, but we will have a more structured mentoring program to provide support to these young people. We will have more sustained engagement with local media, to get their stories out there and fight some of the negative narratives about Cite Soleil. We will leverage this event to support other initiatives that bring together the people of Cite Soleil in solidarity and unity. 
Sadly, 2015 has been such a violent year that many of the young leaders I know and care about are getting discouraged, and talking to me about giving up. We can't let this happen. Now is the time to show them that their sacrifices are not invisible, their fight is not vain, and their futures can still be bright.
Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't give money, you can still help! We need everyone we can to fight the negative stigma about Cite Soleil, and at the same time, help bring attention to the serious barriers that our young people face. Look for and share positive stories about our community. Help us think about creative ways to fight the structural violence that holds us back. Brainstorm about how we can create opportunity for the talented young people across Cite Soleil.

story:
The Cambodian NGO Committee on CEDAW (NGO-CEDAW) is a Cambodian-based non-profit that has worked for 20 years to improve women's rights in Cambodia.

We have a small staff (most are pictured above): 3 full-time and 1 part-time, plus a rotating set of volunteers, contract consultants and interns.  We work in an office that we barely fit into (2m by 3m).  Larger donors will give us grants to do projects, such as providing leadership training to women in rural areas, writing reports on domestic violence, and lobbying for better laws to stop human trafficking.  But they don't want to pay for rent or salaries or computer equipment.   They also don't want to pay for ongoing work.
Our main work is important and no one else in Cambodia is doing it:

  • Monitoring the government's efforts to end discrimination in compliance with the constitution and international treaties it signed is our main activity.   We focus on the UN Convention to Eliminate Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW) by publishing a shadow report with accurate information on how women are really treated whenever the government writes an official report.
  • We are the umbrella organization for more than 50 other Cambodian non-profits that work for women's rights.  NGO-CEDAW organizes all of the coalition's activities, including lobbying, information-sharing, technical training workshops, producing radio shows on human rights, and an annual member conference. 

With your help, we won't have to take another pay cut and spend so much time writing grant proposals and reports that we can't get our primary work done.

Budget breakdown:

  • We need $25,000 to cover six months' wages and health insurance for the whole staff:  the coordinator, finance officer, communications officer, part-time webmaster and consultants (for report writing, legal research, grant-writing and translation). 
  • Rent for the office space, including utilities, costs us $2100 for six months.
  • We need another $1750 for office supplies, business phone calls, transportation to meetings, maintenance/repair of office equipment and website hosting.

We only ask for a small amount from each of you.  If you can donate just $5, we would be very grateful.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have much money please send a link to this site to your family and friends, since most crowdfunding donations come from people you know, not random folks looking at the website.

story:
[Overview] 

It`s hard to know where to start when confronted with a humanitarian crisis of such unimaginable proportion. You certainly can`t help everyone. But you can definitely help someone. Which is what I intend to do. But I can`t do it alone.

If you can support my campaign to get a caravan out to Greece to function as a mobile GP surgery then we`re all making a difference, despite individually probably being a bit useless when it comes to worldwide conflict and oppression. 

[Donations]

I have pledged to raise £600 to cover the cost of the caravan, If we exceed the £600 target then the additional money will be used to sanitise the caravan and stock it with items as per the requirements for a mobile support unit. If we fall short of our £600 target then the money that we do have will be given to CalAid and used to buy fresh produce for the 2500 or so hot meals distributed daily.

[Perks]

The perks are offered in exchange for your support at no extra cost. However if you`d like to just donate that`s also totally fine/amazing.

Thank you so so much - you are the reason we have such a big impact on humanity!

- L x

story:
Mona Relief recap 2016 and 2017

We had great success with the campaign from 2016 (#20foryemen) and 2017 (Ramadan Campaign), this year we hope for an even greater success for our 2018 Ramadan campaign. Our activities during 2017 increased rapidly with many projects. Our first fundraising campaign in 2018 sets to begin here, and we hope you will help the people of Yemen to achieve it.

Our own resources are limited, however being independent, we have still achieved the trust of the Yemeni people, and have so far carried out many projects with the help of local and foreign donors.

 

The crisis in short during 2017 and 2018

Yemen is at the moment the world’s largest humanitarian crisis, with 8.4 million people on the verge of famine. Over 1 million is suspected of being infected with cholera, and thousands have died as a result of the war.

On top of all that, Yemen was blocked in all entry points in November 2017. Almost nothing from food or humanitarian help could enter Yemen, which led to even more starvation. Those responsible for the war have blocked many int’l human rights organizations from traveling into Yemen. Fighting forces have also blocked food and medical supplies and have imposed restrictions on aid workers. And so it goes on 2018. 

We can only hope for good, but as a matter of fact, the situation has only got worse. You would think 3 years were enough (1000+ days and counting into the war), but no, the war still goes on, and the biggest losers are the people of Yemen.


Our aim for this Ramadan campaign in 2018

Regardless of the purpose of the project, our aim has always been the same - to serve the helpless people. This year we will focus especially on food and medicine.
During winter 2017 we carried out a lot of clothing projects for the winter, and this year we will start out by our food and medicine projects again.

Our goal for this project will be to reach 30.000 USD in 45 days.

We are planning to visit many of the Yemeni governorates, and with your donations we will carry out the projects. All our projects are documented and pictures of them can be found on our website (www.monareliefye.org) or our twitter (@monarelief).

Our Campaign will provide funds to help families during Ramadan and after it.

 

$30 can do more than you think

By giving a simple amount of only $30, you are helping a whole family for one month. For each $30 donated we can supply the following for a family for a month:

Every penny counts. Giving 25, 250 or even $2 - the more we donate, the closer we get to the goal. Hundreds of projects have been carried out since we started and over 40.000 families fed. We believe that in spite of the heavy shelling, no one deserves to die hungry or thirsty. The previous projects were carried out in the governorates of Sana'a, Hodeidah, Hajjah , Marib, Dhamar, Amran, Mahweet and Amant al-Asimah, Aden, Taiz and Saada.

 

Image from 9. september 2017

 

Previous distribution projects

Have a look at some of our projects during last year and 2016.

 

Food aid baskets to Jewish community’s members in Sana’a - May 2017

 

Ramadan food aid baskets Sanaa May 2017

 

Mona Relief Yemen distributing food aid to IDPs in Sana'a April 2017

 

+ many more projects! Visit our website https://www.monareliefye.org to see more projects or follow our twitter @monarelief or www.flickr.com/monareliefyemen

 

The money you donate

Every penny we receive from the donors goes to buy food for Internally displaced families. To give you a calculation, one of our first food distributions from 2015: we bought 149 bags each of which contained: 25 Kg wheat, 5 kg sugar, 5 kg rice and 2L of cooking oil. The total price was 845820 YR which is equal to $2500. Transport costs from Sanaa (Capital of Yemen) to Harf Sofyan (The Area where the food was given) costed 62000 YR which is equal to $248.

By donating $30 you can feed a family for a whole month with 25 kg wheat, 5 kg rice, 5 kg sugar, 2L cooking oil, 1L powdered milk and medicine / aid kits.

We have included milk this time instead of dates, since the demand has been greater for it.

 

What Is Happening to Yemen?

Saudi Arabia together with a coalition launched a bombing campaign in Yemen on 25 March 2015 and imposed a blockade on all Yemeni sea, land and airports which has restricted entry of all supplies into the country.


• At least one child dies every 10 minutes in Yemen because of preventable diseases such as diarrhea, malnutrition and respiratory tract infections, according to UNICEF.


• 17.8 million people are food insecure including 8.4 million who don't know where their next meal will come from, UNOCHA said.  

• More than 2 million children in Yemen are acutely malnourished and require urgent care, including more than least 460,000 suffering from severe acute malnutrition — an increase of almost 200% since 2014

• 3 million people have been displaced since the conflict escalated following the Saudi-led military intervention, UNOCHA.
 

About Us

Mona Relief is a 100% Yemeni Organization based in Sanaa, Yemen. We are an internationally recognized by U.N. and other organizations. We carry out projects in accordance with Yemeni relative laws and regulations.

We are recognized by the many different communities across Yemen. All of our work is documented with pictures, videos and stories directly from within Yemen. We are completely independent and none of our work is politicized.

 

Mona Relief Founder

The Project founder is Fatik Abdullah Al Rodaini. Fatik is 40 Years Old and lives in Sanaa, Yemen. He is a Journalist and human rights activist. He is responsible for volunteers, sourcing and distribution of aid 'on the ground’. Follow Fatik here on twitter here: https://twitter.com/Fatikr

Working alongside Fatik, is a core group of compassionate people who are obsessively and tirelessly working to see that humanity prevails. These are the friends of Twitter who initially started this project and keep it running. Without the patronage and help of some of our Twitter friends, we wouldn't be able to do what we do.

Remember: We work in extremely dangerous and volatile conditions everyday in order to get needed food to people. Your donations do go a long way to make this happen. Please give Yemen a chance!


We do all the work ON THE GROUND in Yemen.

With the hep of great volunteers ofcourse.

 

Cant Donate? That's Okay.. Raise Awareness!

Not everybody can donate, but everybody can make a difference - it doesn't always have to be money, you can raise awareness by using the twitter hashtag: #yemen #saveyemen #monarelief to raise awareness about this campaign.

Don’t forget to include a link to the campaign. Share it with family and friends and help spread the message!

 

Last Words

This concept comes to fruition with the aim that every human being should be able to live with dignity without having to worry about the very basic right of sustenance.

Please give generously because the only way to live a pleasant life is either in someone's heart or someone's prayer. And in this case you get both!

Mona Relief is nothing without donors, and therefore we hope you will keep making us strong.

Don’t forget to visit our website https://www.monareliefye.org see our previous projects.

story: Our Names are Maureen Cahalan and David Gorden. We both have Cerebral Palsy. It affects our speech and muscle movement. Maureen can not walk, she is in a wheelchair. Maureen counts on me to take care of her. I do get paid for assisting Maureen. The pay isn't much but it is something. We both have a fixed income which makes purchasing a home hard. We have asked about hud homes and we were told that hud does not do any extra construction to make a home accessible. So we are asking for help. So we can have a permanent home. We are tired of paying rent and the rent increasing and having to move. Because the rent gets too high. It's hard to find anything that's accessible for Maureen. I want to have a house built for Maureen's needs. But it's so expensive especially new construction. Then we can stay put and call our new place our permanent home. We appreciate any help we get.

story:
Who i Am and What i Stand For...

Aloha! I'm Arielle, Founder & C.E.O of m.a.d.e., a start up non profit promoting racial justice and gender equality.

Here's some fun facts about me!

  • I haven't matched my socks since seventh grade
  • I'm a proud member of the Ravenclaw house
  • I'm a strong believer in social justice
So here's the deal ... 
Social media is running the planet. It's tied into EVERYTHING we do. So, it should also be instrumental in grassroots organizing and community development.

Our responses to racism and gender inequality are stale, outdated, and boring. m.a.d.e. aims to make social justice and community organizing fun, intelligent, and savvy through extensive use of social media and entrepreneurial millennial culture.

Show Me the Money

Our fundraising goal is modest. As a start-up non-profit, every little bit helps. Here's what the $ will go towards:

  • Complete expansion of the Diverse Expressions Program (the infrastructure is already in place. Now it's time for optimization)
  • Establishing the Medical Retrieval Project (assisting the poor in getting their medical records for federal disability benefits. At some hospitals, it costs 75 cents a sheet, putting the total cost at upwards of $150)

The Vision

This is only the first step. There's an entire movement we're building in tackling racism and gender inequality. 

Join us.

story:
What's The Big Idea?

The goal of this campaign is to help house Muslim refugees, by sheltering them in our President's egotistical monument to himself, Trump Tower.

By supporting our campaign you're helping make a huge statement - a powerful rebuke to President Trump - while also helping to house the needy, and reminding Americans of their founding creed.

/Important notes/

1. No matter what the outcome of this campaign - all the funds raised will go to helping refugees in America.

2. We will not be renting the unit from The Trump Organization, so your donations will not be benefitting the Trump family.

America was built as a country of immigrants, of refugees, of those seeking out a better and safer life. As the Statue of Liberty says "Give me your tired, your poor, Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, The wretched refuse of your teeming shore, Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"

President Trump has quickly gone to work, attempting to rebuke these ideals that form the bedrock of our nation. His discriminatory ban of refugees (effectively targeting Muslims) from seven nations is especially cruel, and has been implemented with the carelessness that seems to befit his new administration.

Let's show President Trump, and the folks that elected him, that Muslim refugees deserve the right to live in America as much as anyone else. And let's do it by using his own gold festooned tower against him.

Let's Get to Work

We're going to house refugees (ideally a couple or young family), from one of the seven predominantly Muslim countries recently barred from entry to the United States, in Trump Tower.

The President has spent years boasting about the luxurious amenities of this address. Who would be more befitting of those benefits than a refugee who has spent the last months and years of their life fleeing a war torn nation.

  • Rent at Trump Tower starts at $4,950/month. We're raising approximately one year's rent.
  • We'll secure the apartment on behalf of a Muslim refugee (ideally a couple or young family) that's fled one of the seven countries on the President's ban list.
  • Not only does this house them near jobs and opportunities (and, gold elevators) it'll also remind Americans that our country was founded on the premise of being open to everyone.

  • We're taking the utmost care to make sure this project beneficiary is secure, and is someone who is not only comfortable living in Trump Tower (the building seems like it might be full of assholes), but will be comfortable with the media scrutiny such a life may entail.

Ancillary Details

The goal of this campaign is to help house Muslim refugees. If, for some reason, we cannot secure a unit in Trump Tower near the base price ($4,950/mo) we would move on to one of the many other properties that bear his name. Should we fall short of our fundraising goal, or overshoot it, the funds raised will be disbursed to charities and nonprofits that work to assist Muslim migrants in America. 

Won't this help Trump?

Nope! While in a perfect world he would have already sold off Trump Tower (ha!) the available units have long since been purchased from him, and are now owned individually.

What about security?

With round-the-clock NYPD and Secret Service protection, Trump Tower might just be the securest place in New York. Naturally, anyone that chooses to live there, will have to be comfortable with this heavy handed approach, as well as the presence of nearby protestors and gawkers.

What about amenities?

So glad you asked! If there's anyone that should be treated to a 24-hour concierge, doormen, a fitness facility, onsite landscaped atriums, and views of Central Park, it's someone fleeing a war zone of America's making. Let the Wall Street pricks and nou·veau riche live in Westchester!

Who will live in Trump Tower?

As part of our launch, we've been in contact with a number of fantastic nonprofits & advocacy organizations. Of particular note is EmergencyBNB, a service that connects refugees with short-term housing. This way, even if we only raise one month's rent, we'll still be able to provide much needed housing to refugees.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and families. The more people we can get talking about it, the more we can help remind the entire country (there seem to be some slow learners) of the ideals our nation was founded upon.

Thank you so much!
story_txt:
What's The Big Idea?
The goal of this campaign is to help house Muslim refugees, by sheltering them in our President's egotistical monument to himself, Trump Tower.
By supporting our campaign you're helping make a huge statement - a powerful rebuke to President Trump - while also helping to house the needy, and reminding Americans of their founding creed.

/Important notes/
1. No matter what the outcome of this campaign - all the funds raised will go to helping refugees in America.
2. We will not be renting the unit from The Trump Organization, so your donations will not be benefitting the Trump family.

America was built as a country of immigrants, of refugees, of those seeking out a better and safer life. As the Statue of Liberty says "Give me your tired, your poor, Your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, The wretched refuse of your teeming shore, Send these, the homeless, tempest-tost to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!"
President Trump has quickly gone to work, attempting to rebuke these ideals that form the bedrock of our nation. His discriminatory ban of refugees (effectively targeting Muslims) from seven nations is especially cruel, and has been implemented with the carelessness that seems to befit his new administration.
Let's show President Trump, and the folks that elected him, that Muslim refugees deserve the right to live in America as much as anyone else. And let's do it by using his own gold festooned tower against him.

Let's Get to Work
We're going to house refugees (ideally a couple or young family), from one of the seven predominantly Muslim countries recently barred from entry to the United States, in Trump Tower.
The President has spent years boasting about the luxurious amenities of this address. Who would be more befitting of those benefits than a refugee who has spent the last months and years of their life fleeing a war torn nation.

Rent at Trump Tower starts at $4,950/month. We're raising approximately one year's rent.
We'll secure the apartment on behalf of a Muslim refugee (ideally a couple or young family) that's fled one of the seven countries on the President's ban list.
Not only does this house them near jobs and opportunities (and, gold elevators) it'll also remind Americans that our country was founded on the premise of being open to everyone.
We're taking the utmost care to make sure this project beneficiary is secure, and is someone who is not only comfortable living in Trump Tower (the building seems like it might be full of assholes), but will be comfortable with the media scrutiny such a life may entail.


Ancillary Details
The goal of this campaign is to help house Muslim refugees. If, for some reason, we cannot secure a unit in Trump Tower near the base price ($4,950/mo) we would move on to one of the many other properties that bear his name. Should we fall short of our fundraising goal, or overshoot it, the funds raised will be disbursed to charities and nonprofits that work to assist Muslim migrants in America. 
Won't this help Trump?
Nope! While in a perfect world he would have already sold off Trump Tower (ha!) the available units have long since been purchased from him, and are now owned individually.
What about security?
With round-the-clock NYPD and Secret Service protection, Trump Tower might just be the securest place in New York. Naturally, anyone that chooses to live there, will have to be comfortable with this heavy handed approach, as well as the presence of nearby protestors and gawkers.
What about amenities?
So glad you asked! If there's anyone that should be treated to a 24-hour concierge, doormen, a fitness facility, onsite landscaped atriums, and views of Central Park, it's someone fleeing a war zone of America's making. Let the Wall Street pricks and nou·veau riche live in Westchester!
Who will live in Trump Tower?
As part of our launch, we've been in contact with a number of fantastic nonprofits & advocacy organizations. Of particular note is EmergencyBNB, a service that connects refugees with short-term housing. This way, even if we only raise one month's rent, we'll still be able to provide much needed housing to refugees.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends and families. The more people we can get talking about it, the more we can help remind the entire country (there seem to be some slow learners) of the ideals our nation was founded upon.
Thank you so much!

story:
The MSR Community Chlorine Maker is changing lives with just salt, water, a battery, and five minutes’ time. By creating chlorine on the spot, it empowers users to create their own chlorine for drinking water treatment that otherwise would be unavailable or unreliable. But with 1.8 billion people around the world still drinking from a contaminated source, this device is needed now more than ever. Our goal is to deploy 2,500 of these devices by the end of 2017 and get them into the hands of those that need it most, providing safe water treatment for 500,000 people around the globe.  We just need to get them out there. That’s where you come in. Your contribution will help fund the deployment of this life-changing technology to communities who need it desperately. 

The Situation

The World Health Organization estimates 502,000 people around the world die from diarrheal illnesses every year. With just a touch of chlorine those numbers can be reduced drastically. Chlorine is powerful enough to kill disease-causing microbes, preventing illnesses such as cholera, dysentery, and typhoid. The problem is in low resource settings, chlorine is often unavailable or expensive due to the difficulties relating to transport and degradation.

With the Community Chlorine Maker, enough chlorine can be created on the spot to treat up to 200 liters of water in just five minutes. All it takes is a few simple steps.

Salt: A solution of salt and water is mixed before it’s added to the Community Chlorine Maker.

Power: The device is connected to either a 12v battery or wall plug.

Start: At the press of a button, the device begins an electrolysis process, creating chlorine in about five minutes.

Our partners, World Vision and Operation Blessing, are ready, able, and in need of a minimum of 2500 devices to quickly provide water treatment for 500,000 people. With every device sent, we’re able to educate more low-resource communities on how to treat their water, giving them the power to control their own safe drinking water.  

Featured Contribution Perks

For 45 years, MSR has been a leader in outdoor gear design, development and manufacturing. Harnessing this expertise, we’ve been able to leverage our experience and invest in innovation specifically for people in low-resource communities who lack access to basic human needs.  We think the same trusted engineering that creates gear for challenging outdoor environments can find solutions to improve the lives of people struggling to find safe water in remote villages.

To learn more about MSR's impact, visit: http://msrglobalhealth.com.

story:
Please help the Pleasantville Community Garden. 

Your donation is so important for helping our volunteer-run Pleasantville Community Garden make an even greater impact in our community and beyond! Since 2014, we’ve donated nearly 90,000 pounds of fresh food to thousands of people in need across Westchester.  Help us get more food to more people during this very difficult time.  Your donation matters!

Also, did you know, in our continued effort to maximize resources, we’ve also created and launched our How-To Guide – www.pcgguide.org to help other individuals, groups and organizations create their own garden to expand the scope of donated fresh food?!  Everyone deserves fresh food and vegetables and we will keep moving forward to achieve that goal!  Your donation will help us keep that vision alive.

Thank you for your support!

Devin Juros & the Board of Directors of the Pleasantville Community Garden

story:
NB. If using a UK bank card to donate - the system will convert it - so don't be put off please donate!

Our Story

This is a continuation of our campaign to bring out the murky truth behind the glitz and expensive promotion of the Trump golf and housing complex in Aberdeen. On contacting Brian May about the use of Bohemian Rhapsody to highlight the issues, he responded :

I can see there is a horrible example, here, of bullying the defenceless, by a rich man who apparently can buy anyone and anything he wants.  I deplore this kind of abuse and feel greatly for Molly and the others who are being ridden over by a very selfish man.  And what the world certainly does NOT need is more golf courses ! I am disgusted. 

We are a small group of artists creating a new video of Bohemian Rhapsody sung by the amazing 'Spitting Image' style puppet of Donald Trump - those wonderful Spitting Image songs that everyone loved have influenced our idea.  The video has also been inspired by the one which was made by the Muppets.  Puppeteer and Actor, Francis Wright has written the script with appropriate words highlighting some of the issues with satire. Pianist, Dmytro Morykit has arranged the music for piano Tchaikovsky style and filming will take place in January 2012.

This is not an easy time of year to raise funds, but if you are able to contribute even $5 then you will automatically receives updates on the progress and be one of the first to see the video.

The Impact

People need to know the truth behind what has gone on with the Golf and housing complex at Menie and the terrible bullying and harassment which a number of families are continually subjected to by Trump.  With the mass press coverage manipulated by the Trump organisation, very little of the truth is reaching people who would be equally disgusted and ask questions of those in power.


What We Need & What You Get

Our initial campaign allowed us to create the puppet, the lyrics and music for this fantastic video.  We now need to pay for the recording and film studio.  We also need to hire extra equipment for the filming and editing process. The puppet makers, the musician and the puppeteer have all given their professional time for free but there are practical items which have to be paid for and all support is welcome.


Recording and filming will take place in January 2012 and the result will be brilliant, entertaining and people will want to watch it over and over again and pass it on to friends.  This is a great chance to become involved in an event that will highlight an issue which is mirrored elsewhere and causes everyone concern.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word and post on your facebook page and tell as many people as you can.  If you have any suggestions or think you can help in any way, do get in touch.  We have one purpose: to stand with the Menie families against corporate and governmental bullying. The people yielding the power and money think they can ignore a few individuals but perhaps they will listen to Menie voices.

story:
Paul Davis is a wrongfully incarcerated prisoner currently serving time in the Michigan Department of Corrections. In 2004 he was charged and convicted of a homicide he did not commit. The prosecution’s theory was that he shot and killed a man name 'Red' over a bet in a house located in Detroit, Michigan. At the time of the shooting, he was in the city of Taylor, Michigan with several friends hanging out eating and playing video games. There was no physical evidence tying him to the crime. He was given an incompetent attorney who showed signs of Narcolepsy during court proceedings, also failing to investigate and/or provide a proper defense. For the most part, he was in court alone. Defending himself against astute prosecutors and corrupt police officers that had two things in mind: getting a conviction and climbing the ranks in their law enforcement profession.

The lead homicide detective in his case, Ms. Lanesha Jones, became a felon in 2007 due to her role in a police corruption scandal where she assaulted a young woman with a glass bottle. Jones was still allowed to work as a Detroit Police Officer after her conviction. Furthermore, the "Ballistic Expert" in his case, David Pauch, habitually fabricated ballistic reports to confirm the prosecutor's theory of its case against People v Desmond Ricks. Desmond Ricks was exonerated, and his attorney filed a civil action in a federal court. See Ricks v Pauch, 2018 US Dist Lexis 89453 (2018). David Pauch did the same in the cases of People v. Darrell Diggers, who was also exonerated after he proved Mr. Pauch fabricated a false ballistic report. Mr. Diggers later filed a $150 million-dollar lawsuit. Also in Stewart v. Wolfenbarger, 595 f.3d 647, 651-52 ( 6th Cir. 2010) Mr. Pauch did the similar ballistic fabrications in Mr. Davis’ case. Over the years he has relentlessly attempted to prove his innocence.

His first-round appeals were unsuccessful due to xenophobia and his lower-class status. The Michigan and Federal Court system urges a customary “blanket” policy denial to pro se litigants. We now possess new evidence from the mother of the witnesses. Ms. Henry came forth stating that she and her children were coerced by law enforcement (Sgt. Lanesha Jones and Curtis Staples) to give false statements and testimony. She has written letters to Mr. Davis apologizing for helping fabricate evidence against him and signed an affidavit of truth. With your help of donating $1, $5 or more, the $15,000 goal can be reached for Paul Davis to obtain the proper legal counsel. Not only will this assist in presenting the new evidence and unveiling hidden files; it will also prove his innocence.

Please help stop wrongful incarceration and mass incarceration by donating to this Campaign. Please bring awareness to wrongful and mass incarceration by telling your friends, family, business partners, about my situation. Paul Davis only one of the thousands of the wrongfully incareacted  prisoners in the United States.

 

UPDATE:

Donations can only be accepted via desktop/laptop computers. Apologies for the inconvenience.

story:
THREE YEARS AFTER THE HAITI QUAKE LEOGANE TO BECOME POWERFUL EPICENTER FOR REBUILDING AND REGENERATION


Saturday, January 12, 2013 marks three years to the day when the horrific 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti, devastating the country and leaving its people in dire need of help. Immediately following the 2010 quake relief poured in to help the country, but as time has past that help has significantly declined, yet their need for assistance is still massive and urgent.Three years later there are approximately some 370,000 Haitians still residing in unsafe, temporary housing or to be more frank “tent-cities.” These living conditions are still extremely difficult and many people are sadly struggling to survive.

In the wake of the 2010 earthquake Community Leader, Josiah Bruny, who runs the after-school program, Music Changing Lives in Redlands, CA founded the organization Luv for Haiti. Over the past several years Luv for Haiti has provided direct support to the children and families in Leogane, Haiti who reside in dangerous tent-cities, who struggle for food and live in severe poverty. After making several trips to the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere, Josiah and the Luv for Haiti team were deeply touched by the children of New Vision Orphanage in Leogane. The earthquake destroyed what once was a suitable home for these children. There is no running water or electricity and living conditions are primitive. 


Luv for Haiti has chosen the anniversary of the quake to launch a fundraising campaign to build a new orphanage for the 70 children in Leogane, Haiti that currently live in the devastated home now. The orphanage will be built completely of adobe materials, with construction beginning in July of 2013. The total estimated budget for this home is $200,000. These costs encompass building materials, construction, professional expertise, and travel expenses. It also includes the launch of a new apprenticeship program which will certify up to 50 Haitians in the skills needed to help rebuild the nation and establish long-term careers in construction.

However, this is only the beginning of the vision for Luv for Haiti. In Phase I, the orphanage is to be completed by Fall of 2013, Phase II and III will follow, including a new school, community center, church, health clinic, sanitation system and career training center. By the fifth anniversary of the quake the objective is to have a self-sustaining village, complete with new local businesses financed through microlending partners. 


“Our vision is to build a sustainable community in Leogane, Haiti where the Haitian people can build their own eco-homes using natural resources, grow their own crops, create their own energy sources, develop their owns businesses and means for employment, thus improving their overall quality of life.” commented Josiah.

Leogane will, once again, serve as an epicenter, but this time the ripple effect will be for positive change, eventually touching and improving the lives of every Haitian.

Luv for Haiti is currently seeking the support businesses, organizations and individual advocates and ambassadors to help make this temporary home a permanent one for these children. If you would like to become a sponsor, community partner, volunteer or otherwise get involved with Luv for Haiti, please contact Josiah Bruny at 951-992-0721 or visit www.luvforhaiti.com.


No One Can Do Everything, But Everyone Can Do Something.

story:
Summary

  • There's never been a more important time for what Ruka Dopomogy does in Ukraine. Because of the ongoing conflict in eastern Ukraine young people are searching for hope for their future.  In recent months the Ukrainian currency (Hryvnia) has dropped dramatically against the US Dollar (from 8:1 to more than 30:1 at one point) yet income has not increased at all! As a result, summer camp, especially for vulnerable children such as those displaced by the war in the east, is a financial impossibility!
  • Igor Minenko is President of Ruka Dopomogy, a 17 year old Ukrainian Charity Fund (non-profit). RD has trained hundreds of youth workers in churches all over Ukraine how to build Jesus Focused Youth Ministries.  Before leading RD, he was the youth pastor at one of the largest youth ministries in Kiev.  Under his leadership Ruka Dopomogy has sponsored Summer Youth & Children Camps in western Ukraine since 2010. He also serves as the Director of Youth Alpha Course in Ukraine.

What We Need

  •  $29.50 USD will sponsor a child or teenager for one week of summer camp. Last year camp cost 200 Hryvnia  (about $25 USD) per week.  Not expensive, right? Today, that same $25.00 USD = about 600 UAH, and remember, Ukrainian wages have NOT increased. The kids and families we work with, especially displaced children and their families cannot afford a 200% increase. For the amount of money your teenager will spend on snacks and fast food on the way to camp, you can sponsor a Ukrainian Child or Teenager for a week of camp. 
  • Our camp is small but awesome! Our capacity is only about 60 kids per week and because of time limitations at our venue we can only host 3 camps. Expenses are low because facilities are shockingly sparse and Staff pay their own way. There are no salaries! 85% of your donation (85% of $29.50= $25.00) will sponsor a week of camp for a child or teenager. 15% will be shared with International Teams-US, our parent ministry/US 501c3 based in Elgin, Illinois and cover the cost of using Indigogo and/or Paypal.
  • Our goal of $5310 will fully fund all three camps at maximum capacity. If we raise more then International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy will help fund additional ministries with refugee and at-risk children.

The Impact

  • Many of the kids we're ministering with are facing an uncertain future. Many of them have fled their homes in war torn eastern Ukraine and may not ever return. They are stressed and their parents are stressed. You contribution will give them a week of respite in the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains. They'll sleep in tents, they'll hike the mountains, swim the river, and sing around campfires. They'll practice English, they'll play games and participate in competitions. They'll hear the Gospel every day and they'll be loved and cared for by veteran youth workers from among the churches Ruka Dopomogy has trained.
  • 2015 is the fifth year of our camping ministry. Up until last summer we were seeing a lot of "repeat" kids from the churches we've coached. Beginning last summer we started receiving children and teens who were displaced by the war; the need is even greater this summer.

Camp Staff

  • Our camps are staffed with full-time workers from International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy Staff along with volunteers from local and participating churches. This summer a team of "World Racers" (www.worldrace.org) from Canada and the US will serve with us.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word for us through email and all forms of social media.
  • Pray for us.
  • You can donate through Indiegogo to our US parent organization, International Teams. You can also give via Paypal directly to Igor Minenko's account (http://www.paypal.com to "iminenko@ukr.net").

Because of the ongoing conflict in eastern Ukraine young people are searching for hope for their future.  In recent months the Ukrainian currency (Hryvnia) has dropped dramatically against the US Dollar (from 8:1 to more than 30:1 at one point) yet income has not increased at all! As a result, summer camp, especially for vulnerable children such as those displaced by the war in the east, is a financial impossibility!
Igor Minenko is President of Ruka Dopomogy, a 17 year old Ukrainian Charity Fund (non-profit). RD has trained hundreds of youth workers in churches all over Ukraine how to build Jesus Focused Youth Ministries.  Before leading RD, he was the youth pastor at one of the largest youth ministries in Kiev.  Under his leadership Ruka Dopomogy has sponsored Summer Youth & Children Camps in western Ukraine since 2010. He also serves as the Director of Youth Alpha Course in Ukraine.
   What We Need

 $29.50 USD will sponsor a child or teenager for one week of summer camp. Last year camp cost 200 Hryvnia  (about $25 USD) per week.  Not expensive, right? Today, that same $25.00 USD = about 600 UAH, and remember, Ukrainian wages have NOT increased. The kids and families we work with, especially displaced children and their families cannot afford a 200% increase. For the amount of money your teenager will spend on snacks and fast food on the way to camp, you can sponsor a Ukrainian Child or Teenager for a week of camp. 
Our camp is small but awesome! Our capacity is only about 60 kids per week and because of time limitations at our venue we can only host 3 camps. Expenses are low because facilities are shockingly sparse and Staff pay their own way. There are no salaries! 85% of your donation (85% of $29.50= $25.00) will sponsor a week of camp for a child or teenager. 15% will be shared with International Teams-US, our parent ministry/US 501c3 based in Elgin, Illinois and cover the cost of using Indigogo and/or Paypal.
Our goal of $5310 will fully fund all three camps at maximum capacity. If we raise more then International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy will help fund additional ministries with refugee and at-risk children.    The Impact

Many of the kids we're ministering with are facing an uncertain future. Many of them have fled their homes in war torn eastern Ukraine and may not ever return. They are stressed and their parents are stressed. You contribution will give them a week of respite in the foothills of the Carpathian Mountains. They'll sleep in tents, they'll hike the mountains, swim the river, and sing around campfires. They'll practice English, they'll play games and participate in competitions. They'll hear the Gospel every day and they'll be loved and cared for by veteran youth workers from among the churches Ruka Dopomogy has trained. 2015 is the fifth year of our camping ministry. Up until last summer we were seeing a lot of "repeat" kids from the churches we've coached. Beginning last summer we started receiving children and teens who were displaced by the war; the need is even greater this summer.    Camp Staff  Our camps are staffed with full-time workers from International Teams and Ruka Dopomogy Staff along with volunteers from local and participating churches. This summer a team of "World Racers" (www.worldrace.org) from Canada and the US will serve with us.    Other Ways You Can Help  Spread the word for us through email and all forms of social media.
Pray for us.
You can donate through Indiegogo to our US parent organization, International Teams. You can also give via Paypal directly to Igor Minenko's account (http://www.paypal.com to "iminenko@ukr.net").

story: I live in a small town. A very small town. In that town is an elderly man who has difficulty walking due to a degenerative disease and lives only a short distance from the library. He used to ride his lawnmower on the side of the road to get there, but not anymore. A couple decided that he was a danger to the town, called the cops, and told them he was causing a hazard for traffic. What traffic? At most there are 5 cars in front of the library at one time. The police came out and threatened to arrest him if he ever rode his lawnmower to the library again. He now hobbles to and from wearing a leg brace and using a cane. Please help fund this campaign to get a vehicle that is legal that he can use to get to the library.

story:
* Please note, I've also accepted some cash donations en route, and so there's an additional £80 on top of the figure from Indiegogo. *

As many of you know, in September 2015 I will have been in the UK for five years. This means I can apply for "indefinite leave to remain". I need to sit the "Life in the UK" test (£50), and then apply and pay the application fee of £1900.

I've chosen to be here in the UK, yes. That's my choice. But I've also chosen a career path that offers much to the community around me, and now I'm asking that community to help me raise the funds in order to continue to do what I do. I;

1) I work as a professional dancer. I'm committed to exploring, growing and developing my craft. It's a career that offers the chance to raise questions, provoke deeper thinking and challenge audiences to think beyond the mundane. In such a fast paced society today, dance, and indeed art in general has a large role to play to continue to evoke thoughts, feelings and the imagination of the public. Despite what life today may hold, we have the capacity to feel and reflect and indeed reach a higher place.

I've toured to small village halls with Plan B, to the Unicorn Theatre in London with Stillmotion, to the visual art works of Kelly Nipper and Pablo Bronstein in Tramway Glasgow and ICA London, to the walkabout work of Mischief La-Bas. This is not work undertaken and not being seen, this is work that is being seen and is being valued. It is important.

2) I Co-Direct @TheGlasgowJam, Glasgow's jam and contact improvisation scene. I have been instrumental in developing this form in Scotland, and in 2015 helped to mentor seven aspiring facilitators to grow further as supported by Creative Scotland.
theglasgowjam.blogspot.co.uk
For example, this year has seen outreach work to bring our work to a family settings, to see children and adults dancing together in a free, creative manner. This is the work of @TheGlasgowJam, and this is my work. This is what I bring to Scotland, to the UK.

Please remember, to be in the UK thus far, I have spent AUS$800 on my initial visa to come here. Last year I spent a further £1000 on another visa and now I need to find another large sum in order to stay here, permanently. Please bear in mind that the application fee of £1900 represents a HUGE chunk of my income.

And that's an income drawn from dance work, art work, community work. It's work that directly feeds and stimulates us a society, and work that doesn't always have a figure value on it.

I am asking for £2100, to cover the application fee, the fee to sit the "Life in the UK" test, and to cover the fee taken by Indigogo and banks for transactions along the way.

Thank you, and your support is very much appreciated.


Photo donated by Sean Purser from Cottier Dance Project.

story:
This fundraiser is an initial effort to honor Caylee's memory by establishing Caylee's Heart Foundation. Thus, in lieu of gifts or other acts of kindness, the family respectfully asks that a contribution be made to ensure that Justice 4 Caylee and others. 
Proceeds from the Caylee's Heart Memorial Fundraiser will be awarded to the Hall family to help with looming funeral expenses from a loan the family had to take out for Caylee's services, medical bills, loss of income,and lifestyle alterations.
About the CHF Memorial Fund.
Caylee's family has sought a method for contributing to other families in need. Accordingly, the CHF Memorial Fund will serve to educate, collect and distribute financial contributions, and share the story of Caylee and others that didn't receive proper medical care. Some proceeds from the Caylee's Heart Foundation Memorial Fundraiser will be used the start and fund the Caylee's Heart Foundation(or CHF) a charity organization that funds research, education, care and awareness campaigns aimed to prevent ,Hospital Negligence and bring awareness to a rare form of heart diseases myocarditis.
The administrators of the CHF Memorial Fund are honored to sponsor this fundraiser for the family of Caylee Hall. 
While this gift may not ease the pain of such a devasting and unfortunate loss, hopefully it will assist Timika Hall and the Hall Family as they travel on their path to Justice and helping other families. Please share Caylee's Heart !!  
 
  
So many people are asking for Caylee’s story and here goes…..On Aug 21st, Caylee’s father took her to the army hospital ER cause she had been sick throughout the night. He was told that Caylee had a virus cause there was a virus going around and she “must” have it too. NO LAB WORK OR IV FLUIDS were given to her. She progressively worse throughout the day and mommy instincts just told me that something wasnt right. So going with my gut and the advice of my sister in law we took Caylee back to the ER. Well Caylee was gone within an hour of being back in the ER. Caylee was treated like a kid with a common cold. No urgency and as a matter of fact she NEVER got evaluated by the nurse cause he said he didnt want to cause the doc was going to come and do it again. As we were sitting in the room waiting for a doc to come Caylee passed out. I rushed to the nurses station and told them that Caylee had passed out and that we needed a doc asap! They just gave me the blankest stares but no one came to help us. I returned to the room to find Caylee in her dads arm and he was trying to keep her alert by rubbing her back and calling her name….well it didnt work. Caylee went totally limp like a rag doll. I went BACK to the nurses station again and told them that Caylee had passed out and that we needed a doctor….NO ONE CAME!! By the time the doctor and nurse made it to the room my princess had taken her last breath. I saw my baby eyes open the widest I had seen them open in 2 days….I saw life leaving my baby and as a mommy I couldn't help her. The people we trusted to help her didn't and now they are trying to cover up her death. My husband and I watched our baby die and not a sole in the hospital helped her until it was to late. I plan on fighting !! No parent should have to endure what we’ve gone through. No parent should ever be paranoid about taking there child to the ER….no parent!

story:
GOAL: 10000 SUPPORTERS WITH 1$ EACH

The short story of a country hijacked by corrupted political parties

On June 23, 2013 Albania holds national elections. Nowadays Albanian citizens are called by political parties to vote for the lesser evil. They are offered to vote for the current government coalition that has a history of corruption, oppression and killing of protesters, or to vote for the opposition coalition that has a history of corrupted leaders.

In Albania there is no free media. Every media operator is controlled by opposition political parties or the government. The organized crime has very strong ties with the government and opposition parties and is used to a great extend before elections to fund campaigns and to threaten opponents. Most of the international aid focused on democratization goes to N G Os that are directly or indirectly serving the interests of political parties. Any free grassroots citizen movement is attacked and discouraged.

Citizens are oppressed by the government and opposition political parties. All individuals that work for the public administration of the central or local government are obliged to attend & support the electoral campaign of the government or the opposition. As a result electoral campaigns of all parties are attended & supported by thousands of people that are threatened to lose their job if they do not obey to the party of the central government or the parties of the opposition.

 

The protest camp on June 21, 2013

Albanian politicians claim that Albanian citizens support corrupted political parties by voting for them. To show that Albanian citizens disagree with the corrupted political system installed in the country and are not willing to vote for the lesser evil, on June 21, 2013 (36 hours before election day) a protest camp will be set up at the center of Tirana.

https://www.facebook.com/events/153589218155571

story:
#MEAction is a global health network advocating for people with Myalgic Encephalomyelitis, an often misunderstood neuroimmune disease affecting millions.

We need to raise $100,000 through this Indiegogo campaign to support our work for the remainder of the year to expand our reach, build community, increase our advocacy, educate doctors and scientists, and inspire new researchers and clinicians to join the field. Here is what your support can help us achieve.

REACH ME

We're working hard to gain mass and strategic recognition of ME as a debilitating disease suffered by millions by engaging press and developing a wide variety of multimedia education tools.

You support helps us create short-form educational videos and infographics to make it easier than ever to raise awareness, dispel myths, and help patients find diagnosis. It also helps support an ongoing press and communications strategy to keep ME in the spotlight and increase public pressure for change.

CONNECT ME

We're growing a thriving community of support, friendship, fun, creativity, and purpose.

You can help us grow a community of peer support and activism, build better tools for connecting volunteers with worthy projects, and support community initiatives like our literary magazine and BedFest.

Whoever we once were in our lives before illness – scientists, nurses, artists, parents – we still have so much to give one another and the world. We believe fostering greater connection is a good unto itself, one that improves quality of life, but also builds our capacity to create and take action together in order to save our lives.

ADVOCATE with ME

We're mobilizing patients and allies to advocate for more public investment in research, public awareness, and medical education. Our emphasis is local, strategic action in order to build, our time, our capacity for national impact. 

Your support will help us build a new suite of tools for local organizers; grow our network of local, state/provincial and national groups; support our events and petitions tools; add a new contact Congress and Parliament tool; and help us keep supporting the work of amazing patient advocates engaging with a variety government institutions including the US Congress, National Institutes of Health, the Centers for Disease Control, CFSAC, the UK Parliament and much more.

EDUCATE ME

We're doing outreach to doctors, nurses and other health professionals to encourage empathetic, knowledgeable care for all.

Your support will help our efforts to deepen and expand Unrest as a tool for medical education and outreach. Unrest has already screened at many medical schools around the world, but now through a new partnership with the American Medical Women's Association, we have an opportunity to accredit the film for continuing medical education and build a medical school curriculum around it. We then hope to work with local organizations around the world to adapt and translate these curricula and materials for other national contexts as we expand screenings of in medical and nursing schools across the US and around the world.

INSPIRE ME

We want to inspire a new generation of researchers to join this field.

Your support will help us to expand and improve MEpedia and bring new students into the project, including budding neuroscientists and immunologists; launch a quarterly newsletter for clinicians and researchers summarizing the latest science, conferences and funding opportunities; build new partnerships with related disease organizations; support network-building efforts between ME researchers and scientists in related fields; and our collaborations with existing research organizations to link all of our outreach efforts to their incredible work.

SHARE

We understand if you aren't currently able to donate. This disease robs so many of us of our ability to survive, let alone earn a living. Even if you can't support MEAction financially, there are so many ways you can help support the movement: share this campaign on social media or by email, tell friends about it, or join, start or share a  #MillionsMissing Protest on May 12th 2018 www.millionsmissing.org.

FB: https://www.facebook.com/MEActNet/videos/2091577217791340

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MEActNet/status/989577209537904640

We cannot thank you enough for all you do for #MEAction. Help us continue this fight!

OUR BUDGET 

$100,000 is a big goal but these are also ambitious plans! Our 2018 budget is $300,000, of which we have raised $140,000.

Even if we meet our crowdfunding goal, that alone will obviously not be enough to achieve all of this vision, many of which involve multi-year projects and program. But it will go a long way toward helping us take some important first steps and build on all of the success and impact of this last year. And as ever, the more we are able to raise, the more we can do.

You can read more about our financials here.

Live in the UK? You can also support our efforts to hire a full-time UK team member for advocacy & outreach here.

REWARDS

All rewards will ship in July 2018 (earlier if we can!). MEAction is a 501(c)(3) organization. All rewards are tax-deductible, minus the value of any tangible rewards. Rewards may be slightly different in appearance than the images shown. 

OUR TEAM

Learn more about our team here.

story:
The Time Is Now!

The case against Rowan Bailey—the traditional midwife who was arrested in March 2013 in Asheville, North Carolina, and charged with felony murder of an unborn child, felony obtaining property by false pretense (in other words, working as a midwife without a license), and felony obstruction of justice (not keeping medical records)—is moving forward.  Rowan was indicted on August 5, 2013, on all three counts, and her next court appearance is set for September 3rd, 2013, when her arraignment & the trial dates will be set.

This case has the potential to secure or trample on women’s reproductive rights in North Carolina and throughout the United States.  If Rowan is found guilty, women everywhere will be told that they are not the ultimate decision-makers in their pregnancies and/or their births.  If Rowan is found not guilty, women everywhere will know that they are the ultimate decision-makers in choosing how, when, where, and with whom they give birth.  Whether you are a mother or not, midwife or not, woman or not—if you believe that women and families have the basic human civil right of choosing their care providers and the right to refuse medical treatments—this is your chance to get involved!

This case will set precedent for EVERY state in the U.S.!  We have an opportunity to bring dignity, beauty and choice to the birth world.

Certified Nurse Midwives, Certified Professional Midwives, and unlicensed or traditional midwives all need each other.  We need everyone who serves women during their childbearing years to come together to fill the gaps in our maternity care system.

Please donate NOW to ensure that Rowan has the best legal team for her case.  It will make all the difference!!

Case History

Wednesday, March 27, 2013, a friend, teacher, mentor, and fellow midwife, Rowan Bailey, was arrested for murder in Asheville, North Carolina. North Carolina prohibits the practice of midwifery by traditional community midwives and Certified Professional Midwives (CPMs). After serving 14 days in jail and then released on $150,000 bail, Rowan remains on house arrest with a GPS monitor.

Pregnancy and birth are the most natural processes in the human experience.  This process has been supported, facilitated, and protected since the dawn of civilization by the midwife.  Today, in the United States, more than 98% of all births occur in a hospital setting: a medical facility.  Just under 2% of births occur out of the hospital, and approximately 1% of births occur at home with a midwife.  We inherently have rights to choose who, where, and how we birth.  For some of us, medical practitioners and surgeons are not the “who, where, and how” we choose. 

  • The United States ranks poorly among industrialized nations in maternal and infant deaths.  Babies die in the hospital all the time.  These numbers are unacceptable, yet they persist despite the fact that the U.S. spends the most money in the world on birth technology and interventions.
  • Midwives provide a choice in birth for families who want less medical intervention, and who want to preserve birth as a rite of passage and a natural bodily process.
  • The way we birth is a HUMAN RIGHTS issue and we must embrace it with compassion, love, and responsibility. 

To learn more about Birth as a Human Rights Issue, please go to http://www.humanrightsinchildbirth.com/

 

Your Midwives Need Your Support Now!

 •   Rowan Bailey, arrested for MURDER, needs a legal defense team who believes in and understands reproductive/birth/human rights. 

 •   The law under which she was arrested is  

http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/Sessions/2011/Bills/House/PDF/H215v1.pdf

 •   Your funds will go directly to Rowan's Legal Fund Account to pay for her legal defense and expenses.

*Any funds raised over and above the campaign amount will be donated to Human Rights In Childbirth.  Any funds that are not used (if the case does not go to trial, etc), will be donated to Human Rights in Childbirth.  Please read more about this organization at http://www.humanrightsinchildbirth.com/. 

 

Where will it stop?

If we allow one midwife to be tried and convicted for murder, where will it stop?

•   Murder is the intentional loss of life; acting in order to destroy life.

•   Midwives, the keepers of the sacred in birth, are called to protect the rights of mothers and babies. 

•   Women and families are responsible for choosing their birth attendants and their place of birth. 

•   If we allow our freedoms in birth to be taken away, what freedom is next?

 

Get Involved

 •   Please send this campaign out to your communities, your families, and your midwives. 

•   Please send thoughts and prayers to all midwives who are in service to families around the world. 

Thank you for your continued support and for donating to this important case!

  

Friends of Rowan Bailey
story_txt:
The Time Is Now!
The case against Rowan Bailey—the traditional midwife who was arrested in March 2013 in Asheville, North Carolina, and charged with felony murder of an unborn child, felony obtaining property by false pretense (in other words, working as a midwife without a license), and felony obstruction of justice (not keeping medical records)—is moving forward.  Rowan was indicted on August 5, 2013, on all three counts, and her next court appearance is set for September 3rd, 2013, when her arraignment & the trial dates will be set.
This case has the potential to secure or trample on women’s reproductive rights in North Carolina and throughout the United States.  If Rowan is found guilty, women everywhere will be told that they are not the ultimate decision-makers in their pregnancies and/or their births.  If Rowan is found not guilty, women everywhere will know that they are the ultimate decision-makers in choosing how, when, where, and with whom they give birth.  Whether you are a mother or not, midwife or not, woman or not—if you believe that women and families have the basic human civil right of choosing their care providers and the right to refuse medical treatments—this is your chance to get involved!
This case will set precedent for EVERY state in the U.S.!  We have an opportunity to bring dignity, beauty and choice to the birth world.
Certified Nurse Midwives, Certified Professional Midwives, and unlicensed or traditional midwives all need each other.  We need everyone who serves women during their childbearing years to come together to fill the gaps in our maternity care system.
Please donate NOW to ensure that Rowan has the best legal team for her case.  It will make all the difference!!
Case History
Wednesday, March 27, 2013, a friend, teacher, mentor, and fellow midwife, Rowan Bailey, was arrested for murder in Asheville, North Carolina. North Carolina prohibits the practice of midwifery by traditional community midwives and Certified Professional Midwives (CPMs). After serving 14 days in jail and then released on $150,000 bail, Rowan remains on house arrest with a GPS monitor.
Pregnancy and birth are the most natural processes in the human experience.  This process has been supported, facilitated, and protected since the dawn of civilization by the midwife.  Today, in the United States, more than 98% of all births occur in a hospital setting: a medical facility.  Just under 2% of births occur out of the hospital, and approximately 1% of births occur at home with a midwife.  We inherently have rights to choose who, where, and how we birth.  For some of us, medical practitioners and surgeons are not the “who, where, and how” we choose. 

The United States ranks poorly among industrialized nations in maternal and infant deaths.  Babies die in the hospital all the time.  These numbers are unacceptable, yet they persist despite the fact that the U.S. spends the most money in the world on birth technology and interventions.
Midwives provide a choice in birth for families who want less medical intervention, and who want to preserve birth as a rite of passage and a natural bodily process.
The way we birth is a HUMAN RIGHTS issue and we must embrace it with compassion, love, and responsibility. 

To learn more about Birth as a Human Rights Issue, please go to http://www.humanrightsinchildbirth.com/
 
Your Midwives Need Your Support Now!
 •   Rowan Bailey, arrested for MURDER, needs a legal defense team who believes in and understands reproductive/birth/human rights.  
 •   The law under which she was arrested is  
http://www.ncga.state.nc.us/Sessions/2011/Bills/House/PDF/H215v1.pdf
 •   Your funds will go directly to Rowan's Legal Fund Account to pay for her legal defense and expenses.
*Any funds raised over and above the campaign amount will be donated to Human Rights In Childbirth.  Any funds that are not used (if the case does not go to trial, etc), will be donated to Human Rights in Childbirth.  Please read more about this organization at http://www.humanrightsinchildbirth.com/.  
 
Where will it stop?
If we allow one midwife to be tried and convicted for murder, where will it stop?
•   Murder is the intentional loss of life; acting in order to destroy life.
•   Midwives, the keepers of the sacred in birth, are called to protect the rights of mothers and babies. 
•   Women and families are responsible for choosing their birth attendants and their place of birth. 
•   If we allow our freedoms in birth to be taken away, what freedom is next?
 
Get Involved
 •   Please send this campaign out to your communities, your families, and your midwives. 
•   Please send thoughts and prayers to all midwives who are in service to families around the world. 
Thank you for your continued support and for donating to this important case!
  
Friends of Rowan Bailey

story:
On August 16, 2021 Dr. Jeannie Stone, RISD Superintendent, published a YouTube video. In this video she informs students, staff and visitors that RISD will REQUIRE masks on campuses. We wholeheartedly DISAGREE with this MANDATE. Dr Stone duty is to uphold the laws of the land and Gov. Abbott and the Supreme Court have ruled in favor of NO MASK MANDATES. This is a slippery slope that we feel will lead to more government mandates. We have had enough and want our freedom back. We support any person who feels they want to wear a mask but we vehemently support removing the mandate.

This campaign is raising funds to challenge the legality of Dr. Stones decision to mandate mask wearing at RISD schools. Warren Norred is leading our case and we can't do this without your support.

100% of what you donate is to fund the legal battle we have begun.

Here is a great article to help you understand what we are fighting for.....

https://www.city-journal.org/masking-children-u...

story:
END of the PROJECT

In July 2015, the Lebanese army evacuated 95 Syrian refugee camps in the coastal area North of Tripoli. The living conditions of Syrians in the country have become all the more desperate:

“We can’t return to Syria. Lebanon doesn’t want us. We have nothing left to do but throw ourselves at sea.”

Once having witnessed the evacuation of some of the camps, the residents of Al-Rabia have taken the decision to flee to Turkey. In light of this, the “Spring Camp” project can no longer be realized.

Because of the “flexible funding” mode chosen at the launch of this crowdfunding campaign, we have no way of declining or automatically reimbursing all of the contributions that have been made, nor can we interrupt the campaign before the set date of August 19th.

We have decided to keep all collected funds in order to pay for the land's rent for 2016/17.  Reimbursing all of those who may wish to have their donations back is important to us. In order to enable us to do so, please send us an email at this adress: intothewildance@gmail.com.

FINE del PROGETTO

Nel mese di luglio l’esercito libanese ha sgombrato 95 campi di profughi siriani nella regione costiera a Nord di Tripoli. Le condizioni di vita dei profughi siriani in Libano sono diventate sempre più dure e disperate:

“In Siria non possiamo tornare. In Libano non ci vogliono. Non ci rimane che buttarci a mare.”

Dopo aver assistito agli sgomberi di alcuni insediamenti la maggioranza degli abitanti del campo ha deciso di trasferirsi in Turchia. In queste condizioni il progetto “Campo Primavera” perde di senso.

A causa della modalità di raccolta fondi scelta all’inizio della campagna di crowdfunding non ci è possibile rimborsare automaticamente tutti coloro che hanno contribuito e non ci è possibile chiudere la campagna prima del termine previsto (19 agosto). Abbiamo deciso di conservare i fondi raccolti per poter pagare l'affitto della terra su cui sorge il campo per l'anno 2016/17.

Provvederemo a rimborsare chiunque lo desideri, ma per farlo vi preghiamo di scriverci a intothewildance@gmail.com.

Qui il portavoce del Campo Primavera che spiega perché hanno deciso di lasciare il Libano.



WHAT / The project

                                                                           ITALIANO

We are collecting funds to help Syrian refugees build at least 1 house + 1 lavatory /restroom facility in their camp (Mukhayyam al-Rabia / Spring camp, Lebanon). These will be built in straw & mud, a technique that is eco-friendly, low-cost and traditional both in Syria and Lebanon. Houses built this way are safe, comfortable and graceful.

If we are able to raise the money that we need to complete constructions, the Syrian refugees living inside the camp: 

  1. will have a common place to stay - inhabitable, fresh during summer and warm in winter,
  2. will have access to restrooms and basic plumbing infrastructure, for themselves and a neighbouring camp,
  3. will have a source of income from labour that would enable them to renew the land’s rent for the next year, and
  4. will master a low-cost and eco-friendly building technique, and own the necessary tools to keep building on thier own.


WHY / Story of the project

"As you start to walk on the way, the way appears" [Rumi]


The idea of building houses in mud and straw for a refugee camp occured to Giovanni about 1 year ago, after having spent one night in a hostel built in mud & straw. These houses are traditional feature of cities in both Syria and Lebanon: the center of Damascus is built this way.


The Ecolodge Hostel in Taanayel (Beqaa Valley, Lebanon)

From March to May of 2014 Giovanni lived with volunteers of the Italian NGO Operazione Colomba in the Syrian refugee camps situated in the North of Lebanon. They got to know a large Syrian family that had escaped from Homs, after a 1 year-long siege of their district. Their homes were destroyed, and they were forced to flee the country. These people had been living in shacks made of wood, plastic or cardboard for over 2 years.

In the hostel Giovanni had bought a manual outlining the traditional mud & straw building technique, and he showed it to the inhabitants of the camp. The clan’s matriarch told him that before marrying and moving to Homs she lived in the countryside, where her family had built in this way the home where she grew up.

"Her story fascinated me, and I started thinking that it would be great that these people, who had lost their homes to bombs, could build new homes for themselves with their own hands – homes that are healthy, comfortable, graceful and eco-friendly"

In mid-April of 2015, Giovanni contacted these families again. They were struggling to pay the land's rent, because funding they were receiving until that moment had stopped. After managing to pay the land's rent until April 2016 through donations, thogheter we decided that it was worth starting to work on this project.

As many Syrian refugees in Lebanon, the inhabitants of al-Rabia camp are now struggling to simply survive and offer something to their children. This project is a way to improve the living contitions of these people and create something good out of the war in Syria.

If this project will succeed, 65 people could keep living in the settlement until April 2017, they will have a confortable common space and common restrooms and lavatories, and they will learn a building technique that they could reuse on thier own.


This will be possible if 500 people could contribute with 10 UDS each.

     If this sounds good to you, please help us.

"So a key could stay forever where its creator put it and never be used to open the lock it was made for"  [Wittgenstein]


               More about the project:

ENGLISH:  http://mukhayyamalrabia.weebly.com
ITALIANO: http://campoprimavera.weebly.com


     With great pleasure we do thank everyone for any help: contributions, advices, comments & ideas_
