story:
Hello Indiegogo!


My name is Dan Gallant.  Last year my wife, Krystyn Gallant, and I became the directors of Camp Marcella.  This camp is dedicated to children who are blind and/or visually impaired.  Camp Marcella has also offered special weeks designated to campers who were affected by Superstorm Sandy, as well as economically challenged families.  My wife and I are both tied to this community and are very much a part of it.  We both have vision impairments and have benefitted from this very program when we were young.  Camp Marcella was established in 1947 where these campers came up and actually slept in tents and camped for a week.  It has been around and grown since then.  We offer these children the chance to have a unique experience of the outdoors with other children just like them.  They learn that they are not limited by their disabilities just that they may have to approach things in a different way.  Last summer's experience was a smashing success.  More can be read about it here: 

http://njlions.org/index.php/press-room/news/1-press-room/383-this-was-the-best-summer-we-ever-had-at-camp-marcella


Here's were you come in indiegogo.  As has been the trend, philanthropic groups are finding that they have less and less to give.  These groups just don't have the resources they used to have.  The NJ Lions have been doing most of the funding for all these years but they cannot do it alone.  Camp Marcella is able to have upwards of 80 campers a week.  In this digital age of crowd-funded projects Camp Marcella, as an organization, needs to reach out to you to help fund this life-changing project.  

What we need:

We are trying to raise camper sponsorships to allow many of our economically-challenged campers to attend camp.  These children need your help.  There are so many deserving children whose families are under great hardship and are unable send them despite knowing that one summer at Camp Marcella can change their lives for the better.  The cost per camper per week is $1,050 and although that is far less than other comparable for-profit camps with the same amenities the take-away from Camp Marcella for these kids is like nothing else in the tri-state area.  

Your tax deductible donations will go directly to the children/campers.  If we reach our fundraising goal Camp Marcella will sponsor an additional 10 financially-challenged campers to attend.  If we do not reach our goal we will still put your donations directly to this purpose and give partial scholarships to as many campers as we can.  Also if we should be so fortunate to exceed our goal we will fund even more in-need campers.  We have some unique and very special perks please read on and check them out.  

Help us Change Lives

These experiences are life changing.  We should know, we went here as young people.  My wife and I would not have had the skills, self-confidence, and self-assurance to interact with the world at large despite our handicap were it not for our time spent as campers, then counselors, then directors of Camp Marcella.  

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!  We need all the help we can get.  If you cannot donate please spread the word to your families, friends, co-workers, and communities.  Churches, service organizations, philanthropic groups of all types and sizes, anyone who might help these children.  Perhaps post it to bulletin boards, and social media sites.  Finally, if you are local to the Camp Marcella area in Rockaway, NJ and can donate a few hours of your time and skills; we need help  upgrading and maintaining our buildings and grounds to get ready for our campers.  We can put you in touch with groups who work on these projects.  


So let's get started Indiegogo and get this project funded!!

story:
Hey all! We've have started a little charity (called 416 Bags - https://www.facebook.com/areacodebags) based on giving out backpacks filled with gloves, toques, toothbrushes, deodorant, and other kinds of useful stuff to homeless and disadvantaged people across the GTA. 

We were inspired by this video, so check it out to get a sense of what we’re doing: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6fkyf9UGAE   We’ve given out a small bunch of these bags and gotten some really positive feedback, so we thought we would see if we could gather some donations to put together and distribute more. 
Our goal right now is to reach $1000, which is the equivalent of about 50+ bags. If you’d like to help, please donate!   Thanks all!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word to your friends!
  • Follow us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/416Bags) and on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/areacodebags)

story:
Bringing the Tibetan story to life

Tibet is a country that has been living under China's brutal occupation for over 65 years, but do people actually know this?

Tibet has been independently rated as the second-worst place on Earth for human rights abuses, lack of freedom and government oppression, with only Syria receiving a worse score. This means that the situation on the ground in Tibet is worse than North Korea, Saudi Arabia or Somalia, yet it receives nowhere near the levels of international attention that these places do. 

According to our research, knowledge of Tibet is sorely lacking in the public sphere. Tibet is not the mainstream issue it once was and, with China's limitless resources to fund their ongoing propaganda campaign, we need to keep up by continually renewing our message for the modern world. For the sake of the millions of Tibetans who are suffering every day, we have to show people the truth.

Why make an animated film?

Though Free Tibet is constantly out campaigning in the real world, this can only take us so far. We can't persuade everyone if we do it one conversation at a time, and a film can reach people that we can't. We can screen the film in places that we cannot be ourselves. Also, in order to really spark a global movement, we must take advantage of the internet. We already have a very active online presence, but research shows that the absolute best way to capture people's attention is through video.

One simple film, if done well, can propagate like wildfire. As it spreads from person to person, so too do the ideas it espouses. But this only works if the film is so good that people who see it feel compelled to share it. It has to stand up as a beautiful piece of art in its own right. By using animation, we can hire fantastic artists and storytellers to ensure that our short film is poignant, compelling and captivating. China does a very good job of preventing any footage which shows them in a bad light from ever leaving Tibet, but our animation team can create their own powerful imagery to make an audience connect with the issues.

What do we need and how we will use it?

We are asking for £10,000 to fund our short film. The money raised will allow us to hire experienced and talented people to make our film truly incredible. Apart from paying for the animators to design and draw all the visuals, we will also need to fund a screenwriter to help with the story and script, buy original music for the film's score, hire sound designers, and work with voice over artists.

What impact will the video have?

If done right, the impact of this animated short film could be immense. Using Free Tibet's vast online presence (via our social media, website and mailing list) we have immediate access to hundreds of thousands of supporters to get the ball rolling. Once they have started sharing, the growth and viewership can be exponential. Beyond this, we can host screenings and submit the video for film festivals and animation awards. Each time the video is featured or covered in media, that too will raise the profile of the Tibetan issue.

We could get the story of Tibet in front of millions of people who may not have heard it before. Even if only a small number of those people go on to become supporters, this could represent a marked shift in levels of support for Tibet world-wide.

 

FAQs

Why do you need a crowdfunding campaign to run this?

We’re not a large organisation and manage our resources very carefully. We simply don't have the skills and expertise to create a video of this quality in-house, and we don't have the budget to fund it on our own. 

What will the video actually be about?

We are already hard at work on the script and design of the final product, but the fact is we can't truly answer that question until we know our budget. The more money we make the longer the video can be, the more we can spend on hiring writers to flesh out the story, and the more complex and professional the animation work can be.  What we can tell you, is that it will be an emotional, character-driven story, that will also get across the basic knowledge of Tibet that people need to know.

What if you raise more than the target?

If we raise more than the £10,000 target every penny will be spent to make the film bigger and better.

What if you raise less than £10,000?

We will still use the money we raise to make an animation. It might be simpler or shorter than planned, but we will still ensure it achieves maximum impact.

How do I send my details for receiving perks?

We will send you your perks using the email and/or address you provide when making your donation. Please email andrew@freetibet.org if you prefer we use a different address or contact.

When will the film be completed?

Again, it is difficult to say as the amount raised will determine the scale and complexity of the final product. However, as a rough estimate, we hope to have the film finished within 6 months.

Can I donate in a currency other than British Pounds?

You can donate using your credit card from anywhere in the world using Indiegogo's secure system or PayPal, with amounts converted from your currency into GBP using the current exchange rate. Your credit card company may charge you a currency conversion fee.
story_txt: Bringing the Tibetan story to lifeTibet is a country that has been living under China's brutal occupation for over 65 years, but do people actually know this?Tibet has been independently rated as the second-worst place on Earth for human rights abuses, lack of freedom and government oppression, with only Syria receiving a worse score. This means that the situation on the ground in Tibet is worse than North Korea, Saudi Arabia or Somalia, yet it receives nowhere near the levels of international attention that these places do. According to our research, knowledge of Tibet is sorely lacking in the public sphere. Tibet is not the mainstream issue it once was and, with China's limitless resources to fund their ongoing propaganda campaign, we need to keep up by continually renewing our message for the modern world. For the sake of the millions of Tibetans who are suffering every day, we have to show people the truth.Why make an animated film?Though Free Tibet is constantly out campaigning in the real world, this can only take us so far. We can't persuade everyone if we do it one conversation at a time, and a film can reach people that we can't. We can screen the film in places that we cannot be ourselves. Also, in order to really spark a global movement, we must take advantage of the internet. We already have a very active online presence, but research shows that the absolute best way to capture people's attention is through video.One simple film, if done well, can propagate like wildfire. As it spreads from person to person, so too do the ideas it espouses. But this only works if the film is so good that people who see it feel compelled to share it. It has to stand up as a beautiful piece of art in its own right. By using animation, we can hire fantastic artists and storytellers to ensure that our short film is poignant, compelling and captivating. China does a very good job of preventing any footage which shows them in a bad light from ever leaving Tibet, but our animation team can create their own powerful imagery to make an audience connect with the issues.What do we need and how we will use it?We are asking for £10,000 to fund our short film. The money raised will allow us to hire experienced and talented people to make our film truly incredible. story:
Help us keep Palestinian families together!

  • Saida met her husband when he came to Ramallah to work as a business consultant.
  • Saleh met his wife while he was working in Jordan.
  • Christo met his wife Heather when she came to Ramallah to teach at the music conservatory where he also teaches.

Every family has its own unique story. What these families share is the constant fear that they will not be able to continue living together in the West Bank.

International law guarantees every human being the basic right to live with their family in safety and dignity.

Yet Israel refuses to grant the foreign spouses of Palestinians the right to live with them in the West Bank. Nominally, the Palestinian Authority is responsible for processing applications for family unification, but in fact, all applications have to be approved by Israel. Since 2000, Israel has frozen the review of Palestinian family unification requests. As a result, foreign spouses, and in some cases children, live in the West Bank with short-term visitors' permits or with no legal status at all.

Without a residency permit, they live in a constant state of uncertainty and instability. They cannot work legally or get a drivers' license. Every time they are stopped at an Israeli checkpoint they run the risk of arrest and deportation.

This is what happened to Ma'an, whose father is Palestinian and mother is from South America. He has been in immigration detention for almost two years! Israel is trying to deport him, although he has lived in the West Bank since he was a toddler. His family unification request, submitted in 2007, was never reviewed by Israel, which therefore considers him an illegal alien.

HaMoked is advocating on behalf of these families – normal people whose only wish is to live together, without fear of separation and deportation. Through individual legal advocacy, one family at a time, we aim to change this discriminatory policy.

Join our struggle to ensure the right to family life for West Bank Palestinians and their foreign spouses.

 

About HaMoked:

HaMoked has thirty years of experience advocating for Palestinians' rights within the Israeli legal system. We provide free legal aid and other assistance to some 8,000 Palestinians each year: locating family members in detention, challenging restrictions on movement, defending residency rights and combating collective punishment. Despite the difficult political climate, a majority of our cases are resolved successfully, resulting in relief for individuals as well as broader changes in Israeli government and military policy to better respect human rights.

We are funded entirely by charitable donations. A majority of HaMoked's support is from foreign governmental entities.

For more information on HaMoked's activities – click here.

 

About the Project:

Your support will help us advocate on behalf of twenty families seeking the right to live together in the West Bank. We have already helped them file family unification applications, and written to the military on their behalf. The next step is petitioning the High Court of Justice. We hope that this series of individual petitions will both result in permits for these families, and bring about a change in Israel's policy, enabling Palestinians to live with their spouses in their homes. These families need your support in funding the high costs incurred: employing an attorney to handle such cases, paying court fees, taking affidavits and more.

Support our fight for the right to family life for Palestinians.

 

For questions: mail@hamoked.org.il or +972-2-6271698

Thank you for your support,

Jessica Montell, Executive Director of HaMoked, and HaMoked's team.

story:
So often, we hear of war from those who have never seen it--news reporters, politicians, military analysts. As former "occupier" and "occupied", we think it's time you heard our stories.


What is Front Lines International?

Front Lines International (or F.L.I. for short) is a project that finds the voices most affected by the War on Terror—voices of soldiers, veterans, military resisters and whistle-blowers, alongside the voices of those who have experienced the military occupations of this war. With your generosity and support, “occupier” and “occupied” will have a unique opportunity to exchange their stories with one another, and share them side-by-side with a broader audience through live events, media and social media. Together, they show two of the most valuable perspectives calling for peace—from the “front lines” of war.

We believe our project has tremendous potential--but we need your help.


Why Are We Raising Money?

This October, F.L.I. will be bringing people together from Canada, the United States and Britain, to host a speaking tour beginning in Toronto, Ontario, and ending in a 3-day retreat for project participants to workshop and strategize. Participants include Iraq and Afghanistan veterans, authors, artists, journalists, and members of Afghan and Iraqi communities.

During the tour, there is a 2-day retreat scheduled for participants to connect, share and strategize on the best ways we can lend our voices to the cause of peace. 

The tour is currently being sponsored by Occupy the Roads, who are providing us with a means of transportation. 

How $5000 Breaks Down:

  • Costs of travel to Toronto (flight subsidies for speakers coming from Calgary, Los Angeles, London, and Philadelphia); as well as fuel during the Tour.
  • Retreat costs (camping, workshop programming, food and supplies)
  • Outreach (Printing materials like posters, bookmarks and brochures)
  • Begin Stage 1 filming of a Front Lines Public Service Announcement (PSA) about the realities of war.


The Impact

As the project has come together over the past few months, each meeting has been more exciting than the last. When we describe Front Lines to our friends and supporters, the same words keep coming up: "Cathartic". "Catalyzing". "Life-changing". Never before has a project sought to bring "occupier" and "occupied" together in such a way. And those who have witnessed the impact can speak to its power.

  • This tour will have the ability to reach thousands of people internationally for the cause of peace.
  • Front Lines project partners will speak on the realities of war, as only those with first-hand experience can.
  • The tour launches the F.L.I. project so that other former "occupiers" and "occupied" can find us and plug in--and then begin to tell their stories.With film and social media, the impact of the tour and the rise of Front Lines International as a project can be felt around the globe.


The Perks - and Other Ways You Can Help


Thanks to the generosity of Veterans for Peace, a U.S.-based non-profit, Americans are able to make their donations tax-deductible! We thank them for this generous show of support!

To those who can contribute financially: Thank you. We truly appreciate it, and as our way of showing that to you, we've got some pretty awesome perks: books, artwork, t-shirts and hoodies--and more.


...But even if you can't donate, you can still help us out! Make noise about our fundraising campaign on social media (Indiegogo makes sharing easy), spread the word in your community, your school--wherever you can. If you have media connections, help us tell the story of the FLI project! It's been an amazing experience so far--and it's only going to get better.

If you have any questions about the campaign, the tour, or anything else--get in touch with us! We're pretty sociable.

Thank you in advance for your interest and your contribution! We hope to be hearing from you!


Peace.

--Front Lines International Project Partners, Located in:
Toronto, Canada
London, England
Jacksonville, Florida
Los Angeles, California
Oakland, California
Atlanta, Georgia
Harrisburg, Pennsylvania
Calgary, Alberta

-----------------------------------------------------------
More more information, try these helpful links:

Our Blog:
FrontLinesInt.wordpress.com

Heather Linebaugh's Artwork:
http://heatherlinebaugh.tumblr.com/

More Information about Joe Glenton's book, "Soldier Box: Why I Won't Go Back to the War on Terror", now available through Verso: 
http://www.versobooks.com/books/1428-soldier-box


--------------------------------------------------------------
Sponsors:

Veterans for Peace:
http://www.veteransforpeace.org

Occupy the Roads:
http://www.occupytheroads.com/blog/

story:
Hello my name is Solomon Smith and I am 28 years old and live and work in Brixton.

I set up Brixton Soup Kitchen in January 2013 for the homeless and people in need to get hot food and hot drinks, also to come for advice about housing.

 

We want to get a moving soup kitchen were we can go out at night and deliver a service to the homeless, We will giving food, clothes, sleeping bags all around London.

We believe this is really needed as there are a lot of homeless people that do get information about services like homeless centres and think that it will be best if we do that service while feeding them at the same time.

 

Please help us beat homeliness in and make a Big change

Add us on facebook.com/soupkitchensupport

Twitter @Brixsoupkitchen

http://www.brixtonblog.com/brixton-residents-se...

story:
Please help support women's rights in India by directly supporting a human rights lawyer who has dedicated her post-graduated year to working on key women's and public health issues. Your support will help me carry out this important and desperately necessary work to support women’s rights in India! Although I knew that I would be unable to make ends meet on a local NGO salary (USD 400/month), after spending so many years working and studying to become a human rights advocate, I leapt at the opportunity to take on the systemic injustice and harsh realities discussed in this video in the land where I was born. With the help of this website, I invite you to help make a difference by supporting my grassroots work for the next 13 months. 

Various studies in recent years have labeled Indian women the most stressed in the world, subject to some of the highest levels of violence against women (in and out of the domestic setting), and specific to reproductive rights the highest instance of maternal mortality. All of the women of my family have been born and have given birth in India. Furthermore, all of them, with exception of my mother, continue to live in India. I felt compelled to take the position at HRLN as an Indian woman.

Despite some legislative protection of reproductive rights in India, reproductive self-determination is not yet a reality for many Indian women. Many women give birth too early in life, too frequently, and often in situations that are undignified. Reproductive rights work here focuses on: access to health care services including contraception, pre-natal care, institutional delivery, and post-natal care; prevention of forced sterilization of marginalized populations; and efforts to increase knowledge regarding both reproduction as well as basic access to health care. 

The Human Rights Law Network (HRLN) is a collective of lawyers and social activists dedicated to the use of the legal system to advance human rights in India and the sub-continent for poor, minority and other marginalized people. I choose to work with the Reproductive Rights Initiative at the Human Rights Law Network (HRLN) due to their commitment to grassroots and individual client work, despite, their paying a fraction of similarly purposed international NGOs.  

With your support, my advocacy can make a difference at both the local and national level. I will manage reproductive rights court cases before High Courts (of States) and the Supreme Court. These cases resulting in good orders can introduce sweeping changes affecting thousands of women at once. By leading fact finding mission to assess and document situation of women and children on the ground and possibly open new Public Interest Litigations (PILs) to support women whose rights the government has blithely ignored. By training local, regional, and national civil society organizations, medical students, lawyers, and judges we hope to make sure that multiple partners can come together to create real change for women in India.

After deciding to pursue a career in international public service, due to the comparative standards of rights around the world, it has been important to me to focus on women’s rights. Women are the most underutilized and effective tool in developing nations, as many reports have shown. Furthermore, I wanted to give back to my country of origin. I was born in India and was raised there and in Mexico, Germany, and the U.S.  Due, in part, to my being raised around the world I have known from a young age that I wanted to be a human rights advocate and humanitarian aid worker.  I have taken every possible step since then to place myself in a situation to achieve that goal. I have a B.A. in Political Science from Emory University, a J.D. in International Human Rights Law and a M.A. in International Development from American University.

story:
Short Summary


Human Empowerment Network (HEN) serves both combat veterans and the needs of communities, based on sound ethnographic and cultural analysis. HEN uses defense analytics and Special Operations approaches to map the needs of poor or violent areas as well as map the skills and knowledge of veterans who need interpersonal or material support. This creates a 'horizontal platform' in which these veterans find pathways of stability as they help build up low-income neighborhoods and entire communities, via their motivation, skill and underutilized abilities.
We are veteran-owned (I myself served in Europe, Iraq, Afghanistan and Africa). Our idea formed during the Hurricane Sandy relief effort.  We discovered a nimble, grassroots movement like Occupy Sandy was a more effective humanitarian venture than large bureaucratic organizations like city government or FEMA.  It was so significant at one point government relief workers were directing storm victims to Occupy Sandy.  But the grassroots approach is not just effective disaster relief.  It is the way forward to bringing innovative growth.

Education is the most vital commodity to our society.  As the world grows more interconnected and complicated it is crucial now more than ever. 
Institutions like public schools are universities play their part, but the most important factors are critical thinking, communication, and a global perspective.  It is with this impetus we start the Human Empowerment Network.  Our mission is to create a platform where information and knowledge can be shared in a grassroots movement, fostering sustainable innovation for individuals, businesses, and communities.



What We Need & What You Get

 For those with a more detailed interest, here is a breakdown:

  • The funding we need is for basic start-up capital. We have our projects well in place, as many in Red Hook will testify (including the local VFW post and many lifetime residents), and are simply awaiting funds. While it is a seemingly modest amount for the scale and scope of the impact we are working to make, it is initially modest for a reason: starting small avoids too much preoccupation within neighborhoods on money in an d of itself, enhancing friendly cooperation rather than self-interest and fear of loss with all players involved. In addition, making modest sums go a long way dollar for dollar, in transparent fashion, only enhances efficacy and paves the way for a follow-on rate of return of larger amounts to follow.
  • We are available to donors by phone, email and Skype (or face to face if you are in the area) to explain our business model and funding scheme in whatever level of detail you need.
    (1) Paying skilled residents of the Red Hook community (especially veterans and older, under-employed residents) to improve their neighborhood and teach valuable trade skills to youth in the process, based on well-defined social impact projects vetted by the community and annotated in a business plan and project writeup, in a transparent manner. An example would be several day's work of home restoration for an elderly Sandy victim on the Red Hook waterfront, by an under-employed resident with a lifetime of construction and renovation skills, as he or she teaches and mentors a dozen teens to learn these skills as they volunteer their time and better their community. Such an outlet is indispensable for youth, lowers crime and juvenile patterns within the neighborhood, restores the home of the elderly, and pays an under-employed but over-skilled resident by providing meaningful work.   (2) Meeting the emergency immediate needs of combat veterans via our 'horizontal integration' platform, which can be explained separately upon request. In short, it works along the same lines as 'Donors Choose' ( http://www.donorschoose.org/about ) and the 2012-2013 self-organized (but well documented and tracked) grassroots, volunteer-led Sandy relief efforts in The Rockaways, Coney Island, Red Hook and other places.                                                                                                (3) Several hundred can also be set aside as a 'community microfund' for small parts of the neighborhood to 'come together' and conduct an exercise of sorts in local participatory budgeting. As I have seen in Afghanistan and to some degree, Cusco, Peru, this really works well if done right, in a manner cognizant of local culture, and respectful of human nature and realities on the ground.The defining impact here is not the money (it will be a small amount) but the ability of residents to collaborate and define their own business plans across different walks of the neighborhood. This has profound meaning in and if itself, if done right, and can set the stage for the same thing to happen with larger funds. Starting small and responsibly,, however, is the key.
  • Any contributors can attach themselves to our project, and will have full access to our work as it unfolds. As with Donors Choose and some Sandy relief efforts, thank you letters will be available as soon as the impact from your donation is made.

The Impact

In addition to HEN's wider focus on sustainable neighborhoods and communities across the US, we focus on veterans issues, via partnering with veterans organizations and groups as well as individuals. John Kirbow has served in Iraq and Afghanistan with some of the people he is working with on Operation Crowdsource.
A main facet of our business plan is to facilitate pathways of empowerment, work, skills exchange and education for veterans - especially those with combat deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan. We are doing this through a horizontal platform similar to what worked so well during grassroots Sandy relief efforts here in Brooklyn, but scaling it nation-wide.


HEN in action
Our first project was in the Red Hook neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY.
We began by "mapping" the community: who are the key leaders, how does information flow, what are the biggest needs, and where are the hidden assets.  We found that people communicate and interact through informal "nodes:" churches, small stores (bodegas), coffee shops, and
bars.  We introduced ourselves to the leaders and owners of these nodes, explained who we are and what we wanted to do, and asked them to get the word out.  Soon we had many involved residents coming to us.  One of the biggest concerns was education, especially financial
education.  Another need was better communication with local government.  The current incumbent was not serving the neighborhood well, in fact she rarely even visited.  Finally, we found that, despite many people and organizations trying to better the community,
they were not talking to each other and collaborating.  Using our neighborhood mapping, we created a communication platform to help information flow more effectively.

Our Impact
We found a local man who wanted to help solve the problem of financial education, but had never been given the opportunity. Self-taught in economics and finance, we linked him with a nonprofit that helps at-risk youth to teach a series of financial literacy classes.  For our first class we hoped maybe a dozen kids would show up.  Around 50 did.
To help improve government, we helped a new face who shares our passion for community development in this year's city council election against the deeply entrenched incumbent.  He was running for the first time, and faced an uphill battle, being outspent 5 to 1.
As an emerging key leader, we used our cultural and network-analytic communication platform to get the word out about his goals for the community, and despite a much smaller campaign fund, he won by almost 20 percentage points.
One of the most exciting initiatives the new city councilman promised was Participatory Budgeting (PB).  PB allows the neighborhood to decide how a certain part of the city budget will be allocated, in this case $2 million.  The benefit is two-fold: the money goes to where it is needed most, and the community is more involved in government, taking an active role rather than a passive one. One of the biggest concerns about PB is that the same vested interests will run the show at the expense of the rest of the community.  We ensured this wasn't so.  Using our same communications platform, we created a forum that brought together business owners, nonprofits, local artists, the citizens association, and concerned residents to
implement PB.  The meeting was a success, and the bulk of the money will go towards unmet education needs.  But the most important change was the tone of the meeting.  Before we began our project, neighborhood meetings were filled with bitterness and a sense of ennui.  Now the tone is one of optimism and action. No other district involved in the PB program has engaged a community in this unprecedented fashion, and Red Hook will be a model for others to follow.
Our long term goal is to have non-profits allocate their money in the same fashion.  As we continue to grow, and gain more solid financial traction, that is exactly what we plan to do.


Why we partner  with veterans organizations
No community is "marginalized" more than our veterans, both as needs
and resources.  Many organizations are currently doing a noble task of getting
them the basic resources they deserve: food, shelter, and in many
cases, medical support.  That is the first step.  But veterans are not
liabilities to our nation.  Far from it. They are assets, with wide
variety of skills that must be integrated into the private sector.
And this is where we can assist with the Human Empowerment Network.
In some instances, we can link them with employers that can teach them
what they need.  In others, they will be the teachers.  The key is for
it to be transparent and horizontal.  The possibilities are endless.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share, spread the word, and above all, contact us with any questions, suggestions, feedback or ideas. Putting our site and business platform in front of the right people would be the most paramount thing one can do if they want to help. Finally, any veterans who are in a legitimate hardship situation, please have them contact us and we may be able to help. I am an Iraq and Afghanistan veteran myself, and our platform can vet needs and bridge them to the right resources.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Human Empowerment Network (HEN) serves
 both combat veterans and the needs of communities, based on sound 
ethnographic and cultural analysis. HEN uses defense analytics and 
Special Operations approaches to map the needs of poor or violent areas 
as well as map the skills and knowledge of veterans who need 
interpersonal or material support. This creates a 'horizontal platform' 
in which these veterans find pathways of stability as they help build up
 low-income neighborhoods and entire communities, via their motivation, 
skill and underutilized abilities.We are veteran-owned (I myself served in Europe, Iraq, Afghanistan and Africa). Our idea formed during the Hurricane Sandy relief effort.  We discovered a
nimble, grassroots movement like Occupy Sandy was a more effective humanitarian
venture than large bureaucratic organizations like city government or
FEMA.  It was so significant at one point government relief workers were
directing storm victims to Occupy Sandy.  But the grassroots approach is
not just effective disaster relief.  It is the way forward to bringing
innovative growth.Education is the most 
vital commodity to our society.  As the world grows more interconnected 
and complicated it is crucial now more than ever. Institutions
 like public schools are universities play their part, but the most 
important factors are critical thinking, communication, and a global 
perspective.  It is with this impetus we start the Human Empowerment
 Network.  Our mission is to create a platform where information and 
knowledge can be shared in a grassroots movement, fostering sustainable 
innovation for individuals, businesses, and communities.

story:
Why I am running at the 33rd Athens Marathon

I am running the 10Km race with the team of Amnesty International Greece in order to support the organization's campaign for the human rights of refugees. I am running because I don't want to see more people drowning in the Mediterranean and the Aegean or suffering at our borders behind the fences of Fortress Europe. 

Why I need your support 

Supporting me you are supporting a strong presence of Amnesty International in Greece, which means more pressure on the Greek and European authorities to respect the human rights of refugees. It means supporting activists working daily at the front lines. It means supporting independent and reliable research that translates into campaigns so that Europe can finally say #RefugeesWelcome. 

Where will your money go

All money received will fund the activities of the Greek Section of Amnesty International, and in particular the SOS Europe campaign, which mobilizes thousands of activists across Europe and beyond to demand the protection of the human rights of refugees. Amnesty International's campaigns are solely funded by donations from its members and supporters. 
For more information please see: http://www.sos-europe-amnesty.eu/ 
****************************************************************************

Γιατί τρέχω στον 33ο Μαραθώνιο Αθηνών

Tρέχω με την ομάδα του Eλληνικού τμήματος της Διεθνούς Αμνηστίας, στα 10χλμ και στηρίζω την εκστρατεία της οργάνωσης  υπέρ των δικαιωμάτων των προσφύγων. Τρέχω γιατί δεν θέλω να δω άλλους ανθρώπους να πνίγονται στη Μεσόγειο και το Αιγαίο ή να υποφέρουν στα σύνορα πίσω από τους φράχτες μιας Ευρώπης Φρούριο.

Γιατί θέλω να με στηρίξεις

Στηρίζοντας την προσπάθειά μου  στηρίζεις μια ισχυρή παρουσία της  Διεθνούς Αμνηστίας στην Ελλάδα που σημαίνει μεγαλύτερη πίεση στις ελληνικές και  ευρωπαϊκές αρχές να σεβαστούν τα δικαιώματα των προσφύγων. Σημαίνει στήριξη  των αλληλέγγυων και ακτιβιστών/ριών που δουλεύουν καθημερινά στην πρώτη  γραμμή. Σημαίνει ανεξάρτητη και αξιόπιστη έρευνα που μεταφράζεται σε εκστρατείες ώστε η Ευρωπαϊκή Ένωση να καλωσορίζει τους πρόσφυγες και να σεβαστεί τα δικαιώματά τους. 

Που θα πάνε τα χρήματα;

Τα χρήματα θα πάνε για τη δράση του ελληνικού τμήματος της Διεθνούς Αμνηστίας και ειδικότερα για τη στήριξη της εκστρατείας SOS Europe που κινητοποιέι χιλιάδες ακτιβιστές και ακτιβίστριες στην Ευρώπη και τον κόσμο απαιτώντας το σεβασμό των δικαιωμάτων των προσφύγων. Οι εκστρατείες της Διεθνούς Αμνηστίας χρηματοδοτούνται αποκλειστικά από τις δωρεές των μελών και των υποστηρικτών της. 

Για περισσότερες πληροφορίες: http://www.sos-europe-amnesty.eu/

story:
My name is Chris Mullally and I am just an ordinary man trying to do something extraordinary. When I heard that up to 600,000 children could die from starvation in Somalia, I said the same thing that almost everyone says today – “Wow – that’s really terrible but what can I do about it”.

Within 3 days of learning about this problem it just really occurred to me that I always say that. Of course I cannot do anything about it because I never really try to do anything about it.

It became apparent to me that if I would just make the time in my life to try to do something that maybe I just could. So the Extraordinary Project launches with the goal of raising 1 million dollars to try to do something about it.

I am calling out the rest of this country and the world to join me in trying to make a difference in something that will save the lives of many children. Whether it is your own or somebody else’s, every child must depend on others to be their providers and that is us.

All I am asking for is $1.00 from 1 million people. Almost everyone has a dollar to give. I not only hope that you have $1.00 to give but that you have 10 or 20 other friends that have $1.00 to give. Please get involved in making a difference $1.00 at a time. Together, lets do something that really matters.

An additional note —

The Extraordinary Project is incorporated as a 501 (c) (3) not for profit corporation. The Extraordinary Project is being fully funded by my wife and I. 100% of your donations, less whatever credit card or Paypal fees are deducted go directly to the goal. There are no other administrative fees.

story:
Richad Bradford is a native Atlanta Georgian who had built a thriving company.
 
In 2002, a Customer terminated his contract with Mr. Bradford thus, creating a dispute over the Non Refundable deposit paid on that contract.
 
Five years later, the Cobb Country District attorney's office presented criminal charges solely to obtain an advantage in that civil matter.The district attorney then jailed Mr Bradford and said that they would free him in exchange for $10,000 up front to settle the civil dispute and When Mr Bradford refused to fall victim to those extortions,the office of the district attorney held a criminal trial solely to resolve the civil matter in the Contractual dispute where Mr Bradford had :
 
(a) No probable cause hearing;
 
(b) No arraignment;
 
(c) judge Kell refused to hear his pre-trial motion to dismiss indictment, and,
 
(d) No defense evidence was presented at trial, none!
 
In other words, when Mr Bradford refused to pay their $ 10,000 extortion, they just held court in witch hunt fashion ignoring the fact that he was terminally ill, a cancer patient,and they sent him to prison for 12 year's, all over a non refundable deposit on a contract,a civil contract dispute.
This campaign is important to every American in the United States, who conducts any type of business because the 14th amendment of the United States Constitution quarantees the right of the individual to contract and to engage in any of the common occupations of life.To be impassioned over a simple contractual dispute is a complete failure of our system of free commerce and our judicial systems.

Review this matter in its entirety at www.richardisinnocent.com and support Mr Bradford in this fight against this injustice for surely you recognize that to allow this to happen to Mr Bradford,is to permit the same to happen to you.
 
Share this story with one and all and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Hi Pals! Thanks taking the time to look at our page. 

Abortion Rights Needs You! If 2016 has taught us anything it is that we cannot take women’s rights for granted. Women’s reproductive health, particularly abortion services and access, are constantly under siege.

WHO WE ARE! Abortion Rights is the UK's national pro-choice campaign. We defend and extend women’s rights and access to safe, legal abortion. Women should be able to make their own reproductive decisions without the current unfair legal barriers, obstructions and delays.

PHEW! It's been a successful……We’ve been working hard campaigning, lobbying & pursuing! but there still is much to do.

Unlike the anti-choice groups we're not rolling in dosh from religious and overseas donors, we run our efforts on a string-string budget and the generosity of our membership and volunteer base and really do make a little stretch a long way but, with your help we could achieve so so much more! 

How can you help? We hear you cry! That's SIMPLE Pledge us some cash or become an Abortion Rights member today... or why not to both ;) 

We are asking as many pro-choice-people as possible to chip into our fighting fund to defend and extend choice - and really, every little bit helps!

#Choice4Christmas
story_txt:
Hi Pals! Thanks taking the time to look at our page. 
Abortion Rights Needs You! If 2016 has taught us anything it is that we cannot take women’s rights for granted. Women’s reproductive health, particularly abortion services and access, are constantly under siege.
WHO WE ARE! Abortion Rights is the UK's national pro-choice campaign. We defend and extend women’s rights and access to safe, legal abortion. Women should be able to make their own reproductive decisions without the current unfair legal barriers, obstructions and delays.
PHEW! It's been a successful……We’ve been working hard campaigning, lobbying & pursuing! but there still is much to do.
Unlike the anti-choice groups we're not rolling in dosh from religious and overseas donors, we run our efforts on a string-string budget and the generosity of our membership and volunteer base and really do make a little stretch a long way but, with your help we could achieve so so much more! 
How can you help? We hear you cry! That's SIMPLE Pledge us some cash or become an Abortion Rights member today... or why not to both ;) 
We are asking as many pro-choice-people as possible to chip into our fighting fund to defend and extend choice - and really, every little bit helps!
#Choice4Christmas

story:
What?

Make a donation to buy a meal from Chick-Fil-A for someone in need.

Why?

Hunger

In many ways, America is the land of plenty. But for 1 in 6 people in the United States, hunger is a reality. Many people believe that the problems associated with hunger are confined to small pockets of society, certain areas of the country, or certain neighborhoods, but the reality is much different.

Right now, millions of Americans are struggling with hunger.  These are often hard-working adults, children and seniors who simply cannot make ends meet and are forced to go without food for several meals, or even days.

Chick-fil-A exec takes stance against same-sex marriage

It seems as if people on the left don't  approve of free speech unless it is in line with their beliefs. They  call for boycotts of companies  that espouse opinions other than their own.  Now is your chance to make a statement "We stand for true free speech".

Come again?

By giving now you will help feed a person and support a moral company.

How?

Make a donation today.  Your donation will buy a Chick-Fil-A gift card for someone struggling with hunger.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
English

GOAL: 1000 SUPPORTERS WITH 1$ EACH. All money will be spent to buy tents and sleeping bags for protesters.

The short story of a country hijacked by corrupted political parties

On June 23, 2013 Albania holds national elections. Nowadays Albanian citizens are called by political parties to vote for the lesser evil. They are offered to vote for the current government coalition that has a history of corruption, oppression and killing of protesters, or to vote for the opposition coalition that has a history of corrupted leaders.

In Albania there is no free media. Every media operator is controlled by opposition political parties or the government. The organized crime has very strong ties with the government and opposition parties and is used to a great extend before elections to fund campaigns and to threaten opponents. Most of the international aid focused on democratization goes to N G Os that are directly or indirectly serving the interests of political parties. Any free grassroots citizen movement is attacked and discouraged.

Citizens are oppressed by the government and opposition political parties. All individuals that work for the public administration of the central or local government are obliged to attend & support the electoral campaign of the government or the opposition. As a result electoral campaigns of all parties are attended & supported by thousands of people that are threatened to lose their job if they do not obey to the party of the central government or the parties of the opposition.

 

The protest camp on June 21, 2013

Albanian politicians claim that Albanian citizens support corrupted political parties by voting for them. To show that Albanian citizens disagree with the corrupted political system installed in the country and are not willing to vote for the lesser evil, on June 21, 2013 (36 hours before election day) a protest camp will be set up at the center of Tirana.

https://www.facebook.com/events/153589218155571

 

-------------

Shqip

OBJEKTIVI: 1000 MBËSHTETËS ME 1 $ secili. Të gjitha paratë do të shpenzohen për të blerë tenda dhe sleeping bag për protestuesit.


Historia e shkurtër e një vendi të marrë peng nga parti politike të korruptuara

Në 23 qershor 2013 Shqipëria do të mbajë zgjedhje për Kuvend. Në ditët e sotme qytetarët shqiptarë thirren nga partitë politike të votojnë për të keqen më të vogël. Atyre u ofrohet të votojnë për koalicionin e qeverisë aktuale që ka një histori të korrupsionit, shtypjes dhe vrasjes së protestuesve, ose të votojnë për koalicionin e opozitës që ka një histori të udhëheqësve të korruptuar.

Në Shqipëri nuk ka media të lira. Çdo operator mediatik kontrollohet nga partitë e opozitës ose të qeverisë. Krimi i organizuar ka lidhje shumë të fortë me qeverinë dhe partitë e opozitës dhe përdoret gjerësisht para zgjedhjeve për të financuar fushatat elektorale dhe për të kërcënuar kundërshtarët. Shumica e ndihmës ndërkombëtare që ka në fokus demokratizimin shkon për organizata që janë direkt apo indirekt ne shërbim te interesave të partive politike. Çdo lëvizje qytetare e lirë sulmohet dhe dekurajohet.

Qytetarët janë të shtypur nga ana e qeverisë dhe partive politike të opozitës. Të gjithë individët që punojnë për administratën publike të qeverisjes qendrore apo vendore janë të detyruara të marrin pjesë të mbështetin fushatën elektorale të qeverisë apo opozitës. Si rezultat fushatat zgjedhore të të gjitha partive ndiqen dhe mbështeten nga mijëra njerëz që rrezikojnë të humbasin vendet e punës nëse nuk i binden partive të qeverisë qendrore ose partive të opozitës.

Kampi i protestës në 21 Qershor 2013

Politikanët shqiptarë theksojnë se qytetarët shqiptarë i përkrahin partitë politike të korruptuara duke votuar për to. Për të treguar se qytetarët shqiptarë nuk pajtohen me sistemin e korruptuar politik të instaluar në vend dhe nuk janë të gatshëm për të votuar të keqen më të vogël, në 21 qershor 2013 (36 orë para ditës së zgjedhjeve) në parkun Rinia do të ngrihet një kamp proteste.

https://www.facebook.com/events/153589218155571

story:
To all of our friends, our families, acquaintances, and anyone else!

Last May 2015, I, Rebecca, experienced a trip to Haiti alongside my sister and many other admirable volunteers to help provide healthcare to Do Digue as well as other nearby villages. My journey to Haiti provided me with significant life lessons, and the patience and graciousness the communities expressed for the little amount that we were able to provide was beyond inspiring and enlightening. Last year, one man waited quietly in the clinic for hours to be provided a catheter. Every time I walked by him, he would smile at me, and when I was putting in his information at the end of his long clinic visit, he was just smiling from ear to ear. These communities taught me true resilience, and how happiness sprouts from the simplest of things. And if I cannot aid every person, I will have at least helped one person- even if it is just by making them smile, entering their medical information after a long day at clinic, or offering a bite to eat.

I was truly humbled , and I enjoyed my time so much that I am going back in August 2016. This time I was able to convince one of my dearest friends, Terence Kwan, to join me!

Back in 2009, I, Terence, immersed myself in a Design-for-the-Majority project during college, with the help of grants and non-profit support.  Ultimately, our team traveled to a remote town in Cameroon, Africa (Lebialem) to further refine our concept of a low-cost, quick-to-assemble joinery system.  I uncovered a profound realization during my residency that's since influenced both my life and career, as a person and as a designer.  Over 90% of the human population on this planet is categorized as living below the 1st-world status.  Everyday, those of us in the 'developed-world' (the 10%) find dismay in, what should be, the comforts of our lives, often because we forget there's a bigger human struggle beyond us--taking -our opportunities for granted.  But in the still-developing world, the reality is that most towns and villages may not have things like clean running water, a reliable or existing electrical grid, or access to any health services.  This last service is where I would like to help continue to make an impact for those who need it.

It's been 7 years since my experience in Africa and now's a better time than any to go out and help our fellow souls in need.  This August, I'll be joining Rebecca Marcy as we provide health aid to local community patients in Haiti.  

Community Health Initiative Haiti (CHI) is a non-profit organization responsible for bringing teams together to travel every three months to the same communities in Arcahaie. Its mission, over the past few years, has been to gain solidarity with the people of Arcahaie in order to pinpoint and address their medical and environmental needs. Ultimately, CHI hopes that its presence becomes less and less necessary. It hopes for and works towards a time when the community will be independently stable, with the framework that CHI, its volunteers, and its staff have laboriously and lovingly laid down. 

Four times a year, a CHI team visits Arcahaie treating both new and return patients from this village as well surrounding communities. With the help of the CHI team in August, Terence and I will aid in providing patients with vitamins, treat them for parasites and STD's, and screen them for chronic diseases. Our doctors will perform minor surgical procedures (pictured above from last year), as well as treat acute diseases such as malaria, typhoid fever and dysentery. Many of these diseases when left untreated, could prove to be fatal.

This organization has made glorious strides. This includes (but is definitely not limited to), introducing Gadyen Dlo, a water treatment system that has decreased the rate of diarrhea in these communities from 40% to 1.8%, and providing a 'ReSpectacle station', a new addition which matches patients with potential prescriptions for eyeglasses. 


Each volunteer is asked to raise or provide $1200 (this does not include airfare) which goes towards the most essential of expenses including medicine, salaries for interpreters and nurses, and room and board for the volunteers. Terence and I are hoping to raise $4000 together between both the airfare and trip expenses. 

PLEASE help us help Haiti! Any dollar amount would help us, and if you are unable to help assist financially, SPREAD THE WORD! Share, share, share by word of mouth, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Email, Snapchat, Vine... Okay maybe not that far, but please share as much as possible! We are immensely grateful for any help that comes our way, and any way you can help, matters. 


We are thrilled to be a part of this team!

We thank you a million times in advance for your support,

Rebecca and Terence

story:
Short Summary

Hello Ladies,

My name is Lorraine Greenbaum.  I am doing this campaign "INFERTILITY TO FERTILITY", to help women obtain the the funds they need to use Fertility Clinics so they can have a child of their own.  My youngest daughter and two other women that I know personally, are in desperate need of Fertility Services.  I'm a 65-yr old widow & live in a small town in Missouri.  I'm a Christian that believes in people helping people!  My greatest gift is the joy I feel when I can do something for people in need.  I truly believe that God placed this campaign in my heart to help my daughter and other women!!!  These women have had multiple miscarriages, difficulty conceiving, and the painful loss of infant demise.  The tears and heartache are unrelenting, and insurance companies won't pay a cent!   In spite of being a novice in fundraising, I do believe that all things are possible with God!   

I'm not really sure how much money each woman will need, since there are different treatments for each woman.  Some need IUI, some need IVF, etc.  Costs vary greatly, so I decided to start at an amount that I know will be enough for my daughter and one other woman.  All the funds will go directly to the Fertility Clinic!  I'm hoping to reach my goal & hopefully exceed that amount so I can have more funds to help more women.  God willing, this will go well enough to continue campaigning so I can help more & more women!  If I do not reach my goal, I will distribute the all the donations that I do receive, to at least help with the Fertility costs.

I've added "Perks" to let you know how dedicated I am and prove that sharing and giving is something we can do for each other.  It's my way of saying "THANK YOU"!

Women that are wealthy can easily afford Fertility Intervention - it's the average working class women that can afford living expenses, but cannot afford the hundreds of dollars, and sometimes it's thousands of dollars, that are required "up front"!  You can make the difference - the only chance some of these women will ever have!  Together, we can do what the insurance companies refuse to do - we can be the BLESSING to women all over the world!  This goal amount is small, but it can grow, and grow - YES, WE CAN DO THIS!!!   ONE STEP AT A TIME, ONE, BY ONE, ONE DOLLAR AT A TIME!  Who knows, we might even get enough pressure on the wealthy insurance companies to include Fertility Expenses - as they should do!  LADIES, IT'S TIME OUR VOICE IS HEARD!!!  This campaign is just the beginning, and God is on our side!!! 

Some people just cannot afford to contribute, but they can still help!  Prayers, Likes, & Shares is definitely a positive way to get the word out to others.  This is very important as well!  "Activity" on this campaign will bring "others" to NOTICE, and when a campaign gets "NOTICED" it grows & reaches additional platforms, media sites & more!  Additionally, Indiegogo has "share tools" as well.

THANK YOU, & MAY YOU ALWAYS HAVE BLESSINGS, FRIEND!
Sincerely, Lorraine Greenbaum

story:
Short Summary

My mission is to create better laws and policies in states to help people who have been affected by gender power violence.  In 1994, I was a freshman in college and I was attacked from behind, by a stranger, while sitting on my front porch.  It took two decades to identify him and he was a serial rapist. 

Once he was finally caught and sentenced, I decided to help my state by looking at legislation and policies KY had and how we could do it better.  Personally, in 2015 and 2016 I have helped to identify and clear the backlog of rape kits and rape kit reform in Kentucky and Indiana.  In 2016, I helped Indiana to pass DNA upon felony arrest, which now allows IN to swab for a DNA profile at arrest.  This has lead to some arrests of serial offenders.  In 2017, I helped to pass a bill changing the definition of rape and sodomy in the state of Kentucky which changes the way these crimes are defined and how offenders will be charged for these crimes.  By showing that these issues are about humans and human needs, it helps validate survivors victimized by crimes.

Your contributions will help to fund travel, accommodations and time spent going back and forth to states to speak with law enforcement, legislators, advocates, prosecutors and communities on the importance of educating about these crimes and look at strategies for creating a better system.

What I Need and The Impact

I need funding for:

  • Travel expenses to states. 
  • Printed out literature and presentations for educational purposes.
  • The ability to work in more states.  I have already been asked to work in Indiana in 2018 to help pass my KY bill I did this past session for the definition of rape and sodomy. 

  • You will get a National and state award winner for my work with legislation and educating schools, students, military and community.  You are also getting a passionate and dedicated individual who sees results

Short Summary
My mission is to create better laws and policies in states to help people who have been affected by gender power violence.  In 1994, I was a freshman in college and I was attacked from behind, by a stranger, while sitting on my front porch.  It took two decades to identify him and he was a serial rapist. 
Once he was finally caught and sentenced, I decided to help my state by looking at legislation and policies KY had and how we could do it better.  Personally, in 2015 and 2016 I have helped to identify and clear the backlog of rape kits and rape kit reform in Kentucky and Indiana.  In 2016, I helped Indiana to pass DNA upon felony arrest, which now allows IN to swab for a DNA profile at arrest.  This has lead to some arrests of serial offenders.  In 2017, I helped to pass a bill changing the definition of rape and sodomy in the state of Kentucky which changes the way these crimes are defined and how offenders will be charged for these crimes.  By showing that these issues are about humans and human needs, it helps validate survivors victimized by crimes.
Your contributions will help to fund travel, accommodations and time spent going back and forth to states to speak with law enforcement, legislators, advocates, prosecutors and communities on the importance of educating about these crimes and look at strategies for creating a better system.

What I Need and The Impact
I need funding for:

Travel expenses to states. 
Printed out literature and presentations for educational purposes.
The ability to work in more states.  I have already been asked to work in Indiana in 2018 to help pass my KY bill I did this past session for the definition of rape and sodomy. 
You will get a National and state award winner for my work with legislation and educating schools, students, military and community.  You are also getting a passionate and dedicated individual who sees results

story:
, thank you for viewing my Indiegogo page...

The goal of this project is to launch my 'Font Foundry' called, WooWords.  Don't know what a Font Foundry is?  Well, all the letters and wording you view on a web page, or read in a book, or see as the stylized packaging of every item that you purchase... are designed by someone. The companies that create these letters, also known as fonts, are called font foundries. It is Graphic Arts extreme.

It is my primary goal that one day, my new font LUCKADAIZIAL and other fonts designed by WooWords will be everywhere, online for your use and also as software for commercial use. 

As a new start-up, this campaign's goal is to complete LUCKADAIZIAL as a MEDIUM weight script font, FREE, for the online world.

With your help this whimsical and modern new typeface will join the repository of Google Web Fonts and other platforms... as a wonderful resource to be used as often as you like here online for numerous titles, articles, tag lines, emails and greetings.

I believe we (myself and tech team) are also the first to offer a PRE-LAUNCH commercial license as a give-away. A key factor for all wanting to use LUCKADAIZIAL in actual print. Those hardcopy requirements in the day-to-day world; newsprint, magazine, advertisement, business or personal promotional materials. We hope to be a very successful part of your writing life, headlining as a font of choice! 

Thoughts from around the world are important. Post an online comment or contact me directly at: ddebutler@woowords.com

A small OpenType sample file of the A, B, C glyphs can be downloaded for your perusal at http://www.woowords.com/luckadaizial/sample_abc.zip 

These glyphs are subject to change as the complete character set takes shape.


Please, read on...for the WOOORDY back story, or skip ahead to read our pledge levels.

The story of LUCKADAIZIAL truly begins with my lifelong love of penmanship.

Freehand writing styles come naturally to me after years of what must be hundreds, possibly thousands of practice hours. Always doodling words, I have an obsession for calligraphy and a passion for typography I would like to share.

In good humour I must mention, without words surrounding me I feel dizzy, not quite myself. When the glance of reading something... anything... a front page or book cover, menu or neon light is missing from my hour-to-hour, I have been known to hyperventilate in a state-of-comical-panic.

Words and I go together!

I can't explain it other than to say, in some unusual way my minds eye will twist and turn the words I read to create a multidimensional 3D image. From magazine layouts, brochures, logos, advertisements and tag lines, hardcopy or online, letters and pictures will lift and whirl before me like a computer graphic dangling mid-air for my appreciation. So it seems natural that I would begin designing them.

I agree, it is strange seeing LETTERS as THINGS!  


s a professional Script Supervisor and freelance Story Editor in Film & Television production, I have enjoyed working with teams of terrific talent over the years, each contributing to bring page after page of script (glorious words), dynamic characters and entertaining visuals to your screen. It is magic being a small part of movie production.

Not so surprising, somewhere in the mesh of chasing my career I began to write a little, manuscripts and screenplays but also using true ink to paper my handwriting styles have been used for...

Movie Titles and Opening Credits... Party Invitations... Love Letters... Award Certificates... Movie Props and Cover Designs.

was inspired by swirls I doodled during a recent lunch in a busy café. As fine lines of pink ink gliding across the clean white paper tablecloth, the characters of this font came to life. 

Oodles of people have suggested, encouraged, almost insisted that I become entrepreneurial... so here I am, knowing unique typeface is needed for the headlines, greetings and content written by millions of people daily. I have to admit it is exciting to see the flourish of my penmanship take form as computerized files. 

I am emerging truly as I am, a .

I truly hope LUCKADAIZIAL becomes an inspiring typeface which helps you succeed. As you can imagine, the typography and engineering with loads of encoding to develop a NEW FONT requires massive effort. Your support is very important in helping to generate Luckadaizial as a legible, smooth and expressive font finding its way in the mainstream of communication.

Constructing a reliable and decorative font with great glyphs, accurate spacing and kerning ready for web use, accessible through HTML 5, (ready for your use) requires capability beyond what I own in both hardware and software.

Easily stated, I need new gear!
 
I also need to buy part-time support from my excellent technical team.
 
 
Your PLEDGES towards raising my goal of $5000 will enable me to complete Luckadaizial initially as...

A MEDIUM weight ALL CAPITAL alphabet packaged with NUMERALS and standard PUNCTUATION, including the important EURO symbol. 

Estimated ALL CAPITAL font release: June 15th, 2012

 

Here's the FONT thing...

Should your pledges exceed $6000 a SMALL CAPS variant will be produced as well.

If pledges embrace $7000 a DROP CAPS variant will also be produced.

The matching medium weight lower case set will join in one month following the initial release, if support tops $12,000. Estimated delivery: July 2012

So that ALL words written in the Luckadaizial font appear ideally dressed...

If you really cheer this endeavour on, the full EUROPEAN ISO 8859-1 Latin (Western) character set will be included should your support reach $18,000.  From there... the sky is the limit.

These funds will generate the complete MEDIUM weight LUCKADAIZIAL font with great technical support onboard to verify the files using rasterized bitmaps and custom built curve tracing software.

Should my $5000 goal not be reached, funds collected will be used for tech resources and I will continue preparing LUCKADAIZIAL for delivery... as best I can.

If letters are not your thing, I encourage you to participate by informing others to take a look! PLEASE spread the word of Luckadaizial with your friends, family and colleagues. Share info on Facebook, Twitter and other favorite websites. There are many ways to help, including the terrific Indiegogo share tools.

 

Take a peek at www.woowords.com my splash page. The site is under construction as I am busy...

FONTILIZING: an expression of great love, the indication of feeling artistically fabulous with the personal design effort of creating unique shapes for each letter of the alphabet.

To the professionals out there... during this campaign...

The Luckadaizial MEDIUM WEIGHT font in embeddable form will be LICENSED for all COMMERCIAL PRINT USE to the pledge holders.

This means, the MEDIUM weight variant in OpenType format is yours for online, hardcopy or real world use when you pledge Luckadaizial Club or higher. However, derivative rights of redistribution, service bureaus or conversion of files to a second party will not be offered. Straight forward, understandable and fair.

This commercial license is MY GIFT TO YOU, to properly thank supporters for being a KEY factor with the Luckadaizial launch. Great fun!

 

Please remember, this font is in the development stage. Files are being carefully rendered, adjusted and perfected daily. In the future, should demand indicate Luckadaizial is a rising star, the Light, Bold and possibly the Condensed styles will be released. Perhaps even as a Multiple Master font!

I am thrilled that WooWords Creative Arts, my little FONT FOUNDRY is producing Luckadaizial. Join in, take part on the adventure by visiting often.

As a surprise, a bonus image from the...

typography digital files will be displayed every few days here on Indiegogo.

Remember, you may contact me directly at: ddebutler@woowords.com

Should you be placing a pledge, please, forward a fast-email 'Hello' to me so I may confirm your email and/or mailing address as required for you to receive your security download codes, and product.

With Luv & Luck...you are true patrons of the ARTS, be proud!

Thanks,

DEE

story:
QUI SOMMES NOUS ?

(English version at the bottom)

CARLTON SMILE CHARITY est une fondation panafricaine pour porter assistance aux orphelins et qui a pour mission de réunir les africains en une famille de « Smile Donors ». Cela fait presque deux ans que de nombreuses campagnes telles que des remises de dons, des séances d’activités ludiques avec les enfants ont été menées un peu partout en Afrique : en Afrique Du Sud, au Zimbabwe, au Gabon, au Cameroun, etc… (voir les photos ici) Plus de 500 orphelins ont déjà été assistés sans aucun sponsor mais essentiellement des participations de bénévoles. Nous aspirons à donner des sourires à travers toute l’Afrique.

CARLTON SMILE CHARITY TEAM


SMILE CHARITY en Afrique du Sud


SMILE CHARITY au Cameroun


LE PROJET SMILE4PEACE

Cela fait déjà plusieurs mois que Boko Haram sévit dans la région du Nord-Cameroun. Récemment encore, il eut une attaque dans la ville de Fotokol faisant près de plusieurs centaines de morts dont des soldats camerounais, tchadiens et les résidents de la ville. Nous, SMILE CHARITY, nous soucions des rescapés et des soldats toujours au combat. Nous avons pour ambition de collecter des fonds et de les apporter aux victimes des attaques, contraintes de laisser tout derrière elles pour survivre et aujourd'hui livrées à elles-mêmes. Nous pensons aussi aux enfants, qui ne partent plus à l'école et vivent dans la crainte. Nous aimerions également apporter un soutien à la valeureuse armée camerounaise qui ne cesse de se battre pour maintenir la paix dans notre pays, le Cameroun. 


Attaques au Nord du Cameroun


La Brigade d'Intervention Rapide du Cameroun


Attaques à Kolofata au Nord du Cameroun


Attaques au Nord du Cameroun


Les fonds à collecter sont estimés à 3500$ (environ 2 000 000 FCFA). Ils serviront à acheter des denrées alimentaires, de l'eau potable, des boites à pharmacie, des lampes-tempêtes et autres équipements de survie et de première nécessité que nous nous empresserons d'acheminer auprès des victimes et familles des soldats tombés au combat.


LES CONTREPARTIES

Tous les contributeurs du projet SMILE4PEACE auront une contrepartie en fonction de la somme offerte :

  • Pour un don de $5, les contributeurs recevront un aimable mot de remerciement de la part de l'équipe de SMILE CHARITY.
  • Pour un don de $10, en plus du mot de remerciement, vous recevrez un bracelet SMILE CHARITY. Ainsi vous ferez désormais partie de la grande famille des "Smile Donors".

SMILE DONORS FAMILY


  • Pour un don de $15 et plus, vous recevrez tous les cadeaux cités plus haut et un exemplaire du livre "The what, why and how of Charity", écrit par Jesse Carlton HAPPY (Twitter: @JC_Carlton), le fondateur de la CARLTON SMILE CHARITY. Un livre qui parle de l'importance de la fraternité et du partage dans le développement personnel et professionnel de tout homme.

SMILE CHARITY tient à coeur de réaliser ce projet car le Cameroun traverse une période inédite sur ses Terres. Nous aimerions rassembler les Camerounais, les Africains pour faire face à cette situation qui touche chacun de nous.


LE CHALLENGE

Il est vrai qu'une partie de la région du Nord-Cameroun n'est pas une zone fréquentable à l'heure actuelle. Mais ayant des contacts sur place et avec l'assistance de l'armée Camerounaise, nous ferons tout notre possible pour acheminer les récoltes. ça fait partie du challenge que nous rencontrerons durant ce projet et que nous sommes plus que déterminés à relever.

Pour ceux qui souhaiterait faire un don mais ne possèdent pas de carte bancaire, un centre de distribution est mis à disposition à :

- Yaoundé : Restaurant NETCAFE (situé Sonel Nlongkak)

- Douala : ELITE FASHION (situé à côté de Drugstore à Akwa)

Il est possible de faire un don en achetant directement le livre "The what, why and how of Charity". Dans ce cas, les dons seront évidemment pris en compte dans la collecte de fonds du projet SMILE4PEACE.

N'hésitez pas à en parler autour de vous. C'est pour la bonne cause. Ensemble, nous allons apporter du sourire à nos compatriotes du Nord. Nous allons soutenir et encourager davantage nos troupes. Partagez massivement sur les réseaux sociaux! Toute contribution matérielle, morale, physique est la bienvenue.

Ce projet est suivi par Maitre Martine Nitcheu T.

______________________________________________________________________

For over a year now, a group of rebels have caused major damages in the far northern region of Cameroon. Over 3000 people have lost their lives and the situation might even get worse. We might not be physically trained to put an end to this chaos, but we can all play a role in contributing to PEACE. We all have a role to play. We are all a piece of the puzzle and no piece is insignificant in a puzzle. This is why Carlton Smile Charity is inviting you to contribute to peace.

We are inviting you to be a SMILE DONOR by taking part in the #Smile4Peace campaign. The objective is to assemble 3500$ (2.000.000 FCFA) in two months. These funds will be used to reach out to victims of the conflict and families of soldiers that have died on the battle field.

Feel free to share if you care. No matter what happens, make sure you say : I DID SOMETHING.

This project is supervised by Barrister Martine Nitcheu T.

__________________________________________________________________________

Contacts: + (237) 6 53 81 94 93 / + (33) 6 62 84 72 82
