story:
/SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION/

***USPJELI SMO!***

Uspjeh ove kampanje nadmašio je sva naša očekivanja! U svega tri tjedna kampanje prikupili smo tri puta više od zadanog cilja, čak $10,000. Time je omogućen tisak 2,000 slikovnica u novom, ukoričenom izdanju i 2,000 primjeraka prvog izdanja bojanki Moja dugina obitelj, ali i razvoj daljnjih aktivnosti naše udruge, poput grupa podrške duginim obiteljima i novih izdanja slikovnica.

Cijeli tim udruge Dugine obitelji zahvaljuje vam od srca i baca se na dostavu vaših nagrada te slanje slikovnica i bojanki u tisak. <3

***WE'VE MADE IT!***

The success of this campaign has surpassed all our expectations! In just three weeks we've managed to collect three times more than our initial goal - $10,000. This has enabled us printing of 2,000 picture books My Rainbow Family in a new, hardback edition and printing of the first edition of coloring books My Rainbow Family. Along with that, these funds are gonna help further development of the activities of the Rainbow Families association, such us groups of support for Rainbow Families and new editions of the picture book.

The whole team of the Rainbow Families thanks you from the heart and is starting to work on delivery of your perks and putting those picture books and coloring books to print. <3

*******************************************************************************

/SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION/

 ***PREMA TREĆEM CILJU***

Nije prošlo niti 24 sata od kada smo startali našu prvu crowdfunding avanturu i već smo premašili dva zadana cilja! Brzina kojom napreduje ova kampanja potvrđuje nam da u viziji društva koje poštuje i slavi sve obitelji nismo sami - na tome vam ne možemo dovoljno zahvaliti.

Do sada smo prikupili dovoljno sredstava za čak 1000 novih slikovnica te prvih 1000 primjeraka bojanke Moja dugina obitelj. Sve primjerke planiramo besplatno podijeliti svima predbilježenima (uključujući dosadašnje i buduće predbilježbe). Kako bismo osigurali dovoljan broj primjeraka za baš sve one koji žele slikovnicu i bojanku, pozivamo vas da nas podržite i u dolasku do sljedećeg cilja - $10,000 za 1,000 dodatnih primjeraka slikovnice i 1,000 dodatnih primjeraka bojanke Moja dugina obitelj.

Užitak nam je napredovati prema novim ciljevima s vama, uzbuđeni pozdrav od cijelog tima udruge Dugine obitelji! <3

 

***LET'S DOUBLE***

It hasn't been even 24 hrs since we've started our first crowdfunding adventure and we have already surpassed 2 targeted goals. The speed in which this campaign is progressing confirms to us that in envisioning a society that respects and celebrates every family we are not alone - for that, we can't be grateful enough to you.

So far, we have collected enough funds for 1000 new picture books and 1000 copies of our first coloring book My Rainbow Family. We plan to deliver a free copy to everyone subscribed (including so-far and future subscriptions). In order to secure enough copies of both picture book and coloring book to each interested individual, family and organisation, we invite you to support us in reaching our 3rd goal - $10,000 for 1,000 additional copies of picture book and 1000 additional copies of coloring book My Rainbow Family.

It's our pure joy reaching our goals with you, many exciting greets from the entire team of the Rainbow Families association! <3

 

/SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION OF OUR STORY/

***NAŠA PRIČA***


Nestale su u trenu!

Kada smo u siječnju 2018. ponudili 500 besplatnih slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima "Moja dugina obitelj"  javnosti, odaziv je premašio sva naša očekivanja! U času smo razdijelili cijelu zalihu slikovnica te istovremeno zaprimili više stotina novih upita za njenim primjerkom. Naša misija je omogućiti besplatnu slikovnicu "Moja dugina obitelj" baš svim zainteresiranim građanima i organizacijama te tako doprinijeti stvaranju društva u kojem se od malih nogu uči poštivati različitosti i prihvaćati sve obitelji. Pridružite nam se - pomognite nam osigurati sredstva potrebna za tisak 1000 novih primjeraka slikovnice na hrvatskom i engleskom jeziku, i to u još boljoj, ukoričenoj verziji!

 

Prva slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima u Hrvatskoj i regiji

Svaka priča ima svoje heroje, naši se zovu Ana i Roko. Vole sve što i njihovi vršnjaci predškolske dobi – sport, igranje s prijateljima i druženje s roditeljima. Roku je omiljeno voće kruška, a Ani jagoda. I naravno da imaju svoje omiljeno godišnje doba. Ipak, po nečemu se malo razlikuju od svojih vršnjaka – Ana ima dvojicu tate, a Roko dvije mame. I znaju da se takve obitelji zovu dugine obitelji.

Djelo autora/ice Ive Šegote i Maje Škvorc te ilustratora Borne Nikole Žeželja „Moja dugina obitelj” prva je slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima u Hrvatskoj i regiji. Od naročite je koristi upravo djeci iz takvih obitelji jer u njoj mogu prepoznati sebe i svoj svakodnevni život. Uz to, ova slikovnica baš svakom roditelju može pomoći razgovarati sa svojim djetetom o duginim obiteljima i različitostima u društvu koje su dio naše realnosti.

Slikovnica za baš svakog zainteresiranog pojedinca i organizaciju

Brzina kojom je rezervirano prvih 500 primjeraka pokazala nam je da potreba za slikovnicom koja djecu uči o različitim vrstama obitelji postoji - ostvarimo, stoga, njen puni društveni potencijal!

Prvu nakladu tiskali smo uz financijsku potporu Francuskog veleposlanstva u Zagrebu i članova naše udruge i podijelili je besplatno zainteresiranim građanima i organizacijama. Ovom kampanjom cilj nam je tiskati novih 1000 primjeraka slikovnice s tvrdim uvezom na hrvatskom i engleskom jeziku koje ćemo dostaviti svim trenutno predbilježenim građanima u Hrvatskoj i inozemstvu. Vjerujemo da ovom slikovnicom radimo pozitivan pomak u prihvaćanju različitosti u našem društvu, no ne zavaramo se da to možemo sami - potrebna nam je i vaša pomoć.

 

Kako nam možete pomoći?

Podupirući naš projekt pomažete u promicanju tolerancije te sudjelujete u širenju vrijedne i važne poruke – poštivanju i prihvaćanju svih obitelji. Bit ćemo vam zahvalni za svaki način kojim doprinesete većem uspjehu ove kampanje, a posebno:

  • FINANCIJSKOM PODRŠKOM

Financijskom podrškom ovoj kampanji imate priliku, uz financiranje besplatnih primjeraka slikovnice, rezervirati i svoj primjerak slikovnice na hrvatskom ili engleskom jeziku te ugrabiti neki od nagradnih paketa Duginih obitelji.

  • ŠIRENJEM NAŠE PRIČE MEĐU SVOJIM POZNANICIMA

Pomognite nam direktnim pozivanjem barem još jednog frenda/ice da nas financijski podrži i širenjem glasa o ovoj kampanji putem vaših profila na društvenim mrežama. Ovo je sjajna alternativa i ako kampanji niste u mogućnosti doprinijeti financijski. 

 

To nije sve!

Mnogobrojne pozitivne reakcije i komentari koje smo primili u zadnjih nekoliko tjedana motiviraju nas da idemo i korak dalje. Slikovnica „Moja dugina obitelj” prva je beba našeg izdavačkog tima i nadamo se da je to tek početak Aninih i Rokovih avantura. A tu su i drugi izdavački projekti - preko priča za malo starije uzraste, do priručnika i materijala o duginim obiteljima za stručno osoblje u školama i vrtićima. Imate li vi prijedlog za naš sljedeći izadavački projekt? Slobodno nam pišite! Sve kako bismo ispunili našu viziju - društvo koje poštuje, prihvaća i slavi sve obitelji.

 

Tko čini našu obitelj?

Mi smo udruga „Dugine obitelji”, osnovana 2017. nakon niza godina djelovanja kao neformalna građanska inicijativa. Okupljajmo LGBTIQ* parove i pojedince koji imaju djecu, žele imati djecu ili se samo žele informirati o izazovima i lijepim stranama planiranja obitelji.

Kako je riječ o netipičnim obiteljima, razgovor s drugima u sličnim životnim okolnostima može biti vrlo koristan i ohrabrujuć. Naš volonterski rad stoga uključuje organiziranje druženja, grupa podrške, sudjelovanje na okruglim stolovima i još mnogo toga. Slikovnica  „Moja dugina obitelj” naš je prvi projekt u izdavačkim vodama.

Sve je lakše kad imaš nekoga da ti pomogne, a ovo su oni koji su aktivno uz nas u ispunjavanju naših ciljeva:

  • CroL.hr
  • Trans Aid
  • Center for Civil Courage
  • Transparent
  • NELFA
  • RODA
  • GONG
  • Forum za slobodu odgoja
  • Zagreb Pride
  • Centar za mirovne studije
  • LGBTIQ inicijativa Filozofskog fakulteta 'AUT'
  • LORI
  • Iskorak
  • qSPORT
  • International Family Equality Day NETWORK

DUGINE OBITELJI VAM ZAHVALJUJU <3

 

************************************************************************************

 

They Were Gone In a Blink Of an Eye!

In January 2018, when we offered 500 free copies of “My Rainbow Family” a picture book about children with same-sex parents, the public response exceeded all our expectations! In a blink we distributed our entire stash and simultaneously received a few hundred additional requests for a copy. Our mission is to provide a free copy of “My Rainbow Family”to all concerned citizens and organisations, and in doing so to contribute in creating a society in which, from an early age, people are raised to respect diversity and acceptance of all families. Join us – help us to acquire the means necessary to print 1000 new copies of the picture book in both Croatian and English, and in an even better, hardback edition!

 

First Picture Book About Children With Same-sex Parents In Croatia And the Region

Every story has its heroes, ours are named Ana and Roko. They like all the things their peers of preschool age like – sport, playing with friends, and hanging out with their parents. Roko’s favourite fruit is a pear, but Ana’s is a strawberry. Of course they have a favourite season. However, they slightly differ from their peers – Ana has two dads, and Roko has two moms. They know that those types of families are called rainbow families.

The work of authors Ivo Šegota and Maja Škvorc and illustrator Borna Nikola Žeželj “My Rainbow Family” is the first picture book about children with same-sex parents in Croatia and the region. It‘s of exceptional benefit to the children that stem from those types of families because in it they can recognize themselves and their everyday life. In addition, this picture book can help each parent in talking with their child about rainbow families and diversity in society, which are a part of our reality.

 

Picture Book for Every Interested Individual and Organisation

The rate at which the first 500 copies were taken, showed us that the need for a picture book which teaches children about different types of families is present – therefore, we should achieve its full societal potential!

The first edition was published with financial support from the French Embassy in Zagreb and members of our association and distributed for free to concerned citizens and organisations. With this campaign, our goal is to publish 1000 new hardback copies of the picture book in both Croatian and English, which will be delivered to all currently-subscribed citizens in Croatia and abroad. We believe that, with this picture book, we’re taking a positive step forward in accepting diversity in our society, but we’re not fooling ourselves that we can achieve it on our own – we also need your help.

 

How Can YOU Help Us?

By supporting our project, you’re helping in the promotion of tolerance and are participating in the expansion of a valuable and important message – respect and acceptance of all families. We will be grateful for every possible way in which you contribute to this campaign, and especially:

  • BY FINANCIAL SUPPORT

By financial support to this campaign, you have a chance to, in addition to financing free copies of the picture book, reserve your own copy in Croatian or English and grab one of the prize packages of Rainbow Families.

  • BY SPREADING OUR STORY TO YOUR ACQUAINTANCES

Help us by directly calling at least one more of your friends to financially support us and by spreading word of this campaign through your social media networks. This is a great alternative if you don’t have an opportunity to contribute financially.

 

That's Not All!

The numerous positive reactions and comments that we’ve received in the last few weeks motivate us to go one step further. The “My Rainbow Family” picture book is the first baby from our publishing team and we hope that that’s only the beginning of Roko’s and Ana’s adventures. There are other publishing projects – starting with stories for slightly older children, up to handbooks and materials about rainbow families for professional staff in schools and kindergartens. Do you have any suggestion for our next publishing project? Feel free to contact us! We’re prepared to do everything to fulfill our vision – a society which respects, accepts, and celebrates all families.

 

Who Makes Our Family?

We are the “Rainbow Families” association, established in 2017 after years of functioning as an informal citizens’ initiative. We gather LGBTIQ* couples and individuals who have children, want to have children, or just want to be informed about the challenges and rewards of planning a family.

We’re talking about atypical families, so there’s a necessity for a conversation with others in similar circumstances, which can be useful and encouraging. Therefore, our volunteer work includes organising hangouts, support groups, participation in round tables, and much more. “My Rainbow Family” is our first publishing project.

Everything’s easier when you have someone to help you, so here’s the list of organisations who have and continue to help us in accomplishing our goals:

  • CroL.hr
  • Trans Aid
  • Center for Civil Courage
  • Transparent
  • NELFA
  • RODA
  • GONG
  • Forum za slobodu odgoja
  • Zagreb Pride
  • Centar za mirovne studije
  • LGBTIQ inicijativa Filozofskog fakulteta 'AUT'
  • LORI
  • Iskorak
  • qSPORT
  • International Family Equality Day NETWORK

RAINBOW FAMILIES THANK YOU <3
story_txt:
/SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION/***USPJELI SMO!***Uspjeh ove kampanje nadmašio je sva naša očekivanja! U svega tri tjedna kampanje prikupili smo tri puta više od zadanog cilja, čak $10,000. Time je omogućen tisak 2,000 slikovnica u novom, ukoričenom izdanju i 2,000 primjeraka prvog izdanja bojanki Moja dugina obitelj, ali i razvoj daljnjih aktivnosti naše udruge, poput grupa podrške duginim obiteljima i novih izdanja slikovnica.Cijeli tim udruge Dugine obitelji zahvaljuje vam od srca i baca se na dostavu vaših nagrada te slanje slikovnica i bojanki u tisak. <3***WE'VE MADE IT!***The success of this campaign has surpassed all our expectations! In just three weeks we've managed to collect three times more than our initial goal - $10,000. This has enabled us printing of 2,000 picture books My Rainbow Family in a new, hardback edition and printing of the first edition of coloring books My Rainbow Family. Along with that, these funds are gonna help further development of the activities of the Rainbow Families association, such us groups of support for Rainbow Families and new editions of the picture book.The whole team of the Rainbow Families thanks you from the heart and is starting to work on delivery of your perks and putting those picture books and coloring books to print. <3*******************************************************************************/SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION/ ***PREMA TREĆEM CILJU***Nije prošlo niti 24 sata od kada smo startali našu prvu crowdfunding avanturu i već smo premašili dva zadana cilja! Brzina kojom napreduje ova kampanja potvrđuje nam da u viziji društva koje poštuje i slavi sve obitelji nismo sami - na tome vam ne možemo dovoljno zahvaliti.Do sada smo prikupili dovoljno sredstava za čak 1000 novih slikovnica te prvih 1000 primjeraka bojanke Moja dugina obitelj. Sve primjerke planiramo besplatno podijeliti svima predbilježenima (uključujući dosadašnje i buduće predbilježbe). Kako bismo osigurali dovoljan broj primjeraka za baš sve one koji žele slikovnicu i bojanku, pozivamo vas da nas podržite i u dolasku do sljedećeg cilja - $10,000 za 1,000 dodatnih primjeraka slikovnice i 1,000 dodatnih primjeraka bojanke Moja dugina obitelj.Užitak nam je napredovati prema novim ciljevima s vama, uzbuđeni pozdrav od cijelog tima udruge Dugine obitelji! <3 ***LET'S DOUBLE***It hasn't been even 24 hrs since we've started our first crowdfunding adventure and we have already surpassed 2 targeted goals. The speed in which this campaign is progressing confirms to us that in envisioning a society that respects and celebrates every family we are not alone - for that, we can't be grateful enough to you.So far, we have collected enough funds for 1000 new picture books and 1000 copies of our first coloring book My Rainbow Family. We plan to deliver a free copy to everyone subscribed (including so-far and future subscriptions). In order to secure enough copies of both picture book and coloring book to each interested individual, family and organisation, we invite you to support us in reaching our 3rd goal - $10,000 for 1,000 additional copies of picture book and 1000 additional copies of coloring book My Rainbow Family.It's our pure joy reaching our goals with you, many exciting greets from the entire team of the Rainbow Families association! <3 /SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION OF OUR STORY/***NAŠA PRIČA***
Nestale su u trenu!Kada smo u siječnju 2018. ponudili 500 besplatnih slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima "Moja dugina obitelj"  javnosti, odaziv je premašio sva naša očekivanja! U času smo razdijelili cijelu zalihu slikovnica te istovremeno zaprimili više stotina novih upita za njenim primjerkom. Naša misija je omogućiti besplatnu slikovnicu "Moja dugina obitelj" baš svim zainteresiranim građanima i organizacijama te tako doprinijeti stvaranju društva u kojem se od malih nogu uči poštivati različitosti i prihvaćati sve obitelji. Pridružite nam se - pomognite nam osigurati sredstva potrebna za tisak 1000 novih primjeraka slikovnice na hrvatskom i engleskom jeziku, i to u još boljoj, ukoričenoj verziji! Prva slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima u Hrvatskoj i regijiSvaka priča ima svoje heroje, naši se zovu Ana i Roko. Vole sve što i njihovi vršnjaci predškolske dobi – sport, igranje s prijateljima i druženje s roditeljima. Roku je omiljeno voće kruška, a Ani jagoda. I naravno da imaju svoje omiljeno godišnje doba. Ipak, po nečemu se malo razlikuju od svojih vršnjaka – Ana ima dvojicu tate, a Roko dvije mame. I znaju da se takve obitelji zovu dugine obitelji.Djelo autora/ice Ive Šegote i Maje Škvorc te ilustratora Borne Nikole Žeželja „Moja dugina obitelj” prva je slikovnica o djeci s istospolnim roditeljima u Hrvatskoj i regiji. Od naročite je koristi upravo djeci iz takvih obitelji jer u njoj mogu prepoznati sebe i svoj svakodnevni život. Uz to, ova slikovnica baš svakom roditelju može pomoći razgovarati sa svojim djetetom o duginim obiteljima i različitostima u društvu koje su dio naše realnosti. Slikovnica za baš svakog zainteresiranog pojedinca i organizacijuBrzina kojom je rezervirano prvih 500 primjeraka pokazala nam je da potreba za slikovnicom koja djecu uči o različitim vrstama obitelji postoji - ostvarimo, stoga, njen puni društveni potencijal!Prvu nakladu tiskali smo uz financijsku potporu Francuskog veleposlanstva u Zagrebu i članova naše udruge i podijelili je besplatno zainteresiranim građanima i organizacijama. Ovom kampanjom cilj nam je tiskati novih 1000 primjeraka slikovnice s tvrdim uvezom na hrvatskom i engleskom jeziku koje ćemo dostaviti svim trenutno predbilježenim građanima u Hrvatskoj i inozemstvu. Vjerujemo da ovom slikovnicom radimo pozitivan pomak u prihvaćanju različitosti u našem društvu, no ne zavaramo se da to možemo sami - potrebna nam je i vaša pomoć. Kako nam možete pomoći?Podupirući naš projekt pomažete u promicanju tolerancije te sudjelujete u širenju vrijedne i važne poruke – poštivanju i prihvaćanju svih obitelji. Bit ćemo vam zahvalni za svaki način kojim doprinesete većem uspjehu ove kampanje, a posebno:FINANCIJSKOM PODRŠKOMFinancijskom podrškom ovoj kampanji imate priliku, uz financiranje besplatnih primjeraka slikovnice, rezervirati i svoj primjerak slikovnice na hrvatskom ili engleskom jeziku te ugrabiti neki od nagradnih paketa Duginih obitelji.ŠIRENJEM NAŠE PRIČE MEĐU SVOJIM POZNANICIMAPomognite nam direktnim pozivanjem barem još jednog frenda/ice da nas financijski podrži i širenjem glasa o ovoj kampanji putem vaših profila na društvenim mrežama. Ovo je sjajna alternativa i ako kampanji niste u mogućnosti doprinijeti financijski.  To nije sve!Mnogobrojne pozitivne reakcije i komentari koje smo primili u zadnjih nekoliko tjedana motiviraju nas da idemo i korak dalje. Slikovnica „Moja dugina obitelj” prva je beba našeg izdavačkog tima i nadamo se da je to tek početak Aninih i Rokovih avantura. A tu su i drugi izdavački projekti - preko priča za malo starije uzraste, do priručnika i materijala o duginim obiteljima za stručno osoblje u školama i vrtićima. Imate li vi prijedlog za naš sljedeći izadavački projekt? Slobodno nam pišite! Sve kako bismo ispunili našu viziju - društvo koje poštuje, prihvaća i slavi sve obitelji. Tko čini našu obitelj?Mi smo udruga „Dugine obitelji”, osnovana 2017. nakon niza godina djelovanja kao neformalna građanska inicijativa. Okupljajmo LGBTIQ* parove i pojedince koji imaju djecu, žele imati djecu ili se samo žele informirati o izazovima i lijepim stranama planiranja obitelji.Kako je riječ o netipičnim obiteljima, razgovor s drugima u sličnim životnim okolnostima može biti vrlo koristan i ohrabrujuć. Naš volonterski rad stoga uključuje organiziranje druženja, grupa podrške, sudjelovanje na okruglim stolovima i još mnogo toga. Slikovnica  „Moja dugina obitelj” naš je prvi projekt u izdavačkim vodama.Sve je lakše kad imaš nekoga da ti pomogne, a ovo su oni koji su aktivno uz nas u ispunjavanju naših ciljeva:
CroL.hr
Trans Aid
Center for Civil Courage
Transparent
NELFA
RODA
GONG
Forum za slobodu odgoja
Zagreb Pride
Centar za mirovne studije
LGBTIQ inicijativa Filozofskog fakulteta 'AUT'
LORI

International Family Equality Day NETWORK
DUGINE OBITELJI VAM ZAHVALJUJU <3 ************************************************************************************ They Were Gone In a Blink Of an Eye!In January 2018, when we offered 500 free copies of “My Rainbow Family” a picture book about children with same-sex parents, the public response exceeded all our expectations! In a blink we distributed our entire stash and simultaneously received a few hundred additional requests for a copy. Our mission is to provide a free copy of “My Rainbow Family”to all concerned citizens and organisations, and in doing so to contribute in creating a society in which, from an early age, people are raised to respect diversity and acceptance of all families. Join us – help us to acquire the means necessary to print 1000 new copies of the picture book in both Croatian and English, and in an even better, hardback edition! First Picture Book About Children With Same-sex Parents In Croatia And the RegionEvery story has its heroes, ours are named Ana and Roko. They like all the things their peers of preschool age like – sport, playing with friends, and hanging out with their parents. Roko’s favourite fruit is a pear, but Ana’s is a strawberry. Of course they have a favourite season. However, they slightly differ from their peers – Ana has two dads, and Roko has two moms. They know that those types of families are called rainbow families.The work of authors Ivo Šegota and Maja Škvorc and illustrator Borna Nikola Žeželj “My Rainbow Family” is the first picture book about children with same-sex parents in Croatia and the region. It‘s of exceptional benefit to the children that stem from those types of families because in it they can recognize themselves and their everyday life. In addition, this picture book can help each parent in talking with their child about rainbow families and diversity in society, which are a part of our reality. Picture Book for Every Interested Individual and OrganisationThe rate at which the first 500 copies were taken, showed us that the need for a picture book which teaches children about different types of families is present – therefore, we should achieve its full societal potential!The first edition was published with financial support from the French Embassy in Zagreb and members of our association and distributed for free to concerned citizens and organisations. With this campaign, our goal is to publish 1000 new hardback copies of the picture book in both Croatian and English, which will be delivered to all currently-subscribed citizens in Croatia and abroad. We believe that, with this picture book, we’re taking a positive step forward in accepting diversity in our society, but we’re not fooling ourselves that we can achieve it on our own – we also need your help. How Can YOU Help Us?By supporting our project, you’re helping in the promotion of tolerance and are participating in the expansion of a valuable and important message – respect and acceptance of all families. We will be grateful for every possible way in which you contribute to this campaign, and especially:BY FINANCIAL SUPPORTBy financial support to this campaign, you have a chance to, in addition to financing free copies of the picture book, reserve your own copy in Croatian or English and grab one of the prize packages of Rainbow Families.BY SPREADING OUR STORY TO YOUR ACQUAINTANCESHelp us by directly calling at least one more of your friends to financially support us and by spreading word of this campaign through your social media networks. This is a great alternative if you don’t have an opportunity to contribute financially. That's Not All!The numerous positive reactions and comments that we’ve received in the last few weeks motivate us to go one step further. The “My Rainbow Family” picture book is the first baby from our publishing team and we hope that that’s only the beginning of Roko’s and Ana’s adventures. There are other publishing projects – starting with stories for slightly older children, up to handbooks and materials about rainbow families for professional staff in schools and kindergartens. Do you have any suggestion for our next publishing project? Feel free to contact us! We’re prepared to do everything to fulfill our vision – a society which respects, accepts, and celebrates all families. Who Makes Our Family?We are the “Rainbow Families” association, established in 2017 after years of functioning as an informal citizens’ initiative. We gather LGBTIQ* couples and individuals who have children, want to have children, or just want to be informed about the challenges and rewards of planning a family.We’re talking about atypical families, so there’s a necessity for a conversation with others in similar circumstances, which can be useful and encouraging. Therefore, our volunteer work includes organising hangouts, support groups, participation in round tables, and much more. “My Rainbow Family” is our first publishing project.Everything’s easier when you have someone to help you, so here’s the list of organisations who have and continue to help us in accomplishing our goals:

story:
Hello!

I'm Big Tim Stiles. I am the writer and self-publisher behind the comic book Gorilla my Dreams (along with my partner in crime, artist extraordinaire Ahmed Raafat) and this here is our latest creation JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE!

JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE is a character Ahmed and I created with a friend of mine, Josie. We decided we wanted to get her on a t-shirt as soon as possible. 

I was ready to release JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE as just another character in my stable of heroes when I started to see news turning up on my social medias about the rape and murder of a number of women on our streets.

I don't need the money that JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE t-shirts could bring in as much as people using the services of the Rape Crisis Centre.

So, these t-shirts and posters will be sold to raise funds for the Rape Crisis Centre.

The Rape Crisis Centre is a non-government, not for profit, feminist organisation working to eliminate sexual violence against women, young people, children, families and men.

They provide:
* A 24 hour crisis call out service to police and forensic services every day of the year
* A crisis and counselling telephone support service (7 days a week)
* Counselling and group work to survivors of sexual assault and their families and supporters
* Education, training and professional consultation to agencies and private practitioners

We need your help to raise money for the Rape Crisis Centre.

THE PLEDGE LEVELS

Digital Poster

For as little as AU$10 you will get a digital JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE poster sent to your email inbox.

AU$10 pledge: Digital Poster

Poster

AU$20 will get you the sweet A3 full colour JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE poster for whatever wall or flat surface you want to pin it to!

AU$20 pledge: Poster

T-Shirt

For AU$50 you get the JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE t-shirt. You choose the size (see chart below) and colour (Black, White, Heather Grey, Light Blue, Blood Red).

* Free Postage.

AU$50 pledge: T-shirt

T-SHIRT SIZE CHART

Poster & T-Shirt

To get both the A3, full colour JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE poster and the JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE t-shirt, you want the AU$70 level. Again, you choose the size and colour (Black, White, Heather Grey, Light Blue, Blood Red).

AU$70 pledge: Poster & T-shirt

Make YOU a Superhero

Now the MAKE YOU A SUPERHERO level is for the real superheroes here. For AU$200 you'll work with me and Ahmed to create a unique superhero character based on you. This will be your character that you own 100% so you can use him/her to start your own comic book or whatever you like.

Once the character is designed and finished, we'll email you the digital artwork to do with as you please. 

In addition to that we'll print up your superhero on a t-shirt and post it to you, along with both the JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE t-shirt and the A3 poster.

AU$200 pledge: Personalised T-shirt

 WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

The charts below are based on the AU$70 pledge level. Fees & Charges include Indiegogo and payment processing fees.

I've done my best to calculate these percentages but at the end of the day, I will keep every backer up to date each step of the way as to how much each slice of the pie actually costs once the campaign is done. I will provide regular updates throughout fulfilment of this campaign. 

CREATORS

JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE has been hatched from the egg-like craniums of Ahmed Rafaat and Big Tim Stiles, inspired by Josie Dunham.

JOSIE DUNHAM:

Josie Dunham has been involved in the Canberra musical theatre scene since the age of 7. Josie is a singer song writer who plays the ukulele and can be seen around town performing as a vocalist in local bands.

In her spare time she practices yoga and hangs out with her handsome Cavoodle puppy Chief Brody.

Follow Josie on Instagram: @josie.kate_

AHMED RAAFAT:

Ahmed Raafat is an Egyptian comic book artist currently living in the UK. He is the co-creator of "El Osba" (Arabic for: The League), an independent Egyptian superhero comic book series, and has worked on various comic book projects in and outside the UK.

Contacts:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/ahmedraafatart
Twitter: @theahmedraafat
Instagram: @theahmedraafat
Deviant Art: http://ahmedraafatart.deviantart.com/

BIG TIM STILES:

Big Tim Stiles is an Australian writer, actor, and podcaster who has been working in the creative arts for over two decades. After four years of writing comic book reviews for GiantFireBreathingRobot.com he dove into writing his own comics. Currently he is working on  Gorilla my Dreams, the ongoing webcomic about Knockaround-Guy; a gorilla superhero.

Contacts:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/CthulhuWilliams/
Twitter: @CthulhuWilliams or @BigTimStiles

Risks & Challenges

There is always the possibility of an unexpected Drop Bear attack or a stampede of hungry Bunyips, which could make delivery of JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE loot troublesome. However, nothing short of that will derail my plans.

JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE is already completely designed and the only hold up is raising the funds to get them printed up and sent out to you.

I've been a backer on Kickstarter, Indiegogo, and Pozible for long enough to know that problems come up and delays happen. However JOSIE: SHARK RIDER FROM SPACE is a project I want to see succeed (especially using her to raise money for a charity) and any future plans I have for this character (and frankly, any of my other projects) rely 100% on the backers (you guys) being happy and wanting to come back for more.

I can't promise to know every unexpected hurdle that comes my way, but I can promise to keep you in the loop every step of the way.

story:
THE BASICS:

2018 marks the Fifth Anniversary of Abundant Bodies (at the Allied Media Conference in Detroit, MI). This year, Abundant Bodies is once again holding a Network Gathering - a day filled with amazing sessions centered on the experiences of Indigenous, Black, People of Color, Dis/abled, Super-sized, Trans and Queer fat folks to build a more beautiful, body accepting and abundant loving future! 

WE NEED YOU, FATTIE WON KANOBI:

We need your help to fund our presenters, panelists and even host a large-scale event for all our Abundant Bodies attendees at AMC 2018. We need community support in order to make sure all our presenters and panelists can make it to Detroit for the Conference in June and provide some support additional lodging support. At our $1500 goal, we would be able to provide a small stipend for all involved AND host a large-scale event where presenters, panelists, and attendees will have a space safe for fellow beautiful, body accepting and abundant bodies.

Budget Breakdown:

Session honoraria: 6 sessions x $100 each = $600

Picnic/lunch session (food for all participants): $200

Travel support for participants: $400

Large-Scale (Secret, TBA) Event: $300

TOTAL PROJECTED: $1500.00 

If some of our presenters do not require these funds, we will re-distribute them to participants who can't make it to the conference without more financial support. We will also prioritize workshop presenters and coordinators if we are unable to reach our fundraising goal and any additional funds will go towards fat community activities/track at next year’s AMC.

 

ABOUT ABUNDANT BODIES:

The Abundant Bodies track gathers, shares and celebrates the wisdom and abundance of our bodies. Abundant / thick / fat bodies are the target of so much hate, policing and negativity, even in our organizing communities. How do we unlearn mainstream ideas of what a body should look like and (re)-learn to celebrate the diversity, resilience, wisdom and beauty of all bodies? How can we work together to deconstruct fat stigma and other forms of marginalization while building a stronger inclusive fat community? How can we challenge ourselves to decenter whiteness, capitalism, ableism, cissexism, heterosexism and classism while we explore what it means to be fat?

This track will explore these questions and create spaces to challenge the ongoing ways mainstream media shames and harms abundant bodies. Our goal in our organizing and activism is to create media and practical strategies for resistance, healing and community building. Through workshops, panels and skillshares we will transform mainstream ideas around abundant bodies and create resilient communities utilizing different forms of media such as zines, theater, oral histories, poetry, social media, dance, comics, and art. The topics that sessions will cover this summer include fat sex, afro fat futurism, uplifting fat POC narratives, and much more!

BRING ME THE PERKS:

We have a ton of cool perks to offer you in exchange for some dollar bills & bitcoin. Take a peak at just a few below:

 

THE BOTTOM LINE:

We're a bunch of radical fatties looking to change the world (and give others a chance at the mic too) so throw some spare change our way and we can make a difference together.

And hey - if you don't have a dollar to spare, we've been there. Just share our campaign on social media and don't forget to tag us @abundantbodies.
story_txt:
THE BASICS:
2018 marks the Fifth Anniversary of Abundant Bodies (at the Allied Media Conference in Detroit, MI). This year, Abundant Bodies is once again holding a Network Gathering - a day filled with amazing sessions centered on the experiences of Indigenous, Black, People of Color, Dis/abled, Super-sized, Trans and Queer fat folks to build a more beautiful, body accepting and abundant loving future!

story:
Using the war for cover, management is trying to dismantle a Palestinian workers' committee – join the struggle!

The workers at Zarfati Garage in Mishor Adumim Industrial Zone (occupied Palestinian territory) were employed for years under exploitative conditions and without any rights, against labor laws. They organized with WAC-Maan and have since been negotiating over a collective contract with the management.

With the war for cover, the management initiated firing proceedings against committee Chairman, Hatem Abuzeade, on false accusations of a security risk. The strike faced a violent assault and intimidation from the local industrialist union and Ma'ale Adumim Police which arrested Maan organizers including the CEO, and even revoked the committee Chairman's permit for entry into the Industrial Zone. This persecution has forced us to take on a great deal of legal aid against the witch-hunt. Join the struggle to help us fund our legal defense.

!בחסות המלחמה מנסה ההנהלה לפרק ועד עובדים פלסטיניים - הצטרפו למאבק

עובדי מוסך צרפתי במישור אדומים הועסקו במשך שנים בתנאי ניצול וללא כל זכויות בניגוד לחוק. הם התאגדו במען ומאז מתנהל מו"מ על הסכם קיבוצי עם ההנהלה. בחסות המלחמה יזמה ההנהלה מהלך לפיטורי יו"ר הועד, חאתם אבו זיאדה, בתואנת שווא ביטחונית. השביתה נתקלה בהתקפה אלימה והפחדה מצד ועד התעשיינים המקומי ומשטרת מעלה אדומים שעצרה פעילי מען כולל המנכ"ל. רדיפה זו חייבה אותנו לפנות לסיוע משפטי רחב מול ציד המכשפות. הצטרפותכם למאבק תסייע לנו לממן הגנה משפטית.

story:
Surf Camp for Kids in India

The same surf camp that a group from Nags Head Church has put on in North Carolina's Outer Banks, will be put together for some youth in India.

I am excited to have the opportunity to teach children a new skill and interact with a new culture. You can help by contributing to my travel expenses. Any amount really helps.

We are shipping surfboards, accessories, and tshirts and will be leaving a lot of that equipment for the children to keep and continue their surfing when we leave.

You can help by contributing to my travel expenses. Any amount really helps.We are shipping surfboards, accessories, and tshirts and will be leaving a lot of that equipment for the children to keep and continue their surfing when we leave.

story:
ENGLISH BELOW

---

Nakon raspada bivše Jugoslavije, ratovi koji su se vodili u periodu od 1991. do 2001. godine ostavli su za sobom preko 130 000 žrtava, više od 10 000 nestalih osoba, uništene gradove, veliki broj raseljenih ljudi i društva koja se međusobom ne razumeju i ne priznaju. Svaka država ima svoju verziju dešavanja koja se od države do države u potpunosti razlikuje. Ljudski odnosi su trajno narušeni a nacionalizam je ostao glavna ideologija svih državnih politika.

Incijativa mladih za ljudska prava osnovana je 2003.godine sa ciljem uspostavljanja odnosa između mladih ljudi koji žive u zemljama bivše Jugoslavije. Kroz programe razmene koji su uključivali edukaciju o prošlosti baziranu na utvrđenim činjenicama i učenje o ljudskim pravima izgrađene su trajne veze među mladima u regionu a njihovo upoznavanje sa “drugim i drugačijim” je većini zauvek promenilo živote.

Jedan od sastavnih delova u radu organizacije (Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava) čini aktivistička mreža mladih, koji svoju potrebu da budu aktivni građani izražavaju kroz najrazličitije aktivističke akcije. Svi aktivistički poduhvati, kako u zemlji tako i u regionu, bili su usmereni ka izgradnji društva u kome će svaki građanin osećati zadovoljno, bez obzira na poreklo, nacionalnost, religiju, seksualno opredeljenje.

Aktivizmom smo tražili poštovanje prava nacionalnih manjina, ukazivali smo na potrebu da ljudi pamte ljude i njihove priča bez obzira njihovu nacionalnost, kritikovali smo sve političare koji nisu poštovali činjenice utvrđene o sukobima i koji su se služili ratnohuškačkom retorikom i govorom mržnje, tražili smo osudu politike koja je dovela a do ratova, pozivali smo na mir i bili smo solidarni sa drugim ugroženim pojedincima i grupama.

Osmoro aktivista i aktivistkinja Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava osuđeno je na kazne od po 50.000,00 din jer su na javnom skupu u Domu kulture u Beški (17. januara 2017. godine) na kome je govorio osuđeni ratni zločinac, Veselin Šljivančanin, organizovanom od strane vladajuće stranke, duvali u pištaljke i izneli transparent sa natpisom “Ratni zločinci da zaćute da bi se progovorilo o žrtvama”. Ovaj čin aktivista je, presudom prekršajnog suda, okarakterisan kao drsko i bezobzirno ponašanje, pa tako i kao narušavanje javnog reda i mira.

 

Aktivisti i aktivistkinje Inicijative mladih nikada neće pristati na političku stvarnost u kojoj su mirovni aktivisti i branitelji ljudskih prava ućutkani, a ratni zločinci zaštićeni ili slavljeni od strane celokupnog državnog aparata – predsednika, Vlade, tužilaštva, sudova i lokalnih samouprava.

U Beški smo, 2017. godine, pokušali da ukažemo na nedopustivu podršku koja se od strane vladajuće stranke pruža osuđenom ratnom zločincu Veselinu Šljivančaninu, koji je osuđen za pomaganje i podržavanje mučenja kao kršenja zakona i običaja ratovanja, te da je propustio da zaštiti zarobljenike od zlostavljanja 20. novembra 1991, godine, pre povlačenja vojnika JNA sa poljoprivrednog dobra Ovčara blizu Vukovara.

Na tribinu u Beški došli smo sa jednim transparentom, nekoliko pištaljki i jednim fotoaparatom. Kada je došao red da se Veselin Šljivančanin obrati prisutnima, deo aktivista je dunuo u pištaljke a dve aktivistkinje su razvile transparent na kome je pisalo: Ratni zločinci da zaćute da bi se progovorilo o žrtvama. Tokom ove akcije naši aktivisti su fizički napadnuti i nasilno izbačeni iz sale, dvoje aktivista završilo je u Urgentnom centru sa povredama glave, ruke i noge a njihov automobil je bio uništen.

Nekoliko dana nakon ove akcije na vrata kancelarije Inicijative došla je grupica pripadnika ekstremno desne organizacije “Alternativa”, tom prilikom su ulazna vrata kancelarije bila oblepljena uvredljivim nalepnicama i porukama.

Više informacija o napadu na aktiviste Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava na tribini Srpske napredne stranke u Beški i svim događajima koji se posledično dešavaju, možete pronaći ovde.

I danas nakon presude, koja je doneta u najkraćem mogućem roku, naša poruka ostaje ista, naša misija nepromenja a potreba da kreiramo društvo koje vrednuje mir za buduće generacije sve veća.

Uprkos svemu nismo ostali nemi na predavanja ratnih zločinaca na Vojnoj akademiji, od momenta izricanja drugostepene presude Vojislavu Šešelju tražimo od skupštine da konstatuje prestanak mandata jer je njegov boravak u Skupštini postao nezakonit. Nismo ćutali na prisustvo osuđenih ratnih zločinaca u parlamentarnim poltičkim strankama a glasno smo se usprotivili i štampanju knjiga osuđenih ratnih zločinaca od strane Ministarstva odbrane. Koliko god se trudili da nas ućutkaju mi nećemo odustati jer obavezu da ovome govorimo shvatamo kao ličnu i građansku dužnost.

*Pogledajte naš izveštaj o učešću ratnih zločinaca u političkom životu iz 2017.godine

Neretko, delovanje aktivista Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava, u zemljama u kojima deluju, nailazi na otpor određenih grupa, pre svega ekstremnih desičara i nacionalista. Međutim, znamo koliko našim susedima u regionu, prvenstveno žrtvama, znači da se oni koji su odgovorni za najteža nedela ne promovišu kao uzori. Znamo da su pravi heroji oni koji svakoga dana biraju da ljude posmatraju kao ljude i koji svojim delovanje doprinose prevazilaženju predrasuda i mržnje. Znamo i da se o pravim herojima ne priča dovoljno jer njihov prostor uz podršku države zauzimaju zločinci. Zbog svega ovoga, ne odustajemo!

Kaznu u visini od 450.000 dinara (sa uračunatim sudskim troškovima) moramo da platimo kako bismo nastavili sa svojim daljim radom, i tu nam je neophodna pomoć svih koji veruju da sa prošlošću moramo da se suočimo kako bismo mladim ostavili prostor za izgradnju budućnosti bez konflikata.

Važno nam je da nastavimo sa svojim radom jer verujemo da doprinosi prevazilaženju prepreka koje postoje među državama i ljudima koji žive u regionu. Verujemo da samo ako napravimo jasan otklon od politike koja je zločine podsticala i od onih koji su ih činili, možemo da se bavimo regionalnom saradnjom na svim drugim poljima, jer će ona tada biti rasterećena svega onoga što danas onemogućava dijalog.

Želimo da nastavimo da zajedno sa našim kolegama svakoga dana radimo na izgradnji održivog mira. Ne želimo nove ratove i ne želimo da nam oružje diktira odnose jer posledice toga žive svi ljudi na prostoru bivše Jugoslavije.

 

***********************
 

After the disintegration of Yugoslavia, the conflicts that occurred between 1991 and 2001 left in their wake over 130 000 victims, more than 10 000 missing persons, demolished cities, many displaced persons and societies that fail to understand and recognize one another. Each state has its own version of events, all which differ vastly from each other. Human relations have been permanently corroded, and nationalism has emerged as the leading ideology of all state politics.  

The Youth Initiative for Human Rights was founded in 2003 with the aim of establishing relationships between youth who live in ex-Yugoslavian states. Through exchange programmes, which included teaching about a fact-based past and about human rights, permanent bonds were formed between youth in the region. Getting to know the “other” and the “different” has left a positive and lasting mark in their lives.

One of the pivotal elements in the work of the Youth Initiative for Human Rights is its activist network, made of activists who express their need to be active citizens through various protests and actions. All activist endeavors, both in Serbia and within the region, have aimed at building a society where every citizen would be content, no matter their origins, nationality, religion or sexual orientation.

With our activism we have demanded the respect of minority rights; raised awareness about the need for keeping the memory of people’s stories regardless of their nationalities; criticized politicians who disregarded facts about the conflicts and who used war mongering rhetorics and hate speech; asked for an end to the type of politics that led to the war; called for peace and stood in solidarity with individuals and groups who were at risk.

Eight Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists have been sentenced to a fine of 50 000 Serbian dinars per person for protesting at a public event in Beška organized by the ruling party (on January 17 2017) where convicted war criminal Veselin Šljivančanin was giving a speech.

Activists were blowing into whistles and holding a banner stating “War criminals should be silent so that the victims could be heard”. The Court deemed the activists’ behavior as insolent, disorderly, and convicted them of disturbing the peace.

 

Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists will never accept a political reality where peace activists and human rights defenders are silenced, while war criminals are glorified and protected by the entire state apparatus – the President, government, public attorney’s office, courts and local self-government.

In 2017 in Beška we attempted to call out the unacceptable support the ruling party gave convicted war criminal Veselin Šljivančanin, who was convicted of accessory in torture, as well as of neglecting his duty to protect prisoners of war from torture on November 20 1991, prior to the retreat of the Yugoslav People’s Army soldiers from Ovčara near Vukovar.

We came to the event in Beška with one banner, several whistles and one camera. When Veselin Šljivančanin was about to address the audience, some of the activists began blowing into their whistles, while two others revealed a banner stating : “War criminals should be silent so the victims could be heard”. The activists were then physically assaulted and violently removed from the auditorium. Two activists ended up in the ER with head trauma, as well as arm and leg injuries. Their car had been destroyed.

A few days after the protest, members of the extreme right-wing organization “Alternativa” came to the Youth Initiative for Human Rights office and plastered the front door with insulting messages and stickers.

More information about the attack on activists of the Youth Initiative for Human Rights at the public event of the Serbian Progressive Party in Beška and the events that are happening consequently can be found here.

Today, after the verdict (which had been brought in a very short time span), our message remains the same, as does our mission, and our need to create a society for future generations, one where peace is valued, grows ever stronger.

Despite everything, we remained vocal about the lectures given by war criminals at the Military Academy in Belgrade. We have also called for an immediate ending of Vojislav Šešelj’s mandate in the National Assembly, as his presence there became illegal the moment he was convicted. We weren’t silent about the presence of convicted war criminals in parliamentary political parties, nor when the Ministry of Defense published books written by convicted war criminals. No matter how hard they try to silence us, we will not back down - it is our personal and civic duty to never stop talking about this.

Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists have often faced a lot of opposition, primarily that of extreme right-wing and nationalist groups. We know how important it is for our neighbors in the region, and especially for the victims, to not have those who are guilty of heinous crimes be portrayed as role models.

We know that the true heroes are the ones who choose to view each person as a human being and who contribute to the erasure of prejudice and hatred with their actions. We know that true heroes are rarely spoken of, because they are being overshadowed by state supported war criminals.

We are required to pay the 4400 $ fine in order to continue our work. To achieve this, we need the help of all those who believe that we must face the past to allow youth to build a conflict-free future. We strive to continue working towards sustainable peace with all our fellow activists. We don’t want renewed wars and to be ruled over by guns because the consequences of conflicts are still the reality of all the people living in the former Yugoslavia territory.

It is important for us to continue our work, as we believe it greatly contributes to overcoming the barriers that still exist between the states and people in this region. We also believe that firmly stepping away from the politics that nurtured crimes and those who committed them is the only way to achieve regional collaboration in a manner that is now rendered impossible by what remains unsolved from the past.

Svi aktivistički poduhvati, kako u zemlji tako i u regionu, bili su usmereni ka izgradnji društva u kome će svaki građanin osećati zadovoljno, bez obzira na poreklo, nacionalnost, religiju, seksualno opredeljenje.Aktivizmom smo tražili poštovanje prava nacionalnih manjina, ukazivali smo na potrebu da ljudi pamte ljude i njihove priča bez obzira njihovu nacionalnost, kritikovali smo sve političare koji nisu poštovali činjenice utvrđene o sukobima i koji su se služili ratnohuškačkom retorikom i govorom mržnje, tražili smo osudu politike koja je dovela a do ratova, pozivali smo na mir i bili smo solidarni sa drugim ugroženim pojedincima i grupama.Osmoro aktivista i aktivistkinja Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava osuđeno je na kazne od po 50.000,00 din jer su na javnom skupu u Domu kulture u Beški (17. januara 2017. godine) na kome je govorio osuđeni ratni zločinac, Veselin Šljivančanin, organizovanom od strane vladajuće stranke, duvali u pištaljke i izneli transparent sa natpisom “Ratni zločinci da zaćute da bi se progovorilo o žrtvama”. Ovaj čin aktivista je, presudom prekršajnog suda, okarakterisan kao drsko i bezobzirno ponašanje, pa tako i kao narušavanje javnog reda i mira.

 
Aktivisti i aktivistkinje Inicijative mladih nikada neće pristati na političku stvarnost u kojoj su mirovni aktivisti i branitelji ljudskih prava ućutkani, a ratni zločinci zaštićeni ili slavljeni od strane celokupnog državnog aparata – predsednika, Vlade, tužilaštva, sudova i lokalnih samouprava.U Beški smo, 2017. godine, pokušali da ukažemo na nedopustivu podršku koja se od strane vladajuće stranke pruža osuđenom ratnom zločincu Veselinu Šljivančaninu, koji je osuđen za pomaganje i podržavanje mučenja kao kršenja zakona i običaja ratovanja, te da je propustio da zaštiti zarobljenike od zlostavljanja 20. novembra 1991, godine, pre povlačenja vojnika JNA sa poljoprivrednog dobra Ovčara blizu Vukovara.Na tribinu u Beški došli smo sa jednim transparentom, nekoliko pištaljki i jednim fotoaparatom. Kada je došao red da se Veselin Šljivančanin obrati prisutnima, deo aktivista je dunuo u pištaljke a dve aktivistkinje su razvile transparent na kome je pisalo: Ratni zločinci da zaćute da bi se progovorilo o žrtvama. Tokom ove akcije naši aktivisti su fizički napadnuti i nasilno izbačeni iz sale, dvoje aktivista završilo je u Urgentnom centru sa povredama glave, ruke i noge a njihov automobil je bio uništen.Nekoliko dana nakon ove akcije na vrata kancelarije Inicijative došla je grupica pripadnika ekstremno desne organizacije “Alternativa”, tom prilikom su ulazna vrata kancelarije bila oblepljena uvredljivim nalepnicama i porukama.Više informacija o napadu na aktiviste Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava na tribini Srpske napredne stranke u Beški i svim događajima koji se posledično dešavaju, možete pronaći ovde.I danas nakon presude, koja je doneta u najkraćem mogućem roku, naša poruka ostaje ista, naša misija nepromenja a potreba da kreiramo društvo koje vrednuje mir za buduće generacije sve veća.Uprkos svemu nismo ostali nemi na predavanja ratnih zločinaca na Vojnoj akademiji, od momenta izricanja drugostepene presude Vojislavu Šešelju tražimo od skupštine da konstatuje prestanak mandata jer je njegov boravak u Skupštini postao nezakonit. Nismo ćutali na prisustvo osuđenih ratnih zločinaca u parlamentarnim poltičkim strankama a glasno smo se usprotivili i štampanju knjiga osuđenih ratnih zločinaca od strane Ministarstva odbrane. Koliko god se trudili da nas ućutkaju mi nećemo odustati jer obavezu da ovome govorimo shvatamo kao ličnu i građansku dužnost.*Pogledajte naš izveštaj o učešću ratnih zločinaca u političkom životu iz 2017.godineNeretko, delovanje aktivista Inicijative mladih za ljudska prava, u zemljama u kojima deluju, nailazi na otpor određenih grupa, pre svega ekstremnih desičara i nacionalista. Međutim, znamo koliko našim susedima u regionu, prvenstveno žrtvama, znači da se oni koji su odgovorni za najteža nedela ne promovišu kao uzori. Znamo da su pravi heroji oni koji svakoga dana biraju da ljude posmatraju kao ljude i koji svojim delovanje doprinose prevazilaženju predrasuda i mržnje. Znamo i da se o pravim herojima ne priča dovoljno jer njihov prostor uz podršku države zauzimaju zločinci. Zbog svega ovoga, ne odustajemo!Kaznu u visini od 450.000 dinara (sa uračunatim sudskim troškovima) moramo da platimo kako bismo nastavili sa svojim daljim radom, i tu nam je neophodna pomoć svih koji veruju da sa prošlošću moramo da se suočimo kako bismo mladim ostavili prostor za izgradnju budućnosti bez konflikata.Važno nam je da nastavimo sa svojim radom jer verujemo da doprinosi prevazilaženju prepreka koje postoje među državama i ljudima koji žive u regionu. Verujemo da samo ako napravimo jasan otklon od politike koja je zločine podsticala i od onih koji su ih činili, možemo da se bavimo regionalnom saradnjom na svim drugim poljima, jer će ona tada biti rasterećena svega onoga što danas onemogućava dijalog.Želimo da nastavimo da zajedno sa našim kolegama svakoga dana radimo na izgradnji održivog mira. Ne želimo nove ratove i ne želimo da nam oružje diktira odnose jer posledice toga žive svi ljudi na prostoru bivše Jugoslavije. *********************** After the disintegration of Yugoslavia, the conflicts that occurred between 1991 and 2001 left in their wake over 130 000 victims, more than 10 000 missing persons, demolished cities, many displaced persons and societies that fail to understand and recognize one another. Each state has its own version of events, all which differ vastly from each other. Human relations have been permanently corroded, and nationalism has emerged as the leading ideology of all state politics.  The Youth Initiative for Human Rights was founded in 2003 with the aim of establishing relationships between youth who live in ex-Yugoslavian states. Through exchange programmes, which included teaching about a fact-based past and about human rights, permanent bonds were formed between youth in the region. Getting to know the “other” and the “different” has left a positive and lasting mark in their lives.One of the pivotal elements in the work of the Youth Initiative for Human Rights is its activist network, made of activists who express their need to be active citizens through various protests and actions. All activist endeavors, both in Serbia and within the region, have aimed at building a society where every citizen would be content, no matter their origins, nationality, religion or sexual orientation.With our activism we have demanded the respect of minority rights; raised awareness about the need for keeping the memory of people’s stories regardless of their nationalities; criticized politicians who disregarded facts about the conflicts and who used war mongering rhetorics and hate speech; asked for an end to the type of politics that led to the war; called for peace and stood in solidarity with individuals and groups who were at risk.Eight Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists have been sentenced to a fine of 50 000 Serbian dinars per person for protesting at a public event in Beška organized by the ruling party (on January 17 2017) where convicted war criminal Veselin Šljivančanin was giving a speech.Activists were blowing into whistles and holding a banner stating “War criminals should be silent so that the victims could be heard”. The Court deemed the activists’ behavior as insolent, disorderly, and convicted them of disturbing the peace.

 
Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists will never accept a political reality where peace activists and human rights defenders are silenced, while war criminals are glorified and protected by the entire state apparatus – the President, government, public attorney’s office, courts and local self-government.In 2017 in Beška we attempted to call out the unacceptable support the ruling party gave convicted war criminal Veselin Šljivančanin, who was convicted of accessory in torture, as well as of neglecting his duty to protect prisoners of war from torture on November 20 1991, prior to the retreat of the Yugoslav People’s Army soldiers from Ovčara near Vukovar.We came to the event in Beška with one banner, several whistles and one camera. When Veselin Šljivančanin was about to address the audience, some of the activists began blowing into their whistles, while two others revealed a banner stating : “War criminals should be silent so the victims could be heard”. The activists were then physically assaulted and violently removed from the auditorium. Two activists ended up in the ER with head trauma, as well as arm and leg injuries. Their car had been destroyed.A few days after the protest, members of the extreme right-wing organization “Alternativa” came to the Youth Initiative for Human Rights office and plastered the front door with insulting messages and stickers.More information about the attack on activists of the Youth Initiative for Human Rights at the public event of the Serbian Progressive Party in Beška and the events that are happening consequently can be found here.Today, after the verdict (which had been brought in a very short time span), our message remains the same, as does our mission, and our need to create a society for future generations, one where peace is valued, grows ever stronger.Despite everything, we remained vocal about the lectures given by war criminals at the Military Academy in Belgrade. We have also called for an immediate ending of Vojislav Šešelj’s mandate in the National Assembly, as his presence there became illegal the moment he was convicted. We weren’t silent about the presence of convicted war criminals in parliamentary political parties, nor when the Ministry of Defense published books written by convicted war criminals. No matter how hard they try to silence us, we will not back down - it is our personal and civic duty to never stop talking about this.Youth Initiative for Human Rights activists have often faced a lot of opposition, primarily that of extreme right-wing and nationalist groups. We know how important it is for our neighbors in the region, and especially for the victims, to not have those who are guilty of heinous crimes be portrayed as role models.We know that the true heroes are the ones who choose to view each person as a human being and who contribute to the erasure of prejudice and hatred with their actions. We know that true heroes are rarely spoken of, because they are being overshadowed by state supported war criminals.We are required to pay the 4400 $ fine in order to continue our work. To achieve this, we need the help of all those who believe that we must face the past to allow youth to build a conflict-free future. We strive to continue working towards sustainable peace with all our fellow activists. We don’t want renewed wars and to be ruled over by guns because the consequences of conflicts are still the reality of all the people living in the former Yugoslavia territory.It is important for us to continue our work, as we believe it greatly contributes to overcoming the barriers that still exist between the states and people in this region. We also believe that firmly stepping away from the politics that nurtured crimes and those who committed them is the only way to achieve regional collaboration in a manner that is now rendered impossible by what remains unsolved from the past.

story:
CARTA DE INTENCIÓN

El cuatro de marzo del 2016 escribí un email al periodista Pedro Salinas. Fue la primera vez que le escribía en mi vida. El día anterior había terminado de leer su libro Mitad monjes, mitad soldados, libro publicado el 2014 y escrito con la colaboración de la periodista Paola Ugaz. Al residir en Madrid, no había podido hacerme con el libro anteriormente. Esperé un tiempo hasta que Paola pudo mandarme un ejemplar. Apenas lo recibí, lo devoré en una tarde.

Al día siguiente escribí a Salinas el email titulado: “Obsesiones”. En ese email le confesaba que había leído el libro con intriga, con pasión, pero también con amargura. Estaba claro que esa publicación era el punto culminante de un proceso de varios años y no pocos sacrificios. También le comentaba lo que más me había emocionado de su obra: el compromiso por resolver una historia que llevaba años persiguiéndolo.

En varias ocasiones me he sentido igual. Paola Ugaz, además de periodista ha sido también productora de mis proyectos audiovisuales anteriores. Trabajó conmigo a lo largo de tres años en el proyecto que hicimos en Bagua. Todo lo ocurrido antes, durante y después del 5 de junio del 2009 en el hecho conocido como Baguazo se volvió parte de nuestra vida durante mucho tiempo. De ahí salieron dos películas: el documental La Espera, que llegó a ser vista por más de cien mil personas, y aún se sigue proyectando en auditorios y eventos especiales; y el cortometraje Sólo te puedo mostrar el color, corto que tuvo su estreno mundial en la Berlinale 2014. De Bagua a la alfombra roja de Berlín hubo mucho trabajo y no poco sufrimiento, Paola y mi equipo pueden dar fe de ello. Bagua, sus conflictos, sus enredos políticos, su complejidad social, y las interminables horas de viajes, todo eso fue mi vida durante años y aún hoy lo sigue siendo. Es un tema que nunca dejaré del todo.

Por ello entiendo bien lo que significa que un tema no lo abandone a uno. Eso lo volví a sentir leyendo Mitad monjes, mitad soldados. Lo sentí al leer cada capítulo, desde la introducción hasta el epílogo. Lo sentí al revisar las entrevistas y reportajes que surgieron a raíz del libro. Pero, a diferencia de lo ocurrido con Pedro Salinas, a mí Bagua no me ocurrió personalmente. No lo viví. No lo he sufrí en primera persona. Fue una investigación hecha con tiempo y distancia. En cambio, todo lo que concernía al Sodalicio, Pedro Salinas lo vivió y lo atestiguó de primera mano. De ahí la emoción: el compromiso con una historia que venía arrastrándose por años y que por fin salía a la luz, la sensación de peso terrible que por fin se liberaba en cada una de las personas cuyos testimonios están en el libro. Más que una historia, era una obsesión. Una obsesión por liberarse, y una necesidad de que los culpables sean señalados. Y creo que si hay algo que debemos rescatar siempre de la gente son sus obsesiones.

Leí el libro de tirón y en varias oportunidades me urgía las ganas de hacer algo, de hablar con alguien, de abrazar a alguien, de golpear a alguien. Por fin, escribí a Pedro Salinas y le expliqué que sentía la necesidad de dedicar mi energía y mi tiempo a hacer de este libro una película. Creo que es imprescindible que esta película se haga. Los cines peruanos deben mostrar la historia que el libro ha recogido. El público debe ir a ver esa película y debe comentarla, debe hablar de ella, debe discutirla, debe recordarla. Como los libros, las películas también quedan siempre en la memoria. Es una huella que dejamos en la historia. Pero libros y películas alcanzan fibras distintas. El libro existe, pero hace falta una obra audiovisual tratada con delicadeza que toque esas otras fibras.

Hay un motivo fundamental que me empuja a hacer esta película: la necesidad de hablar que manifiestan las personas en Mitad monjes, mitad soldados. La importancia del testimonio, de la voz. El derecho a hablar y a ser escuchados. Desde que leí el libro tengo claro que la película debe tratarse de un registro coral con distintas voces y distintos escenarios. Partiendo de los testimonios que están en el libro, y continuando con los que hemos recogido estos meses de trabajo (declaraciones de distintas víctimas, el interrogatorio al propio Luis Figari, etc.), queremos armar distintos capítulos donde primen las voces de los protagonistas. El vídeo que está aquí arriba es un boceto, un ensayo. Para ello es importante que los que han estado callados por años, por fin, hablen. Es una responsabilidad para nuestra conciencia como ciudadanos frente al dolor y al peligro que causan actores sociales como los líderes del Sodalicio, sus terribles modus operandis y su perverso discurso.

Ese es mi compromiso. A sacar la película adelante. Seguramente será una película modesta en recursos pero creemos que también será potente en su contenido. No ganaremos ningún Óscar como Spotlight. No podemos prometer si la verá mucha o poca gente. Sólo puedo prometer dedicación y cuidado hacia el tema del libro, hacia sus personajes, y hacia el cine, como arte de expresión. Lo importante es hacer una buena película. Y esto solo lo podemos hacer con la ayuda de muchas más personas. Luego, que pase lo que tenga que pasar.

Que la obsesión no termine.

 

Fernando Vílchez Rodríguez

 

¿QUÉ NECESITAMOS?

Necesitamos 30 mil dólares para realizar esta película basada en el libro Mitad monjes, mitad soldados de Pedro Salinas. Esto se irá exclusivamente en los gastos de producción, alquiler de material y equipo técnico. Es lo mínimo para poder realizar al rodaje que deseamos hacer en noviembre, luego de estos meses de investigación y seguimiento del caso. De esa manera, podemos terminar la película y cumplir nuestra meta que es entregarla al Papa Francisco en su próxima visita a Perú.

 

¿CÓMO APOYAR?

La manera más simple de apoyarnos es donando lo que se pueda, la suma más significativa hace la diferencia. Cualquier aporte es válido y lo agradeceremos muchísimo. Creemos en una manera distinta de hacer cine y este tipo de  plataformas nos ayudan a poder acercarnos a lo que queremos hacer. Todos los que aporten a esta campaña aparecerán en los créditos de la película como colaboradores (a menos que deseen guardar el anonimato).

También puedes hacer donaciones directamente a la cuenta de banco:

-Cuenta INTERBANK (Perú) en Dólares

086-3101489172

CCI: 003-086013101489172-68

Y si no puedes aportar económicamente para el proyecto, pero te interesa apoyarnos, puedes compartir la campaña en redes sociales, Facebook o Twitter y que la gente conozca y hable de ella. Mientras todos hagamos eco, casos como estos no quedarán impunes. 

Muchas gracias.

story:
Our mission

In the past, family-centered structures and low divorce rates encouraged tight family bonds and made the responsibility of elderly caring more straightforward than today. At present, the senior population (60-year-old or above) is growing rapidly and is projected to rise from 12% to 22% of the world’s population by 2050. At the same time, 80% of older people will be coming from low- and middle-income countries.

These dramatic changes in the composition of the population will pose new challenges, such as the substantial potential for growth in the senior population with impaired mobility on the account of age. Therefore, it is important to enhance their accessibility experience, in terms of home-care or logistic supporting services. Our mission is to improve the existing supporting services, especially for those with disabilities or chronic conditions.

The growing senior population should get choice of quality care they want and need. CareEasy provides affordable accessible aid to the elderly, disabled person and their caregivers. We comprise of experienced home relocation specialists, volunteers and academia. As one of the first contact points to the senior residents, we provide consultation service for installation of our proprietary accessible hardware at their home on request. In addition, we care about home safety. Our home relocation service targets to provide optimized furniture arrangement at home, for users’ safety sake.

 

Our services

  1. Promote accessibility issues awareness

We are aware that the current accessibility may not be sufficient to deal with the growing senior population. As such, we collaborate with schools and NGOs to organize activities, such as workshop training to design and make home-accessible hardware to support the daily living issues of the elderly.

 

  1. Provide affordable home relocation services for the senior population

We started our home relocation services in Hong Kong, which is a city facing a limited land supply and high rental cost. We observed that there are home relocation needs for elderly from low-income group, who often need to move from one place to another, such as from one temporary elderly center to another, before they have a chance to settle for a place in public housing estates/public subsidized elderly home. Right now, we are providing affordable logistic and escort services, such as arranging moving dates, transportation and any needs for temporary storage (http://veg.com.hk/en/home-page-eng/ ).

 

  1. Encourage furniture recycling and renovation

Besides that, we aware that there are a lot of re-usable furniture being disposed during home relocation, especially from high-income families, due to the extra cost for the existing removal services. Therefore, we organized a free furniture removal services to collect second-handed furniture/accessories and donate to elderly homes after renovation. By now, we have collected over 100 pieces of furniture. Part of them have been refurnished/renovated and donated to elderly centers. However, we need more resources, such as tools to increase the recyclability of the collected furniture.

 

  1. Develop custom-made home accessible hardware

Safety features are vital when it comes to minimizing risks elderlies face at home. Whether it be modifications to the bathroom area or rails for steps and ramps for entry or exit, all of these features need to be planned, built, installed and tested to make sure they work properly. Currently, we are developing custom-made home accessible hardware, such as armrest/handrails, integrated with emergency-calling system/GPS, allowing the elderly to seek help from the police/parents immediately.

 

What we need

Our goal of $20,000 will help us expand our effort, here's how:

 

As a first step, we plan to move one step forward by providing an affordable, accessible home relocation service and installation services of the developed accessible accessories/hardware at their home to enhance their safety as well as their quality of lives.

 

The dollars we are raising through this campaign as well as through other fundraising, government grants and support from generous donors - goes directly to every elderly home and the development of accessible hardware allocated above. More importantly, a child, a person with a broken leg, a parent with a pram or an elderly person should have a barrier-free environment and an equal opportunity to adapt to fulfill the needs of all people equally. We hope to deliver this message to the world and encourage more people to join our campaign worldwide.

Perks

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, it would be much appreciated if you would spread the word about this campaign to people you know. We hope to expand the concept of community-care home relocation services to other part of the world, as every elderly should deserve a higher quality of life after devoting their life-long efforts and achievements to our community.
story_txt: Our missionIn the past, family-centered structures and low divorce rates encouraged tight family bonds and made the responsibility of elderly caring more straightforward than today. At present, the senior population (60-year-old or above) is growing rapidly and is projected to rise from 12% to 22% of the world’s population by 2050. At the same time, 80% of older people will be coming from low- and middle-income countries.These dramatic changes in the composition of the population will pose new challenges, such as the substantial potential for growth in the senior population with impaired mobility on the account of age. Therefore, it is important to enhance their accessibility experience, in terms of home-care or logistic supporting services. Our mission is to improve the existing supporting services, especially for those with disabilities or chronic conditions.The growing senior population should get choice of quality care they want and need. CareEasy provides affordable accessible aid to the elderly, disabled person and their caregivers. We comprise of experienced home relocation specialists, volunteers and academia. As one of the first contact points to the senior residents, we provide consultation service for installation of our proprietary accessible hardware at their home on request. In addition, we care about home safety. Our home relocation service targets to provide optimized furniture arrangement at home, for users’ safety sake. Our servicesPromote accessibility issues awarenessWe are aware that the current accessibility may not be sufficient to deal with the growing senior population. As such, we collaborate with schools and NGOs to organize activities, such as workshop training to design and make home-accessible hardware to support the daily living issues of the elderly. Provide affordable home relocation services for the senior populationWe started our home relocation services in Hong Kong, which is a city facing a limited land supply and high rental cost. story:
I am Susanna Lynn and I'm a Gospel singer - moved from Kentucky to Florida 8 years ago.  Recently I was led to write a prolife song in response to when I heard a speech supporting legislation for even later term abortions.  Through my tears as I wrote, out poured a powerful song called I AM ALIVE, which is both tragic and yet hopeful. 

I've had great support for the song, including it's debut presentation at the Florida state Sanctity of Life Conference in 2017.  It also made its radio air debut during Sanctity of Life week in January 2018. 

The next step to getting this powerful message out is to create an effective video to accompany the song.  The video will feature cutting edge ultrasound of preborn babies captured in 4D!  By promoting this video nationally, I have faith that it will allow people to see that we must speak up for these babies that don't have a voice yet...and that they have a right to life the same as we all do.

Your support will make the difference between people being able to just hear this song, and actually see videos of the precious preborn babies accompanying the music and lyrics. What a powerful impact!  I already have enormous support from directors of prolife organizations, who are waiting on the video...I just have to get it into their hands as we plan to get it around the nation - and eventually around the world!

I have already assembled a team that consists of 2 videographers, and an ultrasound technician, and we have parents who are eager to have the their preborn babies in this video.  

You will receive for your contribution, your choice of gifts listed in "SELECT A PERK."

Any funds contributed in excess of video production costs will go toward promoting the video nationwide to prolife centers, prolife organizations, and presenting it to legislative representatives.

If you can't help financially, here are a couple other ways to support this mission.  Share this campaign with your friends, on your Facebook, and Instagram.  And please, I ask you to pray, as this is a highly controversial topic and I expect to come up against intense opposition.  

Thank you for any support you can give.  

Blessings and Peace,

Susanna Lynn

For more information:

www.SusannaLynn.com

www.Facebook.com/Susanna.Lynn.9
