story:
For many, the holiday season is a constant reminder of how fortunate we are to be with friends and family. But for others, it is simply another occasion they miss because they have been wrongfully convicted and imprisoned. As you celebrate your fortune with friends and family this season, help others earn the same right by donating to our campaign. The Jeffrey Deskovic Foundation for Justice is fundraising to fight for release of the wrongfully imprisoned, reform the criminal justice system and reintegrate those who have been exonerated. We need your help.


WHAT WILL YOUR DONATION DO?

Your donation is 100 percent tax deductible and will go straight into the operating budget for our 501(c)(3) charity. 

WHO IS JEFFREY DESKOVIC?

Jeffrey Deskovic lost his freedom on January 18, 1991, when, as a seventeen year old, he was sentenced to fifteen years to life in prison for the brutal rape and murder of Angela Correa, his classmate at Peekskill High School. In fact, she was raped and murdered by a crack addict named Steven Cunningham. Police deceived Jeff and subjected him to nearly seven hours of uninterrupted interrogation without food, and without a lawyer or parent present. He falsely confessed after police threatened him and then promised that, if he confessed, he would not be arrested and could go home. He was only sixteen years old.

Prosecutors and the medical examiner knew DNA in Angela did not match Jeff. Yet, they concocted evidence to frame him. Jeff spent the next sixteen years in several maximum-security prisons throughout New York State. Meanwhile, Cunningham remained free, and three years after he murdered Angela, he murdered his girlfriend’s sister, a Peekskill schoolteacher named Patricia Morrison. Cunningham’s DNA was deposited into the FBI’s Combined DNA Index System (CoDIS) and matched the DNA in Angela. On March 16, 2007, Cunningham pled guilty to Angela’s rape and murder. At sentencing, Angela’s mother said Jeff was "blamed and sacrificed like a lamb,” and Patricia’s mother said had police not falsely accused Jeff, her daughter “would still be with us.” Had Cunningham gotten away with murder a second time, Jeff would still be in prison.

Jeff’s rape and murder charges were dismissed on November 2, 2006. The judge who freed Jeff admitted “the undeniable fact that nothing can be done in this courtroom here today to erase the pain and suffering endured by you and your loved ones over the past sixteen years.” Jeff was marched into prison at age seventeen and walked out at age thirty-three. His entire adolescence and formative years had been stolen from him. To this day, none of the police, prosecutors or medical examiners who engineered Jeff’s conviction ever have been disciplined or suffered any career setbacks as a result of their misdeeds.

After his release, Jeff earned a B.S. in Behavioral Science from Mercy College and his M.A. from John Jay College of Criminal Justice. In March 2012, he launched The Jeffrey Deskovic Foundation for Justice, and donated $1.5M from his compensation to get the Foundation off the ground.

Jeff has appeared in local and national media, and spoken at forums across the country. He has spoken at countless academic institutions, nonprofit organizations and community groups, testified before state legislatures, and lobbied high-level elected officials, and made presentations at police academies, judicial conferences, defense bars, and gatherings of prosecutors. He advocates for video recording all police interrogations, changing witness identification procedures, the creation of standardized evidence preservation systems, automatic discovery, an oversight committee for prosecutors, and limits on the devil’s bargain prosecutors make with jailhouse snitches and criminals for testimony against targeted defendants. Jeff is strongly opposed to the death penalty, advocates for its repeal, and fights against its reinstatement, lest the innocent be put to death.

THE FACES OF THOSE YOU WILL HELP

The Deskovic Foundation has worked tirelessly to help others who are in Jeff’s position. Here are a few of the men whose lives have been improved thanks to contributions to the Foundation.

William Lopez spent more than 23 years wrongly imprisoned. The Foundation, working in collaboration with Lopez’s pre-existing legal team of Richard Levitt and Yvonne Shivers, provided some critical investigative resources, turned up some additional evidence of innocence, as well as had a hand in securing testimony from a witness who had been deported to the Dominican Republic. In response, federal district judge Nicholas G. Garaufis set Mr. Lopez free in January of 2013. “The prosecution’s evidence was flimsy to begin with," he wrote, "and has since been reduced to rubble by facts arising after trial.”

The Foundation also helped Lopez reintegrate back into society. We provided short-term housing in a rent free apartment that the Foundation leases, and then transitioned him to his own apartment, gave him some emergency funding, and maintained regular contact with him. As an individual, Jeff also took William shopping for clothes, celebrated holidays and special occasions with him, frequently socialized with him, and introduced him to other exonerees and those empathetic to the cause. William Lopez died on September 20 of this year, causing heartbreak for many at the Foundation.

Eric Glisson is another recent man we worked with after he wrongfully served 18 years in prison. The Foundation does not limit it’s reintegrative assistance to only those which it exonerates – services are open to all exonerees. One such example is Eric. Although the Foundation was not involved in exonerating Glisson, we did assist with his reintegration by providing him housing at the apartment that the Foundation leases, which enabled him to focus on completing a BA from Mercy College and then opening his own business, Fresh Take Juice Bar. The Foundation also assisted him with some emergency funding as well as a monthly metro card, while maintaining regular contact with him.

After serving 16 1/2 years, Lorenzo Johnson was released following a 3rd Circuit Court of Appeals ruling that there was legally insufficient evidence for his conviction. After 4 short months of freedom, in which the Foundation helped him reintegrate back into society by assisting him with finding a job and providing some emergency funding, Jeff had to painfully drive Lorenzo back to prison to resume a sentence of life without parole for a crime he is innocent of when the US Supreme Court decided to reinstate his conviction. The Foundation has since joined Lorenzo's legal team to help exonerate him.  We have additionally provided some investigative assistance and worked on bring media attention to this case.  New evidence, previously undisclosed to the defense, has been found, including the fact that the sole witness against Lorenzo was an alternative suspect and that she had in fact had a personal relationship with one of the main police officers. http://www.freelorenzojohnson.org/


ABOUT THE JEFFREY DESKOVIC FOUNDATION FOR JUSTICE

The Jeffrey Deskovic Foundation for Justice is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to freeing the wrongfully imprisoned. The Foundation employs a trained staff of attorneys and seasoned investigators, and links exonerees to a support network to assist with their reentry into society. The Foundation’s mission are exoneration, education through public awareness and policy reform, and exoneree reintegration.

story:
Rebuilding Lives After a Devastating Earthquake

As many of you are likely aware, southwest Haiti experienced another devastating 7.2 magnitude earthquake on Saturday, August 14th. While the devastation wrought by this earthquake was thankfully smaller than that of the 2010 earthquake, due to the epicenter location, the impact was felt by hundreds of thousands of people.

The August 14th earthquake had its epicenter near the city of Les Cayes, one of the largest cities in the country with a population of over 70,000 people. In addition, the earthquake affected those in the mountains above Les Cayes, including the hamlets of Duchity and Lakadonie, where I have spent considerable time.

Sadly, due to the inept and deteriorating building style and infrastructure, an earthquake has an outsized impact in a developing country like Haiti. The destruction includes homes and buildings, roads, power lines, and water and sewer pipes. And because of the current political instability and violence in Haiti, getting food, medical supplies, and resources to those in need has become almost impossible. People in these communities are trying to support one another, but they need additional help. This is where we come in.

My hope is to raise money to send DIRECTLY to people in need. The money will help people pay for food, medical supplies, clothing, and importantly, rebuilding their homes. These are people that I know personally, dozens of them. Many are dealing with the trauma of losing their homes and everything they have, including loved ones, while also having to deal with the challenges of continuing to survive without food, clean water, or shelter.

This campaign will be short because I want to get the money to them as quickly as possible. The campaign will open Thursday, August 26th and close at 11:59pm on Wednesday, September 1st. On that day I will send the money via Western Union to several Haitians in these communities, who will use it for food and water, clothing, and home rebuilding for themselves, their families, their neighbors, and their community.

Disaster relief is a complicated subject, and many have heard horror stories about money going to big organizations based in other countries where the money gets spent on staff and contractors, rather than going to the people in need. This campaign is different. I am not working with any charity or organization, the money will be sent directly to the people in need. These are community members and community leaders in the small hamlets, who will be able to spend the money directly helping themselves and those around them. They need support and many of us have financial support to give.

Thank you all very much! This is something that is very personal to me; and whether you give money or not, please keep the Haitian people in your thoughts (and prayers if you're religious) while they deal with this crisis.  If we can help the lives of some, then they can help the lives of others, and the cycle of support keeps spinning.

“I want to look happily forward. I want to be optimistic. I want to have a dream. I want to live in jubilee. I want my daughters to feel that they have the power to at least try to change things, even in a world that resists change with more strength than they have. I want to tell them they can overcome everything, if the are courageous, resilient and brave. Paradoxically, I also want to tell them their crowns have already been bought and paid for and that all they have to do is put them on their heads. But the world keeps tripping me up. My certainty keeps flailing.”
~ Edwidge Danticat, Haitian author, from "The Fire This Time: A New Generation Speaks About Race"

story:
What's the shpiel?

We at Hillary Claus have plenty of wishes for 2018: equal pay, intersectional feminism, and a return to some kind of respectful discourse. While Santa is definitely a true ally, we just don't feel like sitting on a cis white man's lap and asking for real progressive change is exactly in line with the future we want.

There's only one icon in a red suit who can truly understand where we're coming from and where we're going. We've put together the Hillary Claus Pop-up Holiday Booth, where New Yorkers can come, sit on Hil's lap, and share your wishes big and small. Sure, you could write her a letter and ask for the strength to continue to fight for a better, more inclusive 2018. Or, you could join us at the Union Square Holiday Market in December to get a selfie with a true symbol of giving.

Hillary Claus 2017 is pristine city streets after the first snow. A cozy pair of socks cuddling your weary feet. A walk through the Chappaqua forest we all need at the end of an exhausting year.

    What actually is it?

    Great question! It's a Hillary Clinton impersonator dressed as Santa, ready for you to take your picture with her and tell her what you wish for this holiday season and in to 2018.

    • It's been a rough year for just about all of us. People were never designed to process as much tragedy as we are taking in between our 24-hour news cycles and the miracle of social media. We wanted to carve out a tiny space in this city for people to feel the spirit of the holiday season as we push through the exhaustion of resistance.
    • For 2 days in December, Hillary Claus will pose for pictures (no photographer provided, bring those cell phones!) and listen to your holiday wish list for a suggested donation of $5. All proceeds from the Hillary Claus Holiday Pop-Up Booth will be donated to Planned Parenthood Federation of America and the Hispanic Federation's UNIDOS Disaster Relief and Recovery Program for Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico.

    Here's exactly how we're spending the crowdfunds:

    We have backgrounds in producing events, low-budget theater, and comedy shows. While we know we could throw a wig and a pants suit on a person and make this whole thing happen for less than $3500, we want to do it right. If I'm going to cry on Hillary's knowing shoulder because only in her lap do I feel truly seen, I want that memory to feel more rich and considered than posing with short Batman in Times Square. And hey, while we're at it, let's go ahead and make it a paid gig for some people who are in the city around the holidays. We are still approaching sponsors and independent in-kind donations to help alleviate these line items. If we are able to bring the project in for less, we will donate the difference to our two causes (Planned Parenthood and UNIDOS). Incidentally, the performing and design team we are bringing on for this project identify entirely as women or non-binary.

    Talent Fee - $1,400
    Meals for Talent/Crew - $150
    Costumes (HC/Elves) - $500
    Elf 1 - $120
    Elf 2 - $120
    Security - $360
    Set - $150
    Storage - $200
    Transportation - $200
    Stanchions - $80
    Crowdsourcing Rewards Shipping - $100
    Contingency budget - $120

    • If we don't reach our goal, we won't produce the event, and whatever money we have raised will go directly to Planned Parenthood/UNIDOS.

    "I'm broke, but this sounds cool!"

    We know how many crowdfunding projects you get hit with, so if you can't donate, it would be great if you could do any of the following things:

    • Tell your friends! Use the hashtag #hillaryclaus and come and visit us at the Holiday Market!
    • Share this campaign with anyone you know who is With Her!
    • Volunteer! If you've got house management or crowd wrangling experience, we could use your assistance!
    • If you've got a skill or craft you're able to donate that we could pass along to our donors as a perk for our Indiegogo, let us know!
    • Want to help us lug stuff to and from Union Square to help us save on transportation?

    Can you leave us with a seasonally appropriate poem about the event?

    Can I?!

    T’was weeks before Christmas, when through the Union Square Holiday Market
    All the liberals were on-the-go, hustling, fighting the patriarchate.
    Remembering last November, recalling #imwithher with care,
    What would they do if Hillary Claus were seen there?
     
    Is that Hillz sitting there dressed in a red suit, from the top of smart head down to her foot?
    In Santa clothes with fur trim, a black belt, laughing with a hoot?
    How big is the bundle of strong ideals she still carried on her back-
    I can hear her now! Sounding-off like a leader, a leader of the DNC pack.
     
    Her eyes- how they twinkle! To sit on Hillary Claus’ lap- what a whirl!
    And then there are the poignant words said to all little girls:
    “never doubt that you are valuable and powerful and deserving!”
    The election left us with wants and needs for self-preserving!
     
    So come spring to her side, to give your life some sizzle,
    And tell her what you want for your life, before your dreams fizzle.
    Hear her exclaim, before she disappears out of sight,
    “Merry Christmas, I love you, please keep up the fight!”
story_txt:
What's the shpiel?
We at Hillary Claus have plenty of wishes for 2018: equal pay, intersectional feminism, and a return to some kind of respectful discourse. While Santa is definitely a true ally, we just don't feel like sitting on a cis white man's lap and asking for real progressive change is exactly in line with the future we want.There's only one icon in a red suit who can truly understand where we're coming from and where we're going. We've put together the Hillary Claus Pop-up Holiday Booth, where New Yorkers can come, sit on Hil's lap, and share your wishes big and small. Sure, you could write her a letter and ask for the strength to continue to fight for a better, more inclusive 2018. Or, you could join us at the Union Square Holiday Market in December to get a selfie with a true symbol of giving.Hillary Claus 2017 is pristine city streets after the first snow. A cozy pair of socks cuddling your weary feet. A walk through the Chappaqua forest we all need at the end of an exhausting year.

What actually is it?
Great question! It's a Hillary Clinton impersonator dressed as Santa, ready for you to take your picture with her and tell her what you wish for this holiday season and in to 2018.

It's been a rough year for just about all of us. People were never designed to process as much tragedy as we are taking in between our 24-hour news cycles and the miracle of social media. We wanted to carve out a tiny space in this city for people to feel the spirit of the holiday season as we push through the exhaustion of resistance.
For 2 days in December, Hillary Claus will pose for pictures (no photographer provided, bring those cell phones!) and listen to your holiday wish list for a suggested donation of $5. All proceeds from the Hillary Claus Holiday Pop-Up Booth will be donated to Planned Parenthood Federation of America and the Hispanic Federation's UNIDOS Disaster Relief and Recovery Program for Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico.


Here's exactly how we're spending the crowdfunds:
We have backgrounds in producing events, low-budget theater, and comedy shows. While we know we could throw a wig and a pants suit on a person and make this whole thing happen for less than $3500, we want to do it right. If I'm going to cry on Hillary's knowing shoulder because only in her lap do I feel truly seen, I want that memory to feel more rich and considered than posing with short Batman in Times Square. Sounding-off like a leader, a leader of the DNC pack. Her eyes- how they twinkle! To sit on Hillary Claus’ lap- what a whirl!And then there are the poignant words said to all little girls:“never doubt that you are valuable and powerful and deserving!”The election left us with wants and needs for self-preserving! So come spring to her side, to give your life some sizzle,And tell her what you want for your life, before your dreams fizzle.Hear her exclaim, before she disappears out of sight,“Merry Christmas, I love you, please keep up the fight!”

story:
Affordable, community-driven bail

Better Bail For America is a community-focused crowdfunding platform for money bail. We serve the thousands of Americans who are denied the presumption of innocence simply because they cannot afford their bail. We leverage community support to grant pretrial release so defendants don’t have to rely on predatory bail bonds.

Affordable. Our bail financing is the most affordable option, with no hidden costs or fees. 

Community-Oriented. The more community support gathered, the more we contribute. Plus, all pledges are returned when the defendant appears in court.

Fair. We work hard to ensure our technology is accessible and free of any harmful biases. 

Why support a bail startup?

The bail system in the United States criminalizes poverty and unjustly separates defendants into two groups: those who can afford bail, and those who can't. Defendants who aren't able to pay their bail are often forced to make an impossible decision. They must either wait in jail for months, leaving their families and possibly losing their job in the process; or plead guilty to a crime for which they may be innocent. 

The problem is widespread. Of the over half a million people incarcerated in local jails nationwide, more than 75% are in jail awaiting trial. Many of these people are not dangerous but remain behind bars simply because they cannot afford bail. 

How does our platform work?

  1. After an arrest, a friend or family member can fill out a simple online form and we'll host a bail page for the defendant. The bail page is shared and pledges of support are rallied from the community. 
  2. With enough backers, we fund the remaining portion of the bail and post it to the courts. At this point, the defendant is free to await trial at home instead of behind bars.
  3. In the weeks leading up to the trial, we proactively remind the defendant of the upcoming court date and help clarify complex legal jargon. 
  4. When the defendant appears, the bail is returned to our fund and we return any monetary pledges to the backers.

We need your help

We hope to serve our first customers this summer, but we need your help to get there… donations  to this campaign will go towards paying bail. What’s more, when these bail payments are returned by the courts, we recirculate the funds into new cases meaning that your donation will go far beyond helping just one person.

Donor Perks

As a thank you for your support, we're excited to share Better Bail For America t-shirts and other branded perks with you!

story:
Tornado Damage at Sex trafficking Shelter

Hello,

I am Beth Nielsen, founder and President of Lotus Circle International, a U.S. based nonprofit that aids disempowered, traumatized and underserved individuals and communities by providing education, treatment, and integrative healing tools for stabilization and empowerment.

I am writing to ask for your donations to help the Purnarnawa Ashram Sex Trafficking Recovery shelter for young girls and women, recover from the devastation of a toronado which effected them on  April 22, 2015 and caused significant property damage.This shelter is located in Bihar, India, one of the poorest states in india. Please. They need our help NOW to immediately begin the repairs!

The cyclonic gale which devastated portions of east Bihar left 120 people dead and many injured. Fortunately none of the shelter residents or staff were harmed but the property damage was significant and included some buildings and a large scale security wall which surrounded the perimeter of the 5 acre property. 

The young female residents (ages 5-28),  all suffer from post traumatic stress due to years of exploitation and abuse in the sex trafficking industry, are very anxious about their home being damaged and their security potentially being at risk. 

The country coordinator for the ashram, Supriya  Awasthi, wrote to tell me that the security of the girls is compromised due to the damaged wall and they are immediately sending more staff to gaurd the establishment. It is important we get these repairs done asap to repair this large wall and your donations will make this possible!

More about the shelter

 The shelter offers residents, who stay for approximately 12 months, a comprehensive recovery program that includes shelter, legal assistance, medical care, emotional and psychological recovery, education, vocational skills training and help in accessing economic entitlements. Women are also encouraged and supported to participate in advocacy on behalf of themselves and other trafficking survivors. 

The shelter focuses strongly on the promotion of economic independence, an understanding of human and civil rights, and an atmosphere of shared work and equality. 

As many of you may recall, I visited this shelter in September 2015 to provide trauma training and treatment for post traumatic stress to the staff and survivors. I plan to return there again in 2016 to provide further clinical support. 

Please help Lotus Circle International raise $10,000. to help repair the tornado damage! 


HOW FUNDS WILL BE USED

Monies raised will be used to cover expenses for repair of the Purnarnawa shelter and property which resulted from a tornado on April 15, 2015. Any additional monies raised beyond the cost of the repairs will go to support the upcoming Lotus Circle International project benefiting the Purnarnawa Ashram Shelter, which will focus on providing further clinical training and support in 2016 to the residents and staff.

You can also help us spread the word about this fundraiser by using the Indiegogo sharing tools! Please help restore the comfort and safety of home to the girls and women recovering at the shelter.  Your donations will make a big difference in their lives.

In peace,

Beth Nielsen, MFT


Beth Nielsen is a Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist, Somatic Experiencing Practitioner, and founder of Lotus Circle International (LCI), a U.S. based nonprofit whose mission is to assist underserved populations affected by violence, disasters, and adversity by providing somatically based (mind-body) training and treatment for trauma resolution.  Beth maintains a private practice in San Francisco, CA and has been a Senior Assistant and Consultant with the Somatic Experiencing Trauma Institute  (www.traumahealing.com)  for 13 years. She has helped train hundreds of therapists in Somatic Experiencing, a psycho-physiologically based method of healing trauma. Her passion for this work lead her into the field of Global Mental Health and in 2005, she helped organize a four-year post Tsunami trauma recovery project in Tamil Nadu with Sr. Somatic Experiencing faculty and Trauma Vidya founder, Raja Selvam (www.TraumaVidya.org). In 2009 she founded LCI, and initiated a Women’s Empowerment Project in collaboration with Auroville Village Action Group (Tamil Nadu, India) aiding NGO staff and local village women affected by gender-based violence. In 2013 she assisted in another Trauma Vidya project in collaboration with Don Bosco, offering an Integral Trauma Resolution Training in Sri Lanka for counselors and other NGO staff with post war trauma. In 2014 she traveled to Bihar, India and provided clinical support and training to staff and residents at the Purnarnawa Ashram shelter for sex trafficking survivors.

She has also consulted on or participated in other trauma training and recovery projects in Kigali, Rwanda, and in Beijing, China.

To learn more about Beth and her work you may visit her website at www.lotuscircleinternational.org To reach her directly you may phone her at (415) 359-5597 or email her at Bethlotus@gmail.com

story:
Background

During September, people across south Wales donated much needed items to be sent to refugees in Europe. A 20ft container full of tents, sleeping bags, clothes and toiletries left west Wales for the Greek island of Kos on Friday October the 2nd and arrived at the charity Kos Kindness' premises on October the 28th. The donated items are currently being distributed to the thousands of refugees who are arriving on the island on a daily basis.  The container itself was also donated, as a lack of storage had been a major problem for them over the past few months. Thanks to the generosity of the people of Wales and beyond, we managed to raise the £4,500 needed to send the container to Kos.

What Next?

We now have another 20ft container filled and ready to be sent to help refugees who are in desperate need. We will be working with the UK Charity 'Syria Relief' this time, and their volunteers on the ground will distribute the items in camps in Syria itself and the surrounding countries. The container can only be sent with your support. We need to raise a further £2,500 within the next month. Please donate whatever you can. Every £1, £10, £100 will make a difference.

We will update you with pictures and more information here and on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/WalesSupportsRefugees

Many Thanks for your support.

-------------------------------------------------------

Y Cefndir

Yn ystod mis Medi, fe wnaeth pobl ar draws de Cymru gyfrannu nwyddau i'w hanfon at ffoaduriaid yn Ewrop. Fe wnaeth container 20 troedfedd llawn o bebyll, sachau cysgu, dillad a deunyddiau ymolchi adael gorllewin Cymru ar ei daith i ynys Kos ddydd Gwener, Hydref yr 2il a  chyrraedd yr elusen Kos Kindness ar Hydref y 28ain. Mae'r eitemau a roddwyd yn cael eu dosbarthu ar hyn o bryd i'r miloedd o ffoaduriaid sydd yn cyrraedd yr ynys yn ddyddiol. Diolch i haelioni pobl Cymru a thu hwnt, fe wnaethom ni lwyddo i godi y £4,500 a oedd angen i anfon y container i Kos.

Beth Nesaf?

Erbyn hyn mae gennym gontainer 20 troedfedd llawn arall yn barod i'w anfon i helpu ffoaduriaid sydd mewn angen dybryd. Byddwn yn gweithio gyda'r elusen 'Syria Relief' y tro hwn, a bydd eu gwirfoddolwyr ar lawr gwlad yn dosbarthu'r eitemau mewn gwersylloedd yn Syria ei hun a'r gwledydd cyfagos. Gallwn ni ond anfon y container yma gyda'ch cefnogaeth chi. Mae angen i ni godi £2,500 arall o fewn y mis nesaf. Bydd pob £1, £10, £100 yn gwneud gwahaniaeth.

Byddwn yn eich diweddaru gyda lluniau a mwy o wybodaeth yma ac ar ein tudalen Facebook https://www.facebook.com/WalesSupportsRefugees

Diolch yn fawr am eich cefnogaeth.

story:
WARRIORS 4 WARRIORS is a charitable foundation with one goal in mind, LEAVE NO ONE BEHIND!!!!
 
So many of our brave men and women serve this great nation and ask for nothing in
return, with the hope that if someday if they need a little help others would give back for their sacrifice. But too many times the help they need just isn’t there and they fall through the cracks that lead them down a road of depression and even thoughts of suicide. An average of one US Army solider kills themselvs a day. That was just the ones reported of active duty members. This did not include those men and women who came home and are no longer active in the military. I was shocked, to say the least, and deeply saddened at the thought of this. That is one suicide a day. I asked myself what we could do to help to stop this trend. How can we give these Mothers, Fathers, Brothers and Sisters the hope that they are not alone and that this nation isn’t going to forget about them now that the war is supposedly over? For most of the brave military members coming home, their hardest battle is just beginning. With the lack of jobs, their injuries and a list of other problems they will face in the years ahead, there is no better time for us, as a country,to step up and help make a difference.
Warriors 4 Warriors is committed to doing just that. We have a simple, but powerful mission.
Our mission is to serve those who have served this country,and are deserving of the gratitude of this grateful nation.
To lead the way in assistance and support to the servicemember and their family.
To assure them that they are not alone in the fight and tha twe stand ready to serve them.
LEAVE NO ONE BEHIND!!!!!! This line is part of almost every military creed in some form or another, but we most often refer to its meaning when in battle. Well, this is a battle, a battle to save lives. The number one reason for suicide is financial hardship, followed by family issues and a lackof support.

So join with us and be that voice in the dark that tells a serviceman or women they are not alone and will never be left behind.

With the lack of jobs, their injuries and a list of other problems they will face in the years ahead, there is no better time for us, as a country,to step up and help make a difference. Warriors 4 Warriors is committed to doing just that. We have a simple, but powerful mission. Our mission is to serve those who have served this country,and are deserving of the gratitude of this grateful nation. To lead the way in assistance and support to the servicemember and their family. To assure them that they are not alone in the fight and tha twe stand ready to serve them. LEAVE NO ONE BEHIND!!!!!! This line is part of almost every military creed in some form or another, but we most often refer to its meaning when in battle. Well, this is a battle, a battle to save lives. The number one reason for suicide is financial hardship, followed by family issues and a lackof support.
 So join with us and be that voice in the dark that tells a serviceman or women they are not alone and will never be left behind.

story:
Short Summary

We are Berni and Sarah. 

Sarah: "I grew up in Turkey and know the rough terrain the refugees are crossing, I know the cities they are arriving in. And I know that Turkey is not equipped -on its own- to help all the people in need. My family is still living in Turkey and the stories of destitution and living conditions grip me."

Berni: "When I heard about what was happening and saw the pictures I thought, 'That could be me and my family. Those could be my children.' I know people in my country with Syrian backgrounds. It felt personal to me."

We are two moms who felt compelled, by the love of God, to do something to help the refugees in Turkey. We are not professional videographers, or advertisers, or graphic designers but have seen crowdfunding accomplish a lot with a little so we made our own campaign.

(More Facts about the Syrian Refugee Crisis)

What We Need & What You Get

Moms For Moms is a campaign to raise at least $3,000 to purchase supplies for refugee families living in camps in Turkey. 

The group Conscience International will be receiving our campaign funds. We have been in contact with them and they are very excited about this independent campaign. Volunteers will then buy supplies and deliver them to refugees.

Specifically, the funds will purchase: sanitary pads, diapers, blankets, and socks.

Breakdown of costs:

  • One box of pads = $8*
  • One box of diapers = $15*
  • One wool (blend) blanket = $8*
  • One pair of socks = $1*

*These are the prices per item when bought in bulk.
The number of diapers/pads in the box will vary slightly based on the final brand we end up buying & based on best prices at the time of purchase.

Perks

Your donations are TAX DEDUCTIBLE! Funds that we raise will be sent directly to a non-profit. Read more here: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...?

AND...
Because we want the funds to go exclusively to refugees we chose to give out simple perks. We are running a Flexible Funding Campaign. This means that we receive donations even if we don't reach our goal of $3,000.

We've decided to give out perks a little differently. We will be "unlocking" perks as we reach certain milestone amounts. Once 'unlocked' any partner in the campaign will be able to get the new perk.

As perks we have created PRINTABLES of quotes from the Bible verse in Matthew 25:35-36 where Jesus is speaking and says, 


“ For I was hungry and you gave me food, I was thirsty and you gave me drink, I was a stranger and you welcomed me, I was naked and you clothed me, I was sick and you visited me, I was in prison and you came to me.’ Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry and feed you, or thirsty and give you drink? And when did we see you a stranger and welcome you, or naked and clothe you? And when did we see you sick or in prison and visit you?’And the King will answer them, ‘Truly, I say to you, as you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’"

You will have personal use rights. So feel free to make the deign into a t-shirt, bag, postcard, or canvas using your favorite online tools for personal use***. Or use it as a computer or phone background. SPREAD THE WORD!

We understand that not all of the campaign backers will be of the Christian faith. We are thankful for all donations because the goal here is to help all refugees, no matter what faith they adhere to. We thank you that you decided to join us in doing that. We really appreciate your support. 

The Impact

Your project will provide dignity, sanitation, and warmth to refugees who are currently living in very primitive squatter refugee camps.

  • Blankets can be used as a mat, a coat, a bag...so many possibilities.
  • Socks can also be used as gloves.
  • Sanitary pads allow women to continue to work and care for their families (read any literature on this - the impact is huge)
  • Diapers make a great difference in sanitation. Those of you who have children or babysit children know how often, especially newborns, need to be changed. Then imagine not having diapers. Enough said.

You will also be impacting the Turkish economy. They are bearing a huge burden with the influx of people. Your donation will provide a boost to locals because we will be buying local goods.

Risks & Challenges

-  One challenge will be informing you about what percentages of funds will go to each item we want to purchase (how many blankets/diapers/socks…will you be buying). The reason for this is that numbers in refugee camps fluctuate. We will know exact numbers once the funds are raised. Compassion International workers will, in real time, assess needs based on ages/genders/numbers in the camps and supplies will be purchased accordingly.

-  Why disposable diapers & pads instead of cloth/alternatives: In doing research we have found that cloth diapers are hard to wash and are not as helpful as disposable diapers. Water is not always available and when it is it is not usually appropriate to be washing waste in the same place you are getting your drinking water.

Other Ways You Can Help

Everyone can help: You can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. 

-  SHARE our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or your Blog!

-  Tell people at your workplace.

-  Call your local radio station.

-  Put up a flier.

-  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.


***(Personal use means non-commercial use of the Media for display on personal websites and computers, or making image prints or video copies for personal use. The Media may not be used in any way whatsoever in which you charge money, collect fees, or receive any form of remuneration. The Media may not be used in advertising. The Media may not be resold, relicensed, or sub-licensed.  Title and ownership, and all rights now and in the future, of and for the Media remain exclusively with the Content Provider.)

story:
For $50 you can Feed a Family of 6 for a Month

Most people in the rural community of San Ignacio, Mexico depended on tourism to make a living. They cleaned hotel rooms and vacation homes, built Airbnbs, cooked in restaurants and watered gardens. Now due to Covid19 all of the tourists have returned home and all non-essential businesses have closed. These families were living day to day before the pandemic. Now they are struggling to keep food on the table for their kids.

Casa Clu, a nonprofit community center for kids, is now providing food for the entire community. Three days a week the staff cook hot meals and 1 day a week hand out food baskets with 1 weeks worth of food for each family.

The goal is to provide food for the 100 families in San Ignacio for 2 months. For that we need about $10,000USD. 

Your contribution will make a great impact on the daily lives of these families. Please consider sponsoring a family.

Thank you for your compassion and generosity

$100 feed a family for 2 months

$50 feed a family for 1 month

$25 feed a family for 2 weeks

$12 feed a family for 1 week

 

En Español

 

                   Con $50 USD puedes alimentar a una familia de 6 personas por un mes

 

La mayoría de la gente en la comunidad rural de San Ignacio, México, depende del turismo para ganarse la vida. Limpian habitaciones de hotel,  casas habitacion y vacacionales, construyen Airbnbs, cocinan en restaurantes  y arreglan jardines. Ahora, debido a Covid19, todos los turistas han regresado a casa y todos los negocios no esenciales han cerrado. Estas familias vivían día a día antes de la pandemia. Ahora están luchando por mantener comida en la mesa para sus hijos.

 

Casa Clu, un centro comunitario sin fines de lucro para niños, ahora proporciona alimentos a toda la comunidad. Tres días a la semana, el personal cocina comidas calientes y 1 día a la semana reparte cestas de comida con 1 semana de comida para cada familia. El objetivo es proporcionar alimentos a las 100 familias en San Ignacio durante 2 meses. Para eso necesitamos alrededor de $ 10,000USD. Su contribución tendrá un gran impacto en la vida diaria de estas familias. Por favor considere patrocinar a una familia.

 

Gracias por su compasión y generosidad.

* $ 100 USD alimentan a una familia durante 2 meses

* $ 50 USD alimentan a una familia durante 1 mes

* $ 25 USD alimentan a una familia durante 2 semanas

* $ 12 USD alimentan a una familia durante 1 semana

story:
Our Story

The Small Warriors 4 Peace Summer Camp Scholarship Fund is for children whose mothers or fathers life was taken by the crime of domestic violence. Currently South Carolina ranks #2 in the Nation for homicide by intimate partner. There are many children that are left behind with no parents, one has been murdered the other incarcerated. Often times they are being raised by either a grandparent, relative or family friend. This year Think2xTwice.org has selected Quantrell Roberson age 6 and his younger sister Nevaeh Roberson age 5. Quantrell and Neveah's mother Kacy Roberson was murdered by her abusive boyfriend on January 18, 2011. At the time of her death she was 4 months pregnant. Quantrell and Neveah now live with thier grandmother Debbie Hyde. Our prayer is to funding for these children to attend summer day camp.

 

The Impact

Our scholarship fund will enable children who without it would not be able to attend summer camp. The children will be exposed to a fun filled day in a safe environment with caring adults. Each camper will enjoy a day of swimming, movies, dance, karate, sports, etc. They will also receive breakfast and lunch while in attendance.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The children currently live in Anderson SC, which is where they will attend a sumer camp selected by their grandmother. Each camp last a total of 10 weeks, however sponsors may dictate amount of sponsorship and number of weeks they are willing to sponsor. Cost of summer day camp varies $45-$90 per week, sponsors may donate for a child to attend one week of camp, or donate on a week-to-week basis. Campers will be selected based on availability of funds. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount as little as $5.00 is acceptable and would be a big help in sending a child to camp. Funds may be donated either by clicking on the donation link or by visiting any Wells Fargo Bank checks payable to Think2xTwice.org memo: Summer camp fund. You can also help us by sharing this campaign with your friends.

story:
**Holiday orders are in! All perks claimed from now on will be received in January.**

Be sure to click on a perk in order to claim it!

 

BACKGROUND

My name is Cheryl, and up until recently I grew vegetables for a living on a small farm outside of Boston. On a long day out in the field a few seasons ago the crew and I started rattling off vegetable celebrity puns. From Broccoli Obama to Rutabaga Ginsburg to George Squashington, we've been on a continuous crusade to turn all kinds of celebrities into vegetables. These characters initially made small appearances in our weekly news zine and gradually blossomed into a complete art show at our local ice cream shop.  Now, they're going portable in an effort to spread a bit of humor while honoring and supporting those who work towards a more just democracy.

Thanks to our AMAZING friends at Camden Printworks, these high-quality t-shirts and onesies will be pigmented in part by the vegetables they celebrate. A successful campaign here will allow me to purchase the initial inventory to launch a varied line of t-shirts and onesies, and will allow YOU to pre-order your shirts while contributing to the work of the Center for Constitutional Rights. Wear them, share them, and think of your own! Either way, thanks for considering.

T-SHIRTS

RUTABAGA GINSBURG serving justice (heather red)

ABRAHAM LEEKOLN serving freedom (burnt orange)

GEORGE SQUASHINGTON serving democracy (maize yellow)

BROCCOLI OBAMA hope stems eternal (heather green)

BEET SEEGER all over this land (heather blue)

CELERY CLINTON love chomps hate (heather cardinal)

TINA TURNIP love's got to do with it (heather brown)

 

ONESIES

story:
Refugees in Bulgaria

Since 2013, the number of people crossing Bulgaria's border to ask for asylum has increased five times. Both meeting their immediate survival needs, such as food and shelter, and guaranteeing their rights to fair procedure, have been a challenge. Obtaining refugee status is very difficult in Bulgaria, and the majority of people are turned down. Asylum seekers from some areas of the world stand little chance, regardless of what their stories tell: for example, in five years, none of the refugee claimants from countries like Rwanda, Tanzania, Pakistan, Nigeria or Mali have received refugee status in Bulgaria.  Others with very little likelihood of obtaining status are people from Iraq, Iran, Afghanistan, Armenia, Lebanon and Morocco, among many other countries in Africa and the Middle East. 

Why Status Matters

HOLDERS OF REFUGEE STATUS CAN: 

*Remain on the territory of Bulgaria

*Access healthcare, housing and social supports

*Access the labour market to support themselves and their families

*Participate in integration programs and take courses 

*Travel to meet family members elsewhere in the EU

PEOPLE WITHOUT STATUS:

*Are driven into poverty with no social support and no income

*Are frequently homeless or near-homeless 

*Are routinely arrested and detained for months 

*Experience grave physical and mental consequences

*Will be eventually deported to potentially unsafe countries

Our work 

We at the Center for Legal Aid "Voice in Bulgaria" believe that migrants have the right to have their stories heard and their claims assessed in a fair manner, which would lead to more humane and just outcomes.

We are a team of lawyers, legal experts, social workers and volunteers, who work on a pro bono basis at the center. 

We help by providing legal aid to asylum seekers in the form of: 

  • In-person consultations, where we help those still in the process of claiming asylum tell their stories in a clear and convincing way, and inform those who have been refused of their options for recourse
  • Preparing appeals, written defense statements and other documents for the courts and the respective administrative bodies
  • Providing court representation in appeals of refugee claim decisions 
  • Informing refugee claimants and other migrants about their legal rights and the process for obtaining status 
  • Advocating for legal and policy reforms to defend migrant rights in Bulgaria 

What your money does:

We need $7,000 to be able to continue to provide legal aid for free in the year 2015 to any migrant in Bulgaria who needs it, independently from government-related funding or influence, and to expand our capacity to meet the enormous need for free legal assistance. 

More specifically: 

- a single donation of $200 (a total of $2,400 for the year) will pay for our rent and bills for one entire month

- ten donations of $120 (a total of $1,200) will allow us to update our computer and printing equipment 

- ten donations of $60 (a total of $600) will pay for our supplies for the year

-  $10, $20, $40: we are currently able to meet only a small fraction of the need for legal counselling of refugees in Bulgaria; if we raise a further $2,800, we would be able to increase the number of people we serve by 50%, so after we meet the above needs, donations of any size will go towards achieving this goal.

Options to donate

You can make a quick and easy credit card donation by clicking on donation button above and following the instructions. Alternatively, if you prefer not to use a credit card, you can make a bank transfer to Center for Legal Aid - Voice in Bulgaria, DSK Bank Bulgaria, IBAN - BG94STSA93000019238542, BIC - STSABGSF. We can issue a donation certificate and receipt in either case. Please, contact us at voiceinbulgaria@gmail.com, if you have any questions or concerns. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, your could still help by spreading this message and thus raising awareness of the importance of supporting refugees and migrants. We value your support, whatever shape it may take. Thank you!

-  $10, $20, $40: we are currently able to meet only a small fraction of the need for legal counselling of refugees in Bulgaria; if we raise a further $2,800, we would be able to increase the number of people we serve by 50%, so after we meet the above needs, donations of any size will go towards achieving this goal.

Options to donate
You can make a quick and easy credit card donation by clicking on donation button above and following the instructions. Alternatively, if you prefer not to use a credit card, you can make a bank transfer to Center for Legal Aid - Voice in Bulgaria, DSK Bank Bulgaria, IBAN - BG94STSA93000019238542, BIC - STSABGSF. We can issue a donation certificate and receipt in either case. Please, contact us at voiceinbulgaria@gmail.com, if you have any questions or concerns. 


    Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to make a financial contribution, your could still help by spreading this message and thus raising awareness of the importance of supporting refugees and migrants. We value your support, whatever shape it may take. Thank you!

story:
I will be taking a trip to Haiti with the Missions team from Victory World Church (Norcross, GA) July 17-24th. We will be hand delivering and distributing food, clothing, and supplies. Construction work will also be done.

I am of Haitian descent and speak Creole fluently; I have a personal investment in this project. I believe that I will be an asset to the team because I can serve both as a relief worker and a translator. However, I can’t go unless I raise the funds! I need $1,200. It’s a challenge but not impossible with your help :).

story:
Recently, we (the two lady bosses over at Smartass & Sass) were talking about a few things. First of all—how inspired and joyful we feel about the Women's March messages and all the feels we felt, second—how many badass females we know, and third—how we feel we need to band together and stand up for things that are right, like gender equality.

We contacted artists with feminist and female-empowering products to see if they'd like to collaborate, and the answer was a resounding "F*CK YES!" And so the Feminist AF Box Campaign was born.

This campaign’s mission is to:

  • Support artists and small businesses
  • Donate money to nonprofits with feminist agendas (organizations will be nominated and chosen by artists and backers)
  • Join together and do something good as supporters of gender equality 

But before we get ahead of ourselves, let's make sure we're on the same page...

From Feminist Goddess Supreme (and UN Women Goodwill Ambassador) Emma Watson: "For the record, feminism by definition is: 'The belief that men and women should have equal rights and opportunities. It is the theory of the political, economic and social equality of the sexes.'"

 

 

  • You, your friends, your grandma, your barista—anyone who wants to support the cause and get cool shit—choose a reward level and back the campaign.
  • When the campaign ends, Smartass & Sass will purchase badass female-empowering products at wholesale pricing from all of the artists involved.
  • We will also send out a survey asking for artist and backer opinions on what organizations to donate to. 
  • Then Smartass & Sass and everyone involved with the campaign will send those organizations bags of money and virtual hugs for doing such wonderful things! Meanwhile...
  • Artists will produce all of the products and send them to us.
  • Smartass & Sass will package everyone's rewards, toss in some extra goodies, and ship them off to you, your friends, your grandma, and your barista.

 

  • Our campaign has flexible funding. That means that whether we surpass our goal by 8 trillion percent or only raise $100, THIS IS HAPPENING! All backers will receive rewards and we will donate to nonprofits whether we hit our goal or not. IT. IS. ON.
  • We already have OVER 30 amazing artists collaborating on the campaign, and more are joining every day. Hot damn!! (More info about artists is listed down below.)
  • All products will be related to feminism and female empowerment: we will be purchasing wholesale products from artists that fall under this wide umbrella. It's all about empowering messages and a whole lot of strong-lady vibes.
  • Depending on where this thing goes (and we're hoping it gets big!), boxes won't have the exact same stuff—we don't expect artists to produce 8 trillion Feminist AF tote bags if we get 8 trillion badass backers! You are guaranteed a certain dollar value for your box and we will work with all of the artists to determine quantities of product that can be provided in the given timeframe. TL;DR your box contents are a surprise!
  • Backers and artists will help decide which organization we should allocate funds to and how much. Everyone will have a say in where donations are allocated, and we'll be able to support more organizations and include smaller ones.
  • Below is a breakdown of where your dollars go. We have minimized fees to the bare minimum to ensure the biggest chunk of change possible to the chosen nonprofits:

 

After talking to artists, planning around life events, and leaving some wiggle room for any potential complications, we've outlined the following schedule:

  • Mid-February - March : The campaign is live!
  • April : We collect any sizing details and other info, along with donation votes.
  • April - May : Artists work hard to get all the goods made!
  • June: Products are sent to Smartass & Sass.
  • Mid-June : We package your goods and send 'em off into the sunset!

 

 

Check out some of the potential products that will be included in the Feminist AF Boxes and the lists of participating artists below! We'll continue to update the images and lists as more artists join. 

Are you an artist interested in participating? Email us at info@smartassandsass.com for more details!

A Shop of Things  |  Alohomora  |  Anna Joyce  |  Bang-up Betty  |  Bash  |  Bias and Bourbon  |  Boredwalk  |  Christy Robinson Designs  |  Could You Please  |  Cricket Lane Studio  |  Crimson and Clover Studio  |  Curated Gift Shop  |  Dark Pony Designs  |  Dear Ollie  |  Hennel Paper Co.  |  Honey and the Hive  |  it must be nice to be a bird  |  idreamoflettering  |  Jess Buhman Art  |  Katie Vaz Design  |  Mugg N Co  |  Paper Pony Co  |  Rockaway Gypsea  |  Sam's Simple Decor  |  Sassy Gals Wisdom  |  Simply Print  |  Snarky Cards  |  Subversive Housewife  |  Sweet Perversion  |  The Golden Type  |  WordCraft Studios  |  Wyoming Creative

 

Will I know what products I'm getting?
You won't—it's a surprise! What we will do is guarantee the value of your box. For example, if you choose a $50 reward level, you will receive $50 worth of awesome products. We will also make sure that each box has a good variety of types of items.

Can I buy multiple boxes? Will I get duplicate products?
You are amazing! If you buy multiple boxes we will ensure that you get different items. So whether you're gifting one or keeping it all, you'll get an awesome array of feminist shiz.

When will products ship?
Based on our schedule, products will ship in June of 2017. Check out the timeline above for more specifics.

Is shipping included?
In order to provide the maximum donation to feminist nonprofits, we have not included shipping fees in your backer price. Your shipping will be based on your location using pre-determined USPS charges.

Do you ship internationally?
We do! Shipping rates vary by region, and you'll be able to see your specific shipping fee during checkout.

How/When will we decide what feminist nonprofits receive our donations?
Within two weeks after the campaign ends, we will be sending out a survey with feminist nonprofits which are nominated by artists. All backers will get to vote for the nonprofit of their choice, and Smartass & Sass will split donations according to the percentage of votes. For example, if ten organizations get equal votes, each nonprofit will receive 10% of the funds raised.

What if the campaign doesn't reach its goal?
This is a flex campaign, so that means that whether we hit our goal or not we WILL be sending out rewards to participating backers and making donations. Not hitting our goal would be a bit of a bummer because we are really motivated to surpass that target, but we are even MORE motivated to make donations to organizations that matter.

We don't foresee many unplanned challenges for this campaign.

We have chosen flexible funding, which means even if we don't hit our goal, we will still provide rewards and donations after the campaign. 

We are in regular contact with the awesome artists who have chosen to collaborate on this project, and we have discussed production times and quantities with them prior to the campaign launch. We hope to continue adding artists as the campaign grows.

We have accounted for all possible fees—we ran a previous Indiegogo campaign, and we package and ship boxes for our gift and subscription service on a regular basis. 

Our biggest "concern" is that this campaign will blow up and will receive a ton of interest—talk about a great problem to have! Obviously, we'd love for that to happen :) We have created some contingency plans should we need more space and help when packaging rewards for shipment.

 

Can't contribute right now, but want to support the cause? Use the sharing tools at the top of the page to share on social media, send the link to your feminist friends, and get the word out! The more funding we raise the bigger the donation, and the better we're able to support the organizations doing important work to help women and fight for gender equality.

You can also follow us on any or all of the outlets below to keep up with what's going on.

 

       

 

Smartass & Sass was created by us—Kim and Abby. We've been friends for almost 25 years. We can quote every line in Wedding Crashers, and we frequently carry on conversations in song. We are silly weirdos and we love to laugh. 

We started Smartass & Sass because we adore snarky products and the vendors who create them. We wanted to cultivate a collection of hilarious stuff while also creating a platform for awesome artists and designers to share their goods in a unique way. Click the links below to learn more about our products.

 

Video music | "Riots" by Jahzzar (http://www.betterwithmusic.com)

story:
Donate to Gaza Now!

Our Mission is to support of Palestinians in their struggle. Palestine,Gaza refugees who do not have enough food to eat. When you donate, you help Palestine,Gaza refugees. Our goal is to feed as much refugees as we can. So donate for Gaza Palestine.
We need your help to make it happen.
You don't need to be Muslim to stand up for Gaza, you just need to be Human.

Children and adults alike are being massacred by heavy air strikes and a ground invasion in what is the worst outbreak of violence in Gaza since 2012.

As the death toll exceeds 1000 and the critically wounded thousands more, the number of casualties, refugees and fatalities are raising by the minute. The vast majority of those affected have been civilians, women and children. 

The hospitals are overwhelmed and fast running out of supplies. Adham Abu Salmia, Gaza's Ambulance and Emergency spokesman, has said the medical crisis is acute and near catastrophic.

The situation is truly dire as Palestinians have been fasting throughout Ramadan and the fighting has continued throughout Eid. They are extremely vulnerable to the escalating violence in the region and urgently need clean water, medicine and temporary shelter.

Please help us to help the people of Gaza,Palestine.

story:
Here are the facts :

There are more than 600 million women who call India their home.

  • A home where in every 22 minutes, one woman gets raped.
  • With More than 21,000 registered rape cases last year only one fourth of those accused were legally convicted.
  • Out of these 83% of the cases are still pending in courts.
  • Even if these 83% of the cases see the light of the court, 97% of the rapists will never spend a day in jail.
  • There was a 300% rise in crime against women in Delhi alone, in the last 12 months.

These facts barely scratch the surface of the brutal and shameful reality hidden beneath the political veil of the Indian society. With the varying constitutional structure of legislative distribution throughout the country, there is no symmetric and systematic system in place for protecting such crimes; neither is there any relevant step being taken against such crimes and helping the women who have actually been victims to such horrors! 

In order for us to answer this question, we would request you to see what these girls have to say about them feeling safe in New Delhi, India.

Courtesy: bluegape.com

The Delhi Gang-rape Case of 2012:

On December 16, 2012, a middle class girl, Nirbhaya, along with her male friend was returning home after watching The Life of Pi. They were tricked into boarding a bus that seemed to be going their way and that had offered them a ride.

Nirbhaya, was gang-raped with extreme brutality, and the man was severely beaten as he tried to protect her. It was a closed bus with tinted windows in which five determined rapists were waiting for their prey, with their impatience heightened; it is alleged, by the drugs they had taken.

The battered bodies of the abused pair were dropped off on a lonely street, and there were reports of people just passing by, without offering any help or assistance to the abused bodies of the poor victims. By the time Nirbhaya received medical attention, she was on her way to death from the injuries, despite specialized medical care in Delhi, and later on in Singapore.

What if Nirbhaya had the choice of getting the assistance that would have uprooted the need for her to look for a less secure, unsubstantiated mode of transport? What if there was a helpline number that she could call, that specialized in assisting women with registered and verified cab services?

LiBERATi is founded to be an active participant in the act of protecting women when they are in distress, we want to be the number that they can call and trust 24x7 for any desired need. We want to be an Institution solely established for purpose of assisting them. We want to Empower the Indian woman!

We have set up an organization that literally diminishes the chances of any Indian women having to face such brutality. By previously conducted surveys and focus groups by social service organizations and campaign runners, most of the crimes committed towards women are in isolated areas, at odd hours and most likely when these women are alone. Statistics tell us, there is a 76% chance that a woman could be harassed or molested by a person closest to her. That’s exactly why we need The LiBERATi. That’s exactly why we need to do what needs to be done. And that’s exactly why with your support, we are sure that we can make a difference.



Astitv Gulati (25) – Founder & Director

A Humanitarian, Visionary and an Achiever, Astitv graduated in 2012 with a Degree in Bachelors of Technology majoring in Electronics and Communication Engineering. After he completed College he worked with American Express, following which his desire to give something back to the people was soon brainstormed with the idea of Making India a safe haven for women. Born and raised in Delhi - The Capital, he has hands-on experience on the atmosphere in Delhi and his insight covers the gaping holes found in the system.


Snehil Tripathi (24) – Founder & Director

An upcoming PR Practitioner and a Social Worker, Snehil graduated in 2013 with a Degree in Communications majoring in PR and Journalism. After completing his Undergrad he worked with Waggener Edstrom Communications, where he himself went through the extensive coverage on the state of women security in India. Driven by his passion to make a difference, Snehil set on this journey to transform the way women work their way through daily nuances and hasn't stopped ever since. Born and raised in Mumbai - The Financial Capital of the Country, and a city known best for its practices in safegaurding women from such atrocities, he brings his ideas to the table.

Astitv Gulati and Snehil Tripathi founded an enterprise in May 2014, the sole purpose of which was to liberate women from the fear that they live in, by giving them an assistance that any world class help-line would provide. And that is how they coined the name 'LiBERATi'. A business for greater good of the women in India.


We are being honest. We can take this leap of faith based on nothing else but ‘faith’ in humanity! It is people like you, who if given the chance, we believe, will make a difference.

The best any humanitarian can get from this project is a clear conscience and a feeling of pride in being a part of protecting a woman's life.

But as a mark of gratitude, we are offering merchandise as perks and memoirs that would reflect your contribution in our fight!

And as added perks we are also offering limited sets of Indian Bangles and traditional Indian Sarees, both being a symbol of Indian feminism for contributions of $30 and $60 respectively!

Credits: Salil Wadhavkar and Pepe Pont


Presenting a world class 'help-line' for the women of Delhi (flagship city), India that makes the city safe for them. We want to establish a Call Center, which would be run by highly skilled employees that would be thoroughly trained to deal with distress calls! The following is a glimpse of what our Toll Free Help Line would have to offer : 

·  Cab Services

·  Legal Services

·  Security Services

·  Telephone-Wiki services

·   Healthcare Services

·  Credit Services

·  Technological Assistance

Following is the graphical representation of our cumulative plans till June 2015:


Following is a list of where the funds would be used almost immediately:

· Technology : Buying computers , accessories, intercoms, setting up toll free lines, software development and so on.

· Recruitment and Training : Hiring the one's who speak and understand the best. Extensive training for the employees so they are ready for everything and not scared themselves. Can think fast and act even faster. 

· Building Sustainable Partnerships : LiBERATi Certified Cabs, for example, will make sure you are travelling safe. We will need to partner with the best and the most effecient.

· Legalities : Setting up the organisation while meeting government norms and policies. For example, applying for licenses amongst other things.

· Administrative Setup : From property rental to furniture , to air conditioners. We want our employees to have the best , so that they can do their jobs most efficiently, without comprising on their duties. 

We want to make sure that the women in distress at the end of the day are safely back home; that's why we're investing in technology that would benefit the women at large.

We are a transparent organization with the power to touch the lives of the 600 million women. We can accomplish our vision of a safe country for women, and we wish to see you, see us achieve it!

For it is the regret of the things that we did that can be tampered by time, it is the regret of the things that we did not do, that is inconsolable!


                            | CONTRIBUTE NOW |

graduated in 2012 with a Degree in Bachelors of Technology majoring in
Electronics and Communication Engineering. After he completed College he worked
with American Express, following which his desire to give something back to the
people was soon brainstormed with the idea of Making India a safe haven for
women. Born and raised in Delhi - The Capital, he has hands-on experience on
the atmosphere in Delhi and his insight covers the gaping holes found in the
system.


Snehil
Tripathi (24) – Founder & Director
An upcoming PR Practitioner and
a Social Worker, Snehil graduated in 2013 with a Degree in Communications
majoring in PR and Journalism. After completing his Undergrad he worked with
Waggener Edstrom Communications, where he himself went through the extensive
coverage on the state of women security in India. Driven by his passion to make
a difference, Snehil set on this journey to transform the way women work their
way through daily nuances and hasn't stopped ever since. Born and raised in
Mumbai - The Financial Capital of the Country, and a city known best for its
practices in safegaurding women from such atrocities, he brings his ideas to
the table.

Astitv Gulati and Snehil
Tripathi founded an enterprise in May 2014, the sole purpose of which was to
liberate women from the fear that they live in, by giving them an assistance that any world class help-line would provide. And that is how they coined the name 'LiBERATi'. A business for
greater good of the women in India.




We are being honest. We can take this leap of faith based on nothing else but ‘faith’ in humanity! It is people like you, who if given the chance, we believe, will make a difference.
The best any humanitarian can get from this project is a clear conscience and a feeling of pride in being a part of protecting a woman's life.
But as a mark of gratitude, we are offering merchandise as perks and memoirs that would reflect your contribution in our fight!


And as added perks we are also offering limited sets of Indian Bangles and traditional Indian Sarees, both being a symbol of Indian feminism for contributions of $30 and $60 respectively!


Credits: Salil Wadhavkar and Pepe Pont



Presenting a world class 'help-line' for the women of Delhi (flagship city), India that makes the city safe for them. We want to establish a Call Center, which would be run by highly skilled employees that would be thoroughly trained to deal with distress calls! The following is a glimpse of what our Toll Free Help Line would have to offer : 
·  Cab Services
·  Legal Services
·  Security Services
·  Telephone-Wiki services
·  
Healthcare
Services
·  Credit Services
·  Technological Assistance
Following is the graphical representation of our cumulative plans till June 2015:


Following is a list of where the funds would be used almost immediately:

· Technology : Buying computers , accessories, intercoms, setting up toll free lines, software development and so on.· Recruitment and Training : Hiring the one's who speak and understand the best. Extensive training for the employees so they are ready for everything and not scared themselves. Can think fast and act even faster. · Building Sustainable Partnerships : LiBERATi Certified Cabs, for example, will make sure you are travelling safe. We will need to partner with the best and the most effecient.· Legalities : Setting up the organisation while meeting government norms and policies. For example, applying for licenses amongst other things.· Administrative Setup : From property rental to furniture , to air conditioners. We want our employees to have the best , so that they can do their jobs most efficiently, without comprising on their duties. We want to make sure that the women in
distress at the end of the day are safely back home; that's why we're investing in technology that would
benefit the women at large.
We are a transparent organization with the power to touch the lives of the 600 million women. We can accomplish our vision of a safe country for women, and we wish to see you, see us achieve it!
For it is the regret of the things that
we did that can be tampered by time, it is the regret of the things that we did not
do, that is inconsolable! 






                            | CONTRIBUTE NOW |

story:
On August 29th 2020. We will be having a End of the Summer Unity Rally to build on the local movement we have created and progress our communities of Benton Harbor and St. Joseph further towards unity. We chose this date to honor the 57th anniversary of Martin Luther King’s ‘I Have A Dream Speech’.

"I Have a Dream" is a public speech that was delivered by American civil rights activist Martin Luther King Jr. during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom on August 28, 1963, in which he called for civil and economic rights and an end to racism in the United States.

We need your help!!! We must raise $1500 to secure a stage, pa, permits along with other items for the event.

We have reached out to local businesses for donations. But now we’re putting in the people hands. We hope you will join us in creating one 269. #BHSJUnited

.

story:
Abraham Lincoln National Cemetery Monument to LGBT Veterans


American Veteran for Equal Rights (AVER) is a non-profit, chapter-based association of active, reserve and veteran service member dedicated to full and equal rights and equitable treatment for all present and former members of the U.S. Armed Forces.
In 2011, members of AVER Chicago Chapter decided that it was time for a Monument dedicated solely to honor the Service of LGBT veterans to be built and placed in a National Veterans Cemetery. Over the last 3 years AVER member Stan Jenczyk worked tirelessly to bring it to reality.  Now, it's time to build it! 
By your contributions big or small you are helping us reach our goal of $20,000 and creating a granite and bronze permanent structure of 4w x 4h x 1d to honor the service of LGBT veterans alongside all veterans.
If you would like for your donation that you have made through here to be tax deductable please contact us directly so we can be sure to provide you with needed forms.
We would like to say a special thank to Tod Tatsui  who brought the monument to "life" with the colored image you see here.
Thank you from all the members of AVER Chicago Chapter. 
Be sure to save the date of May 25, 2015 @ 2pm at Abraham Lincoln National Cemetery in Elwood, IL for the dedication. 
Lee Reinhart
President - AVER Chicago Chapter 
P.O. Box 29317
Chicago, IL  60629

story:
Short Summary

The UK government is pressuring the major ISPs to enable on by default filtering, and the countries major ISP - BT - who most other networks piggyback upon already has agreed to this.

The filter is originally just to block pornography, supposedly to protect children. However history has shown that it is never just the one thing. Before even having full support with all the major ISPs David Cameron has announced plans to extend this to cover what he calls 'extremist' sites.

I want to raise awareness of what he is trying to do to the internet using social media and - if funding allows - traditional forms of advertising.

The Impact

The big issue with filters - as already mentioned - is that pornography is just the beginning. 

When David Cameron says extremist sites he is intentionally leaving it incredibly open to interpretation and will undoubtedly have some very creative interpretations of that. It will start off with terrorist boards and sites - but why would it make a difference. They will just use Tor. Then it will be bent to cover political parties such as 'The Pirate Party' where it will cause serious damage.

Some sites may end up being on the compulsory block lists along with sites like the Pirate Bay, which since being blocked just over a year ago has been joined by countless other sites (see here). Some sites had been added supposedly by accident, such as several wordpress blogs.

What he is doing is getting us used to censorship, if he were to block half of the internet today there would be protests. If he blocks just a few sites, its allowed. They can then slowly ramp up the level of censorship until it gets to god knows what level. 

We need to act now, and kill censorship before it takes off - we can not just lie down and leave the internet in the hands of those that do not understand it.

What We Need & What You Get

All funding shall be used for spreading our message, here are some of the basic costs

  • Video production - we aim to have a professional 30 minute video going in-depth as to why this is wrong
  • Advertising - we shall be using a wide variety of services to  spread the message, a large amount will be done using Facebook to promote our posts.
I shall be giving out some small perks for supporting the cause, however these will not be very big - why waste money on them when it should be going towards what really matters. All designs shall be made by my friend RazeInk who is a professional graphic designer, who will do it free of charge.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people will not be able to donate, so please can you help by doing the following:

  • Share this through any means you have, and tell your friends about the measures being taken
  • Sign the petition here! (pending approval)
  • Like our page!

We cannot allow the Government to have totalitarian control over the internet - the internet is meant to be completely free and open
